1.content:
Provider Definition

A childcare Provider is any individual or group who obtained a license or registered through the state/State Helpdesk to provide care to children. The license number is associated with any Provider contracted with their State Helpdesk/Texas Workforce Commission (TWC). These licenses may be issued by State Helpdesk/state workers for the separate State Helpdesks of Texas.

Note: Locations are associated with different State Helpdesks/Regions of Texas, just like county workers for other states. Providers' main contact is with the State Helpdesk workers.

Searching for a Provider

  1. Select the Providers activity from the Navigation Bar, 
  2. Click on Search.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria into the available fields. Note: The more criteria you enter, the more specific your search results will be.
    • If available, start by asking for the License Number.
    • If the provider License Number is unavailable, you can also ask for Provider's Name. Do not give this information to the callers. Refer to the state helpdesk for further assistance. Note: Entering just the first letter will result in a list of all Providers whose names start with that letter.
    • If needed, you can narrow down the search results by selecting the Provider Type and the Status of this provider, whether active or inactive.
  4. Press Search.

To select the correct option, verify if there is an Operator registered in KinderConnect

  • If there are no registered operators, select the New Provider option.
  • If there are registered operators, select the Registered Provider option. 

Multiple Locations

Note: It is possible for a Provider license number to pull up multiple accounts with the same license across different regions.

Providers listed in multiple regions may need to select a different location to be able to view specific children.

Last Update On: 07/21/2023
1.question: Is the caller a new provider or a registered provider?

2.button_text: Refer to State Helpdesk for policy questions or non-system related issues

2.content:
Operator Definition

An Operator is a provider owner/employee with access to KinderConnect.

  • Each staff member at a provider's facility can be added as an Operator in KinderConnect. 
  • All users who have access to KinderConnect should have an Operator account created. 
  • Two Operator types for Providers:
    • Provider Administrator - Full access
    • Provider User - Limited access

Searching for an Operator

  1. Select the Operator option from the navigation bar.
  2. Click Search from the drop-down menu.
  3. Before any new search, make sure to press the Clear button to remove previously entered criteria.
  4. Enter the appropriate search criteria into the available fields. 
    • NOTE: The more criteria you add, the more specific your search results will be.
    • If available, start by asking for the Operator's First/Last Name or Phone Number.
  5. Press the Search button.

Search Techniques: Use the operator's "First Name" and/or "Last Name" as the search criteria. You can also use their license number by clicking Select >> and then entering the License number to run an open search of all operators in that location. 


Last Update On: 12/07/2023
2.question: Select the topic that best describes the provider's issue or question.

3.content:
Occasionally, a Provider might make a mistake while logging into KinderConnect. If a password is entered incorrectly 3 times the account will show as “Locked” and not allow the user to log in again.

Locked Account Policy

Support staff must speak to the Operator who is locked out. Support can say: “Our security policy is such that we must speak to the person who is locked out.” 

  • The Operator must answer the secret question.
  • We cannot unlock an operator account in response to a chat or Email.

There are three ways to unlock an operator account:

  • Operator contacts the KinderSystems Support Center.
  • Operator self-unlocks their account.
  • Provider Administrator can unlock any other Operator account.

Last Update On 04/26/2023
3.question: Which method is the operator going to use to unlock the account?

4.content:
Note: Support Agents must speak with the account owner (support should always ask for the caller's name). Do not assist if a request was made by chat or e-mail according to the security policy.

Support Agents cannot give any clues or hints to the Provider regarding what their secret answer is. 

However, below are some exceptions where Support Agents may help:

  • Incorrect spelling
    • Support agents should verify the correct spelling. If the answer is missing a letter or some letters are switched, the Support agent may update the secret answer on file. The tablet needs to be refreshed before the Provider attempts to sign in again. 
    • Example 1: The answer on the system is mike, but the Provider enters Mike. The support agent can correct this answer.
    • Example 2: The answer on the system is Smth, but the Provider enters Smith. The support agent can correct this answer.
  • Hidden spaces
    • Support agents must inform the Provider that there is extra space. The Support agent should get their permission before removing extra spaces.
  • Having a full name (first and last name) instead of just part of the name
    • If a Provider enters/provides a part of the secret answer, Support agents will need to obtain the full answer. They can tell the caller that the answer is incomplete.
    • Example: Provider says/enters Jane, but it shows Jane Doe in the system
  • Having part of the name (first and last name) instead of the full name
    • If a Provider enters/provides an extra name or word, Support agents can accept the answer but must inform the Sponsor of what’s in the system.
    • Example: The provider says Jane Doe, but it shows Jane in the system.
  • If you are unsure of the next actions, please contact your manager. 

If a Provider completely forgets the secret answer, Support agents will proceed with the Additional Verification.

Additional Verification

Operators of the program might forget the answer to their secret questions. Support can assist the operator if they can provide additional information to verify their identity:

  • First and Last Name
  • Provider Number/License Number
  • Email Address

To verify the information, perform a Provider search in KinderConnect:

Click on Provider and select Search to perform a Provider search.
Search for the Provider using the Provider # or License # field and press Search.

In the Search Results, support can find (Operator's First and Last Name, and Provider Number/License Number) that are needed for verification.


To check the Operator's email address, click on the Operator Name to go directly to the Operator Detail page.

On the Operator Detail page, the Support agent can verify the operator's email address.

When the Operator is Verified:

  • Support should ask the Operator if they would like to update the secret question.
    • Support can provide the current secret answer if the Operator asks for it.
    • If you are changing a secret answer, make sure you confirm the spelling with the caller.
    • Support can only verify or update the secret question with the account owner. 

Last Update On 05/19/2023
4.question: Can the provider verify their identity?

An operator with the Provider Administrator operator type needs to log into KinderConnect and follow the steps below to update the operator type.

In KinderConnect, click on Operator and select Search to perform an operator search.
Enter the search criteria and press the Search button to find the operator.
or 
The provider can leave all the fields blank and press the Search button to perform an open search to show all operators created at the program.

Click on the Operator Type drop-down menu to select the desired operator type.
Press Save to complete the update.

6.content:
Linking Operator Accounts

Support Agents can link multiple accounts to an existing operator account. 

Before linking accounts, the Support agents must do the following:

1. Search for the caller's account in KinderConnect and confirm their name is found in the accounts in question.

2. Ask for the Provider License Number of the accounts needing to be linked.

  • Identify which account the Provider wants to use/keep. This will be the main account to which you will link the additional account/s.

Scenario 1: The Operator's name is in the two accounts.

    • Proceed to Link Operator Accounts.

Scenario 2: The Operator's name is NOT in the two accounts. 

    • If the caller asks to link an account and their name is not in any of the Operator accounts, the caller will have to ask a Provider Administrator to create an account for them or they will have to contact the State Helpdesk.

Unlinking Operator Accounts

Support Agents must guide the Provider in unlinking their account. Proceed to Unlink Operator Accounts for the steps.

Last Update On 04/02/2024

7.content:
To add a new Operator, an existing Operator with a Provider Administrator operator type must be available.  


Notes:

  • If the previous director is present at the same time as the new director, the previous director should create an account for the new director in KinderConnect.
  • The Support Agent must not help the new director create a new account if the previous director is unavailable, even if the new director has access to the old director’s account. The Support agents should refer the new director to TWC to be added.

7.question: Are there any existing account owners available?

8.content:
Provider Password

  • Providers can change their password in KinderConnect by themselves if their account is not locked. If their account is locked, they have to call support.
  • Password requirements:
    • At least 8 characters long.
    • At least one numerical digit.
    • At least one lowercase letter.
    • At least one uppercase letter.
    • At least on special character

Policies

  • When assisting providers in resetting their password, support must speak to the account owner. 
  • Support should advise providers never to write down their password. 
  • Providers should never share their password with anyone, including support agents.

Last Update On 5/02/2023

9.content:
Reset PIN (KinderSign)

These steps will only work if the provider's account is unlocked. Use the steps below to guide the provider through resetting their PIN on the KinderSign application.  


From the home screen, tap the KinderSign icon to open the application. 

Make sure the Online icon appears on the top-left corner. 

Enter the 10-digit telephone number associated with your KinderSign account.
Tap Next to proceed.

Tap the Change PIN button on the top-right corner of the screen.  

Enter the answer to the secret question using the on-screen keyboard. 
Tap Confirm to proceed.


You will now be prompted to enter a new PIN. Type the new PIN on the number pad.

Note: Your new PIN must be 6 digits and cannot be the same as your last four PINs.
Tap Confirm to proceed.


The next screen will ask you to confirm your new PIN by typing it again.
Tap Confirm to proceed.

You will be taken back to the initial sign-in page.

Now you can use your new PIN to sign in.

Last Update On: 05/02/2023

10.content:

11.content:
If an operator needs to reset their password for KinderConnect, use the guide below to instruct the operators through resetting their password.

Note: If the operator has an email address saved in KinderConnect, a one-time password (OTP) will be sent to their email before resetting the password. Otherwise, the operator will be asked to verify their secret answer.  


From the log-in page, Select Forgot Password? 
Type your username in the "Username" field and press Continue.
FOR OPERATORS WITHOUT EMAIL ADDRESS

If there's no email address saved in KinderConnect, the operator will be asked to type in the answer to the secret question and press Validate Secret Question.

Note: The answer to the secret question is case-sensitive.

After verifying the secret answer, the operator will be prompted to enter the new password in the "Password" and "Verify Password" fields. Select the Reset Password button.

Note: Advise the operator of the password requirements listed at the top of the page. They cannot use the same password they have used in their last four password resets. The Password requirements are also listed below:

Password length must be at least 8 characters long.
Password must contain the required amount of digits: 1
Password must contain the required amount of lowercase and uppercase letters: Lowercase: 1 Uppercase: 1
Password must contain the required number of special characters: 1
 
If the password entered meets all the requirements, you should be greeted with a message stating the password has been reset. Press Close to return to the log-in screen and attempt to log in.


Password Reset Errors

Error 1: Cannot Save Operator Data

While resetting the password, you may receive this error message. This message will be displayed differently based on the caller's device but will retain the same message.

This message appears if the password used does not meet one or more of the password requirements.

Advise the caller to close the message and attempt to enter their new password again, paying close attention to the password requirements.
Error 2: The answer you entered does not match the answer on file, please try again.


If the operator sees this error message, this means that the answer they are typing is correct. 
Note: The secret answers are character and case-sensitive. 
Support must not provide the secret answer to the operator but can assist with any capitalizations, spaces, and characters that might affect their answer.
Support can also check if the operator is trying to reset the password for the right username.


Note: After changing the password, the provider must type in the new password. If the browser is set up to save passwords, it is up to the provider to allow the browser to update the new password. 


Last Update On: 4/26/2023

14.page_title: Provider | Existing Account Owner Not Available
14.content:
There are two scenarios when the Provider Administrator account owner is not available:

  1. The account owner is not working but can be contacted.
    • Advise the caller to ask the account owner to contact Support. 
  2. The account owner is not working and cannot be contacted. 
    • If you encounter a scenario where a person reports that the previous owner has left and the person calling needs access to KinderConnect, State Helpdesk will need to verify if the new person can have access to KinderConnect (operator account). Support must refer the person to the State Helpdesk help desk for assistance at  tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov. 
    • Once validated, the State Helpdesk will notify Support by email, and then a Team Lead or Customer Success Manager will create the new Operator account. 

Last Update on 09/26/2023

15.content:
Newly Registered Providers

New Providers will need assistance getting familiar with the system and its functionalities. They may need a general overview of the basics of navigating and performing different actions in our system, like entering and submitting attendance. For more training videos and documents, you can also refer them to the info site tx3c.info

Previously Registered Providers

They are typically familiar with the system but may need assistance from time to time.

Use the search function to locate the provider's account. Enter the appropriate search criteria into the available fields. Typically, the most effective way to locate a provider's account is by asking for their License Number. 

Note: The more criteria you add, the more specific your search results will be.

If the license number is unavailable, you can enter other available information (as displayed above) in the appropriate field. You can also go to Operator > Search to locate the provider's account using the caller's first and last name.


The results matching the search criteria you have entered will then be displayed under Search Results. Click on the provider's name to load the account. 

Registered Relative In-Home Provider

Relative In-home providers will use IVR to track attendance. They will NOT receive a TWC survey or a tablet. For more information related to Relative In-home  Providers, please select Relative In-Home Provider (IVR).

Last Update On: 11/29/2023
15.question: What is the provider calling about?

16.content:
The Provider | Payments page allows the provider to review the details of all payments issued to them during the selected time period. This includes a list of the children and the amount and fees paid. 

Disclaimer: The payment information contained in the TX3c system is only an estimate of the payment due and is not the actual payment due. The actual payment due will be calculated using the information submitted and any payment determinations made by ODTWC and may differ from the amount shown below. No representations or warranties of any kind, express or implied, should be made about the completeness, accuracy, or reliability of the estimated payment information shown. Any user that relies on the estimated payment summary information below is using such payment information beyond its intended purpose and assumes all risk associated with such reliance and/or action.

 When a provider has issues or concerns regarding payment, support must identify the following:

  • Which billing cycle are you inquiring about? 
  • Which child are you inquiring about?
  • Was the attendance submitted correctly for the child(ren) in question?

Note: The Payment for the submitted attendance is based on the child's authorization. If the Provider has further questions regarding their payment is calculated, please refer to State Helpdesk tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov

Co-Pay Updates

TWC will soon be re-instating co-payments for the families and will be notifying Providers by email of the changes. If a caller is asking how to see co-payment information Support must guide them on how to see this information in Kinderconnect. If the caller has any questions regarding how or when the co-payments will resume, please refer them to State Helpdesk.

For more information on how to guide the caller to see co-payment information please select Payment Review.

Yearly Registration Fees

Yearly registration fees for providers in Texas were sent out starting on February 14th, 2023. If Providers call in asking about the payment, Support Agents should inform the provider they can expect to receive this payment in their accounts within 3-5 business days from the 14th. This will be a separate deposit from their weekly submittal payments. The registration fee is an annual fee of $25 to each program for every child served through the Publicly Funded Child Care program, with at least one day of actual attendance (not absent or PD days) in 2022.

Note: The program has to have been open on 1/1/2023 to receive the Yearly Registration Fees payments. If they closed prior to 1/1/23 then no registration fees would be paid out for the 2022 year. The provider can review these payments on the Provider > Payments page.

Last Update On: 07/17/2023
16.question: Select the topic that best describes the provider's payment issue or question.

3.button_text: Payment Schedule (When will I get Paid?)

17.content:
In KinderConnect, a child is someone who is attending or has attended the Provider. Children get categorized into two groups:

  1. Subsidized Children: Subsidized children are children who are authorized and subsidized by TWC to be in a Provider's care. These records get updated by TWC and will include a Child Identification Number (CIN). Subsidized Children will show Subsidized under the Type column in the search results.
  2. Non-subsidized Children: These are children who are not authorized or subsidized by TWC yet. These children’s accounts either expired or are in an application period with the state.


Non-subsidized Children are not required to be put in the system. Support will not recommend adding Non-Subsidized children into the system, but Support can assist Providers on how to add them if they want to. They will need to know how to make a private pay child account for pending authorizations.

Note: When merging the attendance, it is essential to remind the Provider that they can only merge the active subsidized record with the manually entered Private Pay child account the Provider creates. 

Last Update On: 11/08/2023
17.question: What is the Provider Calling About?

19.content:
Remember, providers CANNOT and SHOULD NOT enter Attendance in KinderConnect.

Still, providers may also need assistance guiding sponsors on how to perform different attendance-related activities. 

Before assisting the provider with Attendance related questions, the Support Agent must identify the following:

  • The Child/ren's First & Last Name
  • The Billing Cycle/dates
  • Any errors message, if any

General Policies for Attendance:

  1. Providers CANNOT and SHOULD NOT enter or edit attendance 
  2. Providers CANNOT Recall attendance 
  3. Attendance can be backdated 6 days from the service date by the Sponsor
  4. ALL attendance is automatically submitted 7 Days after the Service Period, regardless of status. Click on Submitting Attendance for more information. 
  5. Only ONE time needs to be entered for the state to accept the attendance
    • Agents should encourage them to enter at all times
    • Families only need to enter an IN or OUT time. A full-time pairing is not required for the day to be paid by TWC 
  6.  If the Provider is the child's transportation, the Provider may take the tablet with them so the Sponsor can sign in or out the child.
    •  But if the tablet needs to stay at the location for others to sign in then Support must refer the Provider to contact the State Helpdesk at tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov to request additional tablets.

Note: The Payment for the submitted attendance is based on the child's authorization. If the Provider has further questions regarding their payment is calculated, please refer to State Helpdesk tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov

Last Update On: 11/21/2023

22.content:
The TX3C Support facilitates the collection of publicly funded childcare attendance information, which is used in the preparation of publicly funded childcare payments. TX3C Support processes requests for new, replacement (lost, stolen, damaged, faulty), and tablet returns for Providers switching from tablet providers to a certified API.

As part of the TX3C system, the Texas Workforce Commission (TWC) provides eligible Providers with only 1 Samsung tablet and 1 tablet stand per location.

New Tablet & Additional Tablet Requests

The Tablet team ships a tablet to all eligible Providers. If the Provider calls TX3c Support to request a tablet, Support Agents must confirm if the Provider meets the eligibility requirements. 

However, if the Provider has not completed the survey, the Support Agent should direct them to the survey email sent by State Helpdesk@public.govdelivery.com to complete it first.

Providers are eligible to receive the tablet if they meet the requirements below:

  1. They have at least 1 subsidized child attending their location. 
  2. They are NOT using a certified third-party attendance software (API Provider).
  3. They are NOT a Relative In-home/IVR user.

Providers requesting additional tablets must submit their request to the State Helpdesk tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov.

API CMS Providers- If the Provider uses a certified API/CMS, Support should advise that they will NOT receive a tablet. Refer to the Implemented API/CMS list for a list of the certified API/CMS.

  • If the Provider states they need a tablet due to unapproved API or states they were using API as indicated on their state survey but would like to use one of our tablets instead, select Disable API.

Relative In-Home Providers—If the provider is a Relative In-Home Provider, they will not receive a tablet and are not allowed to use KinderSign or KinderSmart; they must use IVR. In case they have further questions regarding this policy, Support Agents should refer the Provider to the State Help Desk. 

Accessories Requests

If the Provider needs a replacement accessory, please verify if the address on file is correct. If the address is incorrect or the Provider wants to change it, please inform them that we can only ship to the address on file. If they want to make any changes, they must contact the State Helpdesk- tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov. 

Tablet Returns

Providers may contact support to return tablets because they are ending their contract with the State or they will be using API. Select Tablet Return for more information.

Last Updated: 05/07/2024
22.question: Select the topic that best describes the provider's question regarding their tablet.

23.content:
KinderSign is a tablet-based mobile application designed for the Provider to collect childcare attendance from parents and other authorized individuals when signing the children In and Out of care at their childcare Providers. All attendance records obtained via KinderSign are uploaded to KinderConnect via a Wi-Fi connection. 


Real-time stamp information is available for time-and-attendance tracking, reporting, and Provider reimbursement.

Click here to review the minimum system requirements.

Last Update On: 04/17/2023

Registering a Provider in KinderConnect is the first step in using the system. Registration only needs to happen with the first Operator of the account. The first Operator will create all future operators. The account can be registered from the login page of KinderConnect.

For Support Agents: Ask for the Provider License Number and search the account in KinderConnect. Check if there's an Operator already registered.

The information that must match in KinderConnect is:

  • Last Name

The Support Agent must walk the provider through the steps to register a new account.

  • If there are Operators already registered, verify their concern, and select the Registered Provider button below.

27.page_title: Provider | New Provider Tablet Request Inquiries
27.content:
The Tablet team ships a tablet to all eligible Providers. If the Provider calls TX3c Support to request their tablet, Support Agents must confirm if the Provider meets the eligibility requirements. 

Eligible providers will receive one tablet per location. If they request for additional tablet, Support must refer Providers to contact TWC Helpdesk

Providers are eligible to receive the tablet if they meet the requirements below:

  1. They have at least 1 subsidized child attending their location. 
  2. They are NOT using a certified API/CMS. 
    • Refer to the Implemented API/CMS list for a list of the certified API/CMS.
  3. They are NOT a Relative In-home/IVR user.

However, if the Provider has not completed the survey, the Support Agent should direct them to the survey email sent by State Helpdesk@public.govdelivery.com to complete it, first.

If a Provider shows no children in the survey but the Provider is calling back to report that they now have subsidized children, Support Agents will need to confirm the subsidized child authorization in the Provider > Cases page. If they have an active authorization, Support Agents will proceed to fill out the Tablet Request Form.

If the Provider does not meet all the requirements, select Provider is NOT eligible to receive a tablet.

Last Update On: 02/21/2024
27.question: Select the best option below:

1.button_text: Provider is NOT eligible to receive a tablet.

28.content:
If the provider has an issue or discrepancy with payment already processed (paid status), the program can easily contact ODTWC Business Unit by sending a Payment Alert. 

This directly goes to TWC where it is reviewed daily. TWC sends their response to the provider by email and the response time frame depends on how many alerts are backlogged.

The support agent must do the necessary research before guiding the provider to send a payment alert. If the discrepancy in the payment is caused by something that can be fixed in our system, such as an incorrect customized schedule, that correction must be made by the provider before they send the payment alert.

Notes:

  • A separate payment alert will need to be sent for each incorrect payment.
  • Do not refer programs to contact TWC before explaining the payment alert.
  • Providers do not need to send their information or child information when sending payment alerts.
  • According to TWC, they will not make payment adjustments for not choosing the school session out. For further questions, refer the provider to contact TWC.

How to Send a Payment Alert



From the menu, go to Provider, and select Payments.



Enter the search parameters using the name of the Provider, Start Date and End Date, Date Filter and Status.
Press Search.


The Search Results contain all payments issued to that provider matching the specified criteria.  Search for the payment line desired, and click on Send Alert.

Note:  Payment Alerts must be sent if the payment is in paid status only. A separate payment alert will need to be sent for each incorrect payment.


The Alert will appear as a message in the Message Center, under the Sent tab. Note that the Recipient's name and the Final Appearance Date do not contain information.

If there is no payment found, check if the attendance for the period has been submitted. Otherwise, refer the provider to contact TWC.

If the provider wants to follow up about a payment alert they have previously sent, refer the provider to call TWC.

If the payment is not in PAID status, explain that the payment must be in this status before sending the alert. If the payment has been in processing status after the scheduled processed date, refer the provider to TWC.

Last Update 01/31/2021

29.content:
Providers can Export all or part of the Provider Payments Search Results. Payment records are exported in CSV format. This means that the provider needs to open this report with any application that can open this format. 

Note: 

  • If the provider is looking for an official document for tax purposes or proof of employment, please refer the provider to State Helpdesk.
  • Please advise the provider to use a computer when exporting the payment reports. The TWC-provided tablet does not allow for reports to be downloaded or viewed.

Provider can download reports in the Provider >Payments page and Provider >Remittance page as shown below:

Provider >Payments

Navigate to the Provider | Payments page.

To narrow the Search Results, click the drop-down arrow and select the desired Status and/or the Date Filter, then press Search.

Select the payments to be included by clicking on the check box next to the desired Payment ID(s) or click on the check box located on the title field to select all.


Once the payments ID(s) is selected, press Export.

Depending on the browser being used, a file ready to be downloaded will be displayed. Click on the arrow and select the option desired. 

Provider >Remittance



To review the details of a Remittance, click on the corresponding Details to view further information regarding the remittance.

To create an alert message related to a Remittance, click on the corresponding Send Alert. 

Note: If the provider uses the Payment Alert button, the support agent should remind the provider to include all the details, including the child's information, as this button is not linked to any child in particular. Results will only show on this page if the payments are already in PAID status.
 
If the search criteria generate Search Results, the Export button allows you to review the details of a Remittance. Click on the corresponding Details.

Note: Depending on your browser, the steps to follow might differ.


By clicking on Details, the provider can see further information regarding the remittance that they are going to receive or will receive. 
Service Period Start and Service Period End show the cycle that the remittance is related to.
Family Fees are fees that the family is responsible for as determined by TWC.
Invoice is the actual amount that the provider is getting paid for the corresponding child.
Adjustment Code will be added if TWC assigns one as applicable. Regular child care payments will not have an adjustment code.
Export Details allows the provider to open and export the remittance details in CSV format for additional review. 

Last Update On: 3/20/2023

34.content:
When a sponsor/caretaker submits an application for a publicly funded child care (PFCC) application but is denied benefits, providers can still receive payments for a specific period when services are rendered.

Support agents must confirm if the Payment after Denial authorization is already in KinderConnect. If the provider needs assistance in viewing the child's authorization information, click on the Assistance with Searching for the Child button below.

If the Payment After Denial Authorization is in KinderConnect, 

  • Support agents must advise the Providers and/or Sponsors that they have (35 days) to get attendance entered from the day the authorization was added to the system. 
    • Assist the providers with questions regarding entering and backdating attendance.
  • If the provider has questions regarding the authorization period or other policies, refer the provider to contact State Helpdesk.
  • If the Provider has no tablet, ask the provider if they have a personal tablet they can use. Assist the Provider with registering the tablet to KinderSign.
    • If the Provider does not have a tablet, Support agents will send a tablet request to the Tablet team to have a tablet shipped. The Tablet Team will check authorizations including all the details in their notes. 

If the Payment After Denial Authorization is NOT SHOWING in KinderConnect, 

  • Refer the provider to State Helpdesk to add the Payment after Denial Authorization.
  • DO NOT recommend adding a Non-Subsidized record because the authorization was already denied. 
  • If the provider has questions regarding the authorization period or other policies, refer the provider to contact State Helpdesk.

Last Update on: 06/30/2023

35.content:
Attendance that spans past midnight is considered Overnight Care. The setting must be enabled if a provider needs to have the sponsors enter Overnight Care attendance. Support will enable or disable Overnight Care in the Provider > Detail page upon confirming the provider number and name of the Operator.

If the Provider wants to enable or disable the Overnight Care setting, the Support Agent must update the settings in KinderConnect.

Note: Support Agents cannot enable or disable Overnight Care via email or chat. Support Agents must request a phone number in order to provide assistance over the phone. 

Overnight care attendance can be entered on consecutive days. When KinderConnect detects that an unmatched In time occurs on the first day (when the child arrives at the location) and that an Out time is the first attendance transaction on the next day (when the child leaves the location), it considers the two transactions a valid time pair and automatically inserts an Out time at 11:59 pm on the first day and an In time at 12:00am on the next day. If the attendance covers more than two consecutive days of care, the system automatically enters the In and Out times for the days in between.

Follow the steps listed below to see what the sponsor entered for Overnight Attendance:

Note: Even though sponsors do NOT need to update the Overnight Care attendance as they are only required to enter 1 in or out time per day the agents need to encourage them to enter complete attendance.

The Sponsor will use KinderSign or KinderSmart to enter the time the child arrived at the location as the In time on the date the child arrived at the location.

The Sponsor will use KinderSign or KinderSmart to enter the time the child left the location as the Out time on the date the child left the location.

KinderConnect will automatically insert an Out time at 11:59 pm on the first day and an In time at 12:00am on the next day.

For children returning for care on the day they have been previously Signed Out from care, the second row of attendance will be used to enter the attendance.

Last Update On: 10/12/23
35.question: Did the steps above solve the Provider's issue or question?

2.button_text: No - Instructions for Sponsor Entering Attendance (KinderSmart)

36.content:
All attendance for Texas providers will be submitted automatically to the state biweekly, 7 days after the 2-week service period has ended.

The providers DO NOT need to have complete attendance. The system will sweep the attendance regardless of the attendance status. 

The service period is Monday through Sunday.

For example, the Service period from the 2nd to the 15th will be automatically submitted on the 22nd.

Note: The easiest way to figure out when the attendance will be submitted, is to view the Attendance > Detail Page, and find the last submitted day. Then calculate from there when attendance will be submitted using the information above.

A provider may request assistance reviewing attendance before it is automatically submitted to the state.

The Support Agent should ask the following:

  • What billing cycle are you reviewing?
  • Which child/ren are you wanting to review?
  • Are there any errors in the attendance that need attention?


Last Update On: 04/26/2023
36.question: Were the Provider's attendance questions answered?

37.content:
KinderConnect detects Incomplete or Incorrect Attendance. It uses colored backgrounds in the cells to indicate if there are errors. In these cases, the provider may want to review the discrepancies. 

Though we encourage complete attendance to be entered, a correction is NOT necessary, as only one in or out time is required. Providers CANNOT and SHOULD NOT correct or delete times. If the Provider wishes to correct attendance for a missed punch, the Provider will have the Sponsor backdate using KinderSmart or KinderSign" Sponsors cannot correct or edit a time punch once entered. If a sponsor gets stuck on missing attendance and cannot enter regular attendance, advise them to click on "all" at the top of the screen.  

Yellow Cells: indicate a missing In or Out time pair. This can be corrected by having the missing time pair entered into the system.

Note: A correction is NOT necessary, as only one in or out time is required. However, the sponsor can enter the correct in or out time to complete the time pair. 
The system shows Missing Time on incomplete Attendance entries. Having a duplicate In or Out time may result in the system indicating a missing time. 
Note: Providers CANNOT correct or delete times.

Red Cells: Indicate an error or discrepancy in the timeline or chronological order of the transactions.

Example:
The In time is entered with a PM instead of an AM. In doing so, the Out time takes place before the In time, creating the red cell.

Note: Providers CANNOT correct or delete times. However, the sponsor can enter the correct in or out time to complete the time pair. The extra entry can be disregarded.

Last Update On: 04/16/2024
37.question: Were the provider's attendance entries questions answered?

Subsidized children are children who are authorized and subsidized by TWC to be in a Provider's care. These records get updated by TWC and will include a Child Identification Number (CIN). 

  1. Search for the child in question under Child > Search page.
  2. Confirm that the child in question is a subsidized child by checking the CIN and Type.
    1. Subsidized children will show Subsidized under the Type column in the search results.

39.content:
Support can assist Providers in adding Non-Subsidized children to the system. 

Note: 

  • Providers are not required to add Non-Subsidized children to the system & Support should not recommend adding Non-Subsidized children. 
  • Some State Helpdesks/Counties may ask providers to add Non-Subsidized children so they can start tracking attendance until the subsidized authorizations come from TWC.
  • The account can then be merged after the subsidized record is imported.

How To View Non-Subsidized

1. Search for the child in question under Child > Search page.

2. Confirm that the child in question is a Non-Subsidized child by checking the CIN and Type:

Last Update On: 04/19/2023
39.question: What is the question related to?

40.content:
There are instances when a provider starts providing childcare services while the subsidy authorization is being processed. The provider may create a record for the child as Non-Subsidized in order to temporarily record attendance until a Subsidized account is created by TWC.  

Once the authorization has been processed, the child's record will be imported into KinderConnect. The child will then have two records, one for subsidized care (that was automatically imported into the system by TWC) and another for Non-Subsidized care (which the provider created). 

When merging the two accounts, any attendance that was recorded in the Non-Subsidized account will be merged with the new subsidy account, according to the authorization dates.

Note: A Subsidized account cannot be merged with another Subsidized account.

Steps to Merge the Child's Non-Subsidized and Subsidized Records 

Navigate to the Child > Merge page or Provider > Merge page.

Note: Support does not see Child > Merge Page.
Click on the radio button next to the authorized child name you would like to merge to generate a list of all potential matches. 

If no matching children are found, the list displays all potential children indicating the reason for this result in bold red letters.

Click on the radio button next to the child's name under "potential matches" to select the record to be merged into the first child record selected.

If the child is not listed under potential matches, click on the Child Not Listed button below.
Then press Accept Match to confirm the potential match.
Note: If parent records are available to be merged, KinderConnect will display the names of all new authorized parents. Click on the radio button next to the parent name you would like to merge to generate the list of potential matches. Click on the radio button to select the parent record to be merged into the first parent record selected.
Select Confirm Merge

KinderConnect issues a message informing you that the merge was successfully completed. Press OK.


When the merge is successful, Support agents must:

  1. Guide the provider to merge Sponsor accounts if needed. The Provider may be prompted to merge sponsors automatically. If not prompted, guide the Provider to Sponsor > Merge Page.
  2. Check the current/active Subsidized record of the child.  If the Non-Subsidized Schedule is active, advise the Provider to set the Non-Subsidized Schedule to end when the authorization started. This will avoid confusion later when the authorization expires.

Last Update On: 04/26/2023
40.question: Was the Provider able to merge the child records?

2.button_text: No - Child Not Listed On Merge Page

41.content:
Absent Days

  • Absent Days are days the child is authorized and scheduled to be in care but is not in Attendance.
  • Absent days are added by sponsors in KinderSign and KinderSmart.
  • Currently, Providers do NOT need to enter absence days. Providers are always paid while there is an active authorization.   
    • Excessive absence consequences are applied to the child when they hit 40 absences but that consequence has been waived until October 1, 2023. Providers are always paid as long as there is an active referral/authorization in the system. They should be checking their KinderConnect portal regularly to make sure referrals/authorizations are still in place and parents are entering attendance.

Closure Days/Professional Days/Holidays

Currently, Providers do NOT need to enter Professional days. Providers are always paid while there is an active authorization. Please advise Providers that they do not need to record Professional days. 

Last Updated 12/01/2023

50.content:
How to Search for a Child

Guide the provider through the instructions below:

Select the Child > Search option from the navigation bar.
Enter your search criteria.

Note: If the provider has difficulties searching, remind them of the following: 
  • It is recommended to always hit clear before entering search criteria 
  • The more information you enter, the fewer results you will see
  • Spaces before and after search criteria will affect search results
  • For hyphenated names, it is recommended to only enter the first name (before the hyphen)
The "Schedule Date" will always show the current date by default. 

It will limit the provider's search results to children with active authorization on the selected day.

To see all children, remove the date from this field.
Press Search.
Children who meet the search criteria are displayed in the Search Results.
Inform the provider that all results are listed in alphabetical or numerical order by default. It is possible to change the order of the results by clicking on the column heading.
Press Clear to clear the search criteria previously entered.


Note: If a Provider calls and reports that the Subsidized child's name, child information, or authorization is incorrect, then the Agent should refer them to notify their Local Child Care Services representative who informed them of eligibility for care.

Last Update On: 05/09/2024

51.page_title: Provider | Linking Child to a Sponsor
51.content:
How to Link Child to Sponsor

Guide the Provider through the process below to link a Child record to a Sponsor record:

Guide the provider to navigate to the Sponsor > Search page.
Prompt the provider to enter any search criteria they want.


Note: The more information they enter, the fewer results they will see.
Spaces before and after search criteria will affect search results.
Ask them to Press Search. Then click on the sponsor's name in the results to go to their detail page.
On the Sponsor > Detail page, they will click on Add Children.
They can type in the child's "First" and/or "Last" Name and press Search.

Then, check the box for the correct child and press OK.

OR
They can keep the fields empty, and press Search to show all Children in the provider. Select the Child required and press OK.

This will add the child/ren on the Sponsor's Detail page under "Sponsored Children".
The provider will select the Sponsor's appropriate "Relationship to Child".
Press Save at the top of the page to save the record.


Once the above steps are complete, advise the provider to refresh the tablet before the Sponsor tries to sign in. For assistance with refreshing the tablet, click on the Refresh Tablet button below.

Last Update On: 04/25/2023
51.question: Was the provider able to link the child to the sponsor?

53.content:
Before adding a new child, and to avoid duplicates, make sure that the child has no other record in the system by searching for them on the Child > Search page.

Add a New Non-Subsidized Child

Click on the Child > Detail page on the navigation bar.
Add a private pay child by pressing New to create a new record at the top of the Detail page.
This step is important when entering multiple records.
Enter the required information for the child indicated 
by a red asterisk (*).
Click on Add Non-Subsidized Schedule.
Enter a Start Date and End Date. 

The dates will depend on the Provider. This should cover the period when the child is attending the Provider. 
Press OK to return to the child Detail page.
Press Save at the top of the Detail page. 
The record will be saved, and the Child Type will automatically be generated for the record.

Note: After the Child record is created, it will need to be linked to a Sponsor for attendance to be entered by the Sponsor.

Suppot Agents should verify in the system that the Child record was added and it is linked to a Sponsor.


If the Provider needs assistance with adding a Sponsor, click on Yes - Needs instructions to Add a Sponsor button below. 

Last Update On: 04/25/2023
53.question: Was the Provider able to add a Private Pay child record?

1.button_text: Yes - Needs instructions to Add a Sponsor

54.page_title: Provider | Updating Information on the Child's Detail Page
54.content:
Updating Child's Information

A provider can update several fields on a Non-Subsidized Child's page. However, they can only update the phone number on a Subsidized Child record. 

Search for the Child on the Child > Search page.
 
For assistance searching for the child, click on the Search for Child button.
Open the Child Detail page by clicking on the child's name under the Search Results.
On the Child Detail page, you can update/modify any of the following information as shown in the image:

First Name
Middle Name
Last Name
Date of Birth
Phone Number
Non-Subsidized Schedule


Deleting a Child's Record

If the Non-Subsidized child does not have any attendance recorded in the past, the provider can delete the record by pressing Delete at the top of the page.
A confirmation message will be displayed. Press OK to confirm.
Note: If the Non-Subsidized child has attendance recorded, the system will not allow to deletion of the record. 
In this instance, guide the provider through shortening the schedule to the date after the attendance was last recorded. 


From the Child > Detail page, locate for Non-Subsidized Schedule at the bottom and select Edit. 

Change the End Date to any date after the attendance was last recorded by typing the date or selecting the date from the Calendar icon.


Press OK. Press Save at the top.

The child's record will not show on the Attendance > Detail page.

If the date selected to end is at the end of the week, the child's record will disappear from the page.


Uploading a Child's Picture

KinderConnect also allows you to add a picture to the records of the children you care for. This picture will also appear next to the child’s name in KinderSign. 

Before you start, you must have a child's picture saved on your computer.

Press Upload Picture at the top of the page.
Locate the child picture you would like to upload to your computer, which you had previously saved. This process will vary based on your computer.
Once selected, the picture will appear on the right side of the Child Detail page. The picture will also display in KinderSign next to the child’s name.
To remove a picture, press Delete Picture.
Once all updates are complete, press Save.

Last Update On: 04/25/2023
54.question: Was the provider able to update the child's record?

55.content:
A provider may find him or herself unable to add a missing time or remove a time that a sponsor entered. Support can verify if the provider had already entered a transaction for the day and if corrections are needed.


How to Review the Attendance History

Click on the History button for the day in question.

Note: 
  • If there is no History button, it means that attendance has NEVER been recorded for that day.
  •  If there is a History button displayed on a day without attendance entered, this means that attendance has been entered for that day at some point but has been erased.
Attendance entered by the provider will display the Operator's name under the User column and Web under the Source column.



If there is attendance already recorded for the day by the provider, the provider will not be able to add more attendance for the day. 

Remember: Providers can only enter one transaction per time pair, per day, per child.

If the provider is looking to remove attendance entered by the parent or an additional sponsor, the provider will need to first delete their attendance entry and save the change. This will then allow the provider to delete the sponsor-entered attendance. 

The provider can either re-enter the correct time and ask the primary parent to approve it or ask the parent or any additional sponsor to backdate the attendance.

Last Updated On: 10 /13/2022
55.question: Was the provider able to correct attendance as needed?

2.button_text: No - Attendance cannot be corrected due to sweep

56.content:
Support can walk the provider through resetting the password while logging in to Kinderonnect. 

Use the guide below to instruct the provider through resetting the Password/PIN when logged in to KinderConnect.

Click on Operator and select My Account menu in KinderConnect.

Advise the Operator to update their password. If needed, assist them with the password requirements.

Password requirements:
  • Password length must be between 12 and 15 characters long.
  • Password must contain the required number of digits: 1
  • Password must contain the required number of lowercase and uppercase letters: Lowercase: 1 Uppercase: 1
  • Password must contain the required number of special characters: 1.

To Update the PIN Click on the PIN field and type the new 4-6 digits PIN.

Press Save to complete.

Last Update On 04/26/2023
56.question: Was the provider able to update their account?

58.content:
Absence Policies

Absent Days are days the child is authorized and scheduled to be in Provider care but was absent. 

  • Providers can get paid for absent days. 
  • Absent days are paid based on child authorization
  • Absent days are added by Sponsor using KinderSign and KinderSmart.

Providers are NOT penalized if a parent isn’t entering attendance. Excessive absence consequences are applied to the child when they hit 40 absences per year, but the consequences have been waived until October 1, 2023. Providers are always paid as long as there is an active referral/authorization in the system. They should be checking their KinderConnect portal regularly to make sure referrals/authorizations are still in place and parents are entering attendance.

If the Provider has questions regarding absences or other policies about this, Support Agents must refer them to contact their county/State Helpdesk.


How to Record an Absence in KinderSign

Sponsors can record absences by following the directions below:

If the tablet is Online, it will automatically upload all attendance to KinderConnect. If the tablet loses its internet connection, the status will display the message Offline. Parents and sponsors can still use it to record an absence. When the tablet reconnects to the internet, it will automatically upload all attendance data collected to KinderConnect. 

Each time the sponsor logs in, a message will appear with terms for using the system. Tap Agree to move on to the menu.
On the Sponsor Activities screen, tap Attendance.
The Sponsor can check the internet connection status for KinderSign in the top left corner.
The tablet will take a picture of the sponsor. Tap Authenticate to capture the picture.
When the child list appears, select the Absent box and add a Note to explain the reason.

If no children appear, then select More Questions About Attendance.
The sponsor must Sign the provided area and tap Submit to automatically transmit the absence to KinderConnect. The tablet needs to be online.
A message will appear confirming the Absence was saved.


After the absence has been recorded, KinderSign will return to the telephone keypad and is ready for the next caretaker/sponsor to sign in. 

Note: If the sponsor is at the location, Support should confirm in KinderConnect that the absence was added successfully. 

Last Updated 06/30/2023
58.question: Select the best option below:

59.content:
Providers need to report any closures to Child Care Regulation and any State Helpdesks where they have an agreement in place to serve subsidy children. Currently, the Professional Day button will also be used for reporting any closure days and holidays.

For further policy questions, refer the provider to contact State Helpdesk. 

How To Enter a Professional Day

Below are the steps that a Provider will follow when entering a Professional Day:

Select Attendance from the navigation bar, then select Detail from the dropdown menu to navigate to the Attendance Detail page.

The Provider will press Professional Day.
A pop-up to set the Professional Day will come up. The Provider can select a Professional Day by:

A. Using the calendar button to select the desired Professional Day or 
B. Entering the date in the available field. This method must be used if the provider wishes to enter a Professional Day in the future.

Notes: 

The Provider must navigate to the week corresponding to the date they want to set as Professional Day. The system will only allow the provider to enter Professional Day within the selected week. If the date to be marked as Professional Day is not part of the current week, type the desired date on the date field, click on the arrows next to the date to move to previous weeks, or click on the calendar icon next to the date field.


The following conditions will generate an error message when creating a Professional Day:
  • A child has another attendance type on that day, including incomplete time pairs.
  • If, after setting a day to be a Professional Day, the Provider needs to provide care on that day for all children, the Professional Day can be removed and replaced with actual attendance for all children.

How to Remove a Professional Day

From the Attendance > Detail page, click on the Absent dropdown. Choose the -Select- option to remove the current selection.

Press Save to save the changes.

Note: Professional Days cannot be removed after the payment for the service week has been processed.  

Last Updated 10/13/2023
59.question: Was the Provider Able to set the Professional Day successfully ?

1.button_text: No - Explained the Steps & Policy. Provider will do this at a later time

2.button_text: No - Provider receives an Error Message

3.button_text: Policy Questions. Refer to TWC State Helpdesk.

61.content:
Here are the common issues related to Professional Day and how to address these issues:

Scenario 1: Unable to Set Professional Day


If the provider reports that they cannot set a Professional Day, review the selected date. The following conditions will generate an error message:
  • A child has another attendance type on that day, including incomplete time pairs.
  • Submitted attendance records.
  • A child has a grayed-out schedule due to being outside of the authorization period.

Note: Support Agents must review the Attendance > Detail page for the Provider. If there are multiple attendance pages, use the Attendance > Transactions page and review the attendance to ensure that no children have any time of attendance on the date the Provider is attempting to set the Professional Day for.

  • Confirm that the date listed in the error message is the day the provider wants to set as Professional Day.
  • Confirm with the provider that they were not open to providing care on that date.
  • Guide the provider to remove any time entries or attendance codes listed for that day.
Scenario 2:  Children No Longer Attending the Program
If the provider reports that a child is no longer attending the program and professional day must not be included, inform the provider that professional day is applied to all children in their roster.
  • The Provider will contact and notify TWC that the child is no longer attending the program.
Scenario 3:   New Authorization
If a program submitted attendance and claimed a professional day before receiving the new authorization, the provider must reapply the Professional Day code to all children.
  • The Provider will contact and notify their State Helpdesk.

Last Updated On: 06/30/2023

63.content:
When preparing to Submit Attendance, KinderConnect notifies the user of all Incomplete records. They appear in red, and there is no Submit check box for their record.

A record listed as Incomplete indicates that there are one or more missing time pairs for the period in question. It also displays when a time is awaiting approval.

To view the necessary corrections, guide the provider through the steps listed below:


Click on Correct corresponding to the incomplete record to access the associated page for more details and/or editing.

Make the necessary changes and press Save.

Notes: 

1. Providers can only enter one time per time pair, per day, per child. If they have already entered one, the Sponsor/Caretaker should backdate the missing attendance.

2. For missing time pairs, providers can manually enter the attendance or have the Parent / Sponsor enter backdated attendance.






Providers can also go to the Attendance / Detail screen to review the entire period and make any necessary changes.

Remember: Transactions entered by the provider will need the primary caretaker's approval.

Last Updated: 3/23/2021

1.button_text: No - Needs Information on How to Backdate Attendance

2.button_text: No - Sponsor is Not Available to Update Attendance

65.page_title: Provider | Recording Attendance in Offline Mode
65.content:
When a sponsor logs into KinderSign while the tablet is offline, functionalities are limited. The sponsor can only record real-time and backdated attendance. They also can update language settings.


  • Attendance will be stored until the tablet is connected to Wi-Fi. 
  • It is recommended to connect the tablet to Wi-Fi at least once a week. 
  • If the tablet is never connected to Wi-Fi, attendance stored in the tablet cannot be uploaded and processed for payment. 
  • The offline transaction needs to be uploaded before the auto sweep.
  • Sponsors can backdate attendance when KinderSign is offline.
Note: If a program does not have Wi-Fi at the business location, they can use personal or public Wi-Fi.

Last Update On 06/06/2023
65.question: Did this resolve the providers question?

66.page_title: Provider | Attendance not Appearing in KinderConnect
66.content:
When a provider reports that the attendance was recorded by the sponsor but did not show up in KinderConnect, this could be because KinderSign is offline. KinderSign will store any transaction collected while offline. It checks every minute to see if it can reestablish a network connection. Once a connection is reestablished, the transactions will automatically upload to KinderConnect. 

Note: 

  • The offline transactions need to be uploaded before the attendance is submitted. 
  • If the attendance was recorded but not synchronized with KinderConnect before the auto sweep 35 days, the provider will not be able to submit the attendance.  
  • The auto sweep schedule can be viewed on the KinderConnect home page splash screen.

How to Troubleshoot Attendance not Appearing:


Verify that the tablet is showing "Online" in the top left corner. It would be showing Green.
If the tablet shows Online:

Confirm the Device ID number that the provider is using. It will show on the KinderSign main page, where the sponsor enters their phone number.
For Support Only:
Using KinderConnect, go to Attendance Transaction search and verify the
transaction time (Update Time) for the Device ID in question.

The search result will allow you to verify when the transaction was received.
If there are transactions from some sponsors but not others, it could be something the sponsor is doing or not doing correctly.

Advise the provider to watch the sponsor record attendance and see what the KS screen says.
If the Tablet is showing Offline:

Try refreshing the data first. If it's still offline, proceed to More Troubleshooting Needed.


Last Update On: 08/04/2022
66.question: Is the tablet now appearing online?

2.button_text: No - Information on Recording Attendance in Offline Mode

67.content:
When searching for Sponsors, it is important to understand that the search criteria being used could give you different results. For example:

When searching by Phone number, we do not see any duplicate accounts.
When searching by name, we find that there are multiple records with the same name. We see that a phone number isn’t associated with the records.


Record to Keep

When searching for duplicate accounts, Agents should always confirm by checking for active authorizations on every record for the children.

In this scenario, we see multiple Subsidized accounts. We see the account with the latest Sponsor ID (top) has no phone number associated with it. 

  1. The provider will need to select the old record by clicking on the sponsor's name and make the old record inactive or at least remove the phone number.
  2. The provider must add the phone number to the correct (usually newest) sponsor record.

On any old record, remove the phone number, press Save at the top, or make the old record inactive for Non-Subsidized records.

On the new record, the provider will enter the phone number, and press Save. 
Once both steps have been completed, the new, correct record should appear with the latest Case number and phone number listed.

Notes: 

  • Make sure the Provider refreshes the tablet before the Sponsor attempts to sign in again.
  • A Sponsor might use KinderSmart. The Support agent must confirm with the provider if the Sponsor is using KinderSmart and print a new registration form.

Last Update On: 04/20/2023
67.question: Is the Provider able to remove the unneeded duplicate records?

2.button_text: No - Needs Help Updating Sponsor Records

68.content:
Notes:

  • Providers CANNOT inactivate a subsidized child authorization (active or expired). If the Provider needs to remove an account Support Agent can advise to remove the phone number.
  • Inactive accounts are accounts that are no longer needed. Sometimes, an account is made inactive by accident and will need to be reactivated.

How to inactivate or reactivate an account: 

Once on the Sponsor> Search page, guide the provider to search for the record they want to update.


  • They can use the Status field to search for only inactive accounts if they need to reactivate a record.
  • They can leave as Select All to search for all records.
After pressing Search, the search results have a column labeled 'Status.' It will show if the record is 'Active' or 'Inactive.'

The provider will select the correct record by clicking the sponsor's name on the inactive record.

Once in the record, have the provider check or uncheck the Inactive field:

Checked is to make an account inactive.

Unchecked is to make an account active.

Note: Support does not activate or inactivate accounts.


Press Save at the top and wait for the 'Record Saved' confirmation.

Last Update On: 04/27/2023
68.question: Was the provider able to update the correct account?

69.content:
If a sponsor is not seeing the child/ren, then there could be a mismatch in the sponsor's account information; some common examples are:

  • The children have been re-authorized on a new case number. The sponsor number is not added to the new account.
  • The phone number is linked to more than one account. The sponsor is selecting the wrong/old account when signing into KinderSign.

Note: Agents must confirm by checking authorization records for the children. The current authorization can be confirmed by matching the CIN and Type.

After the provider enters the search criteria, have them press search and select the correct record they want to update.

This will take you to the Sponsors > Detail page.

SubsidizedThe primary sponsor's information cannot be updated except for their contact information. The children associated with the record cannot be unlinked.

Note: If a record requires corrections other than their contact information, please refer them to their Local Child Care Services representative who informed them of their eligibility for care.

You will only be able to update the following:
  • Phone Number
  • Make Inactive 

Note: Advise the Provider not to update the Sponsor's SMS Phone and or Email Address so that it does not affect the Sponsor's Self-Unlock method.



Non-Subsidized
A record that has been manually entered will have more fields that the provider can update. You will be able to update the following:


  • First Name
  • Middle Name
  • Last Name
  • Sponsor Type
  • Phone Number
  • Email Address
  • CIN
  • Make Inactive

Advise the Provider not to update the Sponsor's SMS Phone and or Email Address so that it does not affect the Sponsor's Self-Unlock method.

If multiple accounts need to be updated because of duplicate accounts:

The provider will need to select the old record or records by clicking on the sponsor's name and remove the phone number or make the old record inactive (for private pay records).

The provider must add the phone number to the correct ( usually newest) sponsor record.


On any old record, remove the phone number, and press Save at the top.

On the new record, the provider will enter the correct phone number and press Save. 
Once both steps have been completed, the new, correct record should appear with the latest case number and phone number listed.

Notes: 

  • Make sure the Provider refreshes the tablet before the Sponsor attempts to sign in again.
    • The tablet must be Online in order for changes in KinderConnect to appear in KinderSign.
  • Support agents must continue to assist if the Sponsor is at the location during the call.
  • A sponsor might use KinderSmart. The Support agent must confirm with the provider if the sponsor is using KinderSmart and print a new registration form.

Last Update On:05/10/2024

71.content:
The State of Texas asked all providers to fill in a survey. The State reviews the provider’s information and sends it to the registration team within the Support department. The registration team then ships tablets to eligible providers according to the list provided by TWC. 

Go Live Process:

  • On 5/17/2023, the registration team will start sending emails with the provider registration information to the providers who already received tablets. Only Providers who have already received tablets will be receiving an email in the next couple of weeks. Emails will continue to be sent to all other providers in the weeks to follow.
  • The providers who have received a tablet & email will be able to register their account in KinderConnect. Support Agents will be able to assist the providers to register their accounts. 
  • Non-tablet Providers may call stating they have not received an email from the registration team. In this case, the Support Agent will need to collect the provider's information and send it to the registration team. The registration team will send the registration email to that provider within 24-48 hours. Select the Provider Information Form button below.
  • If a provider is calling in to request a tablet, the Support Agent must ask if the Provider has filled out the survey they received from TWC@public.govdelivery.com. If the Provider says Yes, the Support Agent must inform them that the information is in the system and tablet will be sent out as soon as possible. If the Provider says No, they will need to fill out the survey sent from TWC first in order to request a tablet.

New Provider 

If there are no Operators registered yet, select the Proceed to Registration Steps button below and assist the Provider with the steps.

New providers must register first before they can log in to KinderConnect. This process can only be done once. The first person from the Provider to create an account is matched to the Provider information loaded into the TWC system.

For Support Agents: Ask for the Provider License Number and search the account in KinderConnect. Check if there's an operator already registered.

Policies

  • Providers who are using API/CMS vendors will NOT receive tablets. 
    • If the provider already received an email from the registration team select Proceed to Registration Steps button below.
  • If the Provider is requesting a tablet, select the Tablet Request Inquiries button below.
  • If the Provider is calling about a new location and wants to register their tablet to the new location, select the New License Number button below.
  • If the Provider License Number is not found in KinderConnect, select the Provider License Number Not Found button below.
  • If there are Operators already registered and they have a tablet on hand, verify their concern, and select Already Registered & Device Already Received button below.

Last Update on: 05/17/2023

74.page_title: Provider | No Child Count is Showing in KinderConnect
74.content:
If no child is showing in KinderConnect inform the Provider of the statement that applies:

1. Unfortunately, the tablet cannot be requested until you have at least one child. 

2. If no children are showing up, ask the Provider to contact us the following business day to check if the children will show up in KinderConnect.

3. If the Provider is already registered in KinderConnect, assist them with how to check if the child is already in the system.

Method 1 - Searching for the child in the Provider > Cases page. 

Select Provider > Cases from the navigation bar.



Enter the Provider name and date when the case became active or use the calendar button to select. Press Search.

The "Search Results" show all active cases as of the selected date.

Method 2 - Search for the child in the Child>Search page.

The provider can search for the child's record with or without search criteria on the search field. Make sure the current date is added under Schedule Date.

When you see the child's name show under search results, this means that there is authorization/Schedule for as of the Schedule Date selected. Click on the child's name to view more information about the authorization.
Method 3 - Search for the child in Attendance > Detail

When a subsidized child's record appears on the date/week selected, this means that there is authorization for that current date. A subsidized record typically shows the case number.

4. If the provider is not yet registered, let the provider know that they can self-register to KinderConnect. Assist with the process, if necessary.

5. Once the authorization is in the system, advise contacting the TX3c Support Center at 888-265-6461, to proceed with the tablet request.

Last Update On: 12/08/2023

In Operator Account, support can click on the Secret Question drop-down menu to read the questions available for the operator to choose.

After the Secret Question is confirmed, support can type in the answer in the Secret Answer field (remember to confirm the spelling and the case of the letters with the operator).

Press the Save button to complete the update.

Click on Provider > Search. Enter the provider's information on the search criteria, then press Search. Click on the Provider's name in the Search Results to go to the Provider page.

On the Provider > Provider page, validate the provider's Program Number and CCP ID Number.

Note: CCP ID is the 6-digit number used to access the CCIDS provider portal.

To self-unlock an account, the operator must have an email address on record in KinderConnect. 

Follow the steps below to verify if there is an email related to the Operator's Profile:

Click on Operator and select Search from the dropdown menu.
Enter the search criteria and press the Search button to find the operator.

Remember: Fewer criteria entered will give more search results. More criteria will narrow down the results.
Click on the Operator's Name in the search results to go to the Operator> Detail screen.


In the Operator> Detail screen, verify the email with the Operator to ensure the information in the system is accurate.

If the operator no longer has access to the e-mail on file, or never set up an email and needs assistance with self-unlocking.

  1. The operator will ask another operator to make changes. The Provider with the Administrator role must update the Operator account's email address. 
  2. If there are no other Provider Administrators available during the call, Click on No - Support has to unlock the account first button. The operator can then follow the process to add their new e-mail address.

79.page_title: Provider | How to Reregister The Tablet to KinderSign
79.content:
Support Agents may need to assist Providers with reregistering the tablets for KinderSign due to:
1. Provider has a new License Number

  •  When the Provider's old location is closed and re-opened under a new license number, support will assist the provider with re-registering the tablet under the new license number. 

2. Provider needs to reset the Geolocation

  • When support agents had to reset the geolocation due to issues with KinderSmart geolocation.


Part 1. Clearing the data (Old License Number Information) from the KinderSign App

Clearing the Data by Scanning the QR Code+

When to Use: This is recommended if the provider is on Kiosk mode.
Open the KinderSign App and have the provider enter their phone number and PIN.

Note: The provider must have an operator account in KinderConnect and will need to set up their account in KinderSign app before using this method.
Select the Scan QR Code menu from the list.
The provider will be prompted to scan a QR code. Click on Proceed with KinderSign Registration to continue the process.

Note that after successfully scanning the QR codes, the Device ID will automatically be removed from the old program and will be linked to the new program.



Close

Clearing the Data from Settings (App Info)+

When to Use: This is recommended if the provider is using a personal device or if they have access to the settings. This is also recommended if the tablet is mistakenly associated with a different provider, as the provider will not be able to access the KinderSign Menu. 
Press and hold on the KinderSign application.
A pop up will appear with a list of options.
Press ‘App Info’

If App Info is not available by holding the KinderSign App, you can also go to Settings > Apps > KinderSign
to get to this page.
   
From the App Info screen, Press Storage, then press Clear Data.

A warning message will appear confirming that all the data from the app will be deleted. 

After the provider acknowledges this, Press Delete.
Go to KinderSign and the provider will be prompted to scan a code.


Close

Part 2. Registering KinderSign by scanning the QR codes found on the new provider license number. 

Note: While it is not necessary to print the QR codes, please make sure that the provider has a second device like a laptop or a desktop, aside from the tablet. Using the second device, the provider will need to log on to KinderConnect and download the necessary codes.

You cannot proceed without collecting the tablet's serial number, Provider's old license number, and the new license number.

For tablets in Kiosk mode, serial numbers can be found on the back of the tablet.

For any other tablets, serial numbers can be found in Settings > About or About Tablet.

Last Update On 01/08/2024
