82.content:
Notes: 

  • Support could not unlock an operator account if the request was made by chat or email according to the security policy
  • If the operator has multiple accounts, the support agent needs to confirm the username the operator is using. 
  • Advise the Provider to remove Operator accounts that are not correctly or completely set up.

If an operator contacts the TX3c Support Center, support can follow the steps below to verify and unlock the account: 

In KinderConnect, click on Operator and select Search to perform an operator search.

Enter search criteria and press Search to find the operator.
Remember, fewer criteria entered will give more search results.

Click on Account on the operator record in the Search Results to access Operator Account.

Support needs to ask the operator's Secret Question, and the operator needs to answer it correctly to complete verification.

If the operator forgot the answer to the secret question, please select Forgot Secret Answer.

After successful verification, support can uncheck the 'Locked' field and press Save to unlock an operator account.

Note: If the account is NOT showing locked, advise to refresh the page or the device they are using to log in.

86.page_title: Provider | Non-Subsidized Child not Showing in Attendance Detail Screen
86.content:
If the provider reports that a Non-Subsidized child is not showing up on the attendance detail page, the Non-Subsidized schedule for the child might be expired. 

Note: If the provider wants to track attendance for an expired subsidized child, the provider can add a new Non-Subsidized child record instead of adding a Non-Subsidized schedule.

Support can use the steps below to guide the provider to confirm the child has an active Non-Subsidized schedule:

In KinderConnect, click on Child and then select Search to perform a child search.
Press Clear to remove all the search criteria and ensure that the Schedule Date field is empty.

Enter the search criteria and then press Search.
Click on the child's name in the search results to access the Child Detail page.
On the Child Detail page, review the Non-Subsidized Schedules
In this example, the child has a schedule from 1/1/2023 to 3/30/2023 with a status of 'Expired.'
Click on Add Non-Subsidized Schedule button to create a new schedule for the child, or click on Edit to update the duration of the current private pay schedule.
The Child Schedule window will appear; enter the desired Start/End Date.

Press OK to proceed.
Once the new schedule has been added or the End Date has been updated, it will appear on the Child Detail page.

Press Save to complete.

Last Update On 4/25/2023
86.question: Was the provider able to edit the Non-Subsidized schedule?

87.page_title: Provider | Child Not Listed On Merge Page
87.content:
If the provider cannot see the child listed on the Merge page under potential matches, then it could be because of two reasons:

Note:  For the Provider to see the child account, the Schedule Date must be within the authorization period. This is the same when searching for cases.

1. Child does not have a Non-Subsidized account

A child can have a subsidized account, but the provider hasn't created a private pay account for them. In this case, there is nothing to merge with, and the Provider should be informed.

2. Child has two subsidized accounts

A child can have two subsidized accounts created by TWC. This could happen when one account expires and TWC creates a new account with a new case number. In this case, the agent must explain to the Provider that only private pay accounts can be merged with a subsidized account.

When confirmed that child records cannot be merged, follow the below:

  1. Confirm with the Provider the reason why the records cannot be merged.
  2. Sponsor Records - Advise the Provider that they will need to attach the new record of the child to any existing sponsors if desired and add any other new sponsors as necessary. If assistance is needed, click on Linking Child to a Sponsor.

89.content:
If the Provider cannot see the Sponsor listed on the Merge page under potential matches, then it could be because of two reasons:

  1. Sponsor Does Not Have a Non-Subsidized Account
    • A Sponsor can have a subsidized account, but the Provider hasn't created a Non-Subsidized account for them. In this case, there is nothing to merge with and the Provider should be informed.
  2. Sponsor Has Two Subsidized Accounts
    • A Sponsor can have two subsidized accounts created by TWC. This could happen when one account expires and a new record has been created. 

In both cases, the Agent must explain to the Provider that only Non-Subsdized accounts can be merged with a subsidized account.

100.page_title: Provider | Payment Schedule (When will I get paid?)
100.content:
When a provider asks the question, "When will I get paid?", support should first identify the following:

  • Which service week/s is the provider referring to?
  • When did they submit the attendance?

It is important that the provider understands the payment schedule to answer this question. 

  • Service Week refers to the actual week when the provider's service to the child(ren) took place. Weeks begin on a Sunday and end on a Saturday. A complete attendance can be submitted after the end of a service week.
  • Submit Attendance Week refers to the week when the provider can submit the attendance. Note that the provider cannot submit an attendance if still in the current service week.
  • Payments Processed Day refers to the day when the payments for the submitted attendance are processed by TWC. Any attendance submitted during a week will be processed on the following Sunday. Processed payments are moved to Paid status. Once the payments are processed, providers will be paid five to seven business days later, depending on their bank.

Example of Payment Schedule:

  • Service Week - 3rd to the 9th
  • Submit Attendance Week - 10th to the 16th
  • Payment Processed Day - 17th
  • Possible Payment Day - 22nd, 25th or 26th

In the example below,  the service week of the 3rd can be submitted anytime after the 9th (end of the service week). If the attendance was submitted any day between the 10th and 16th, the payment would be processed on the 17th. The provider will receive the payment 5-7 business days from this day. In this example, it will be the 22nd, 25th, or 26th. 

  • If the payment was not received over 7 business days after checking that it was processed on the scheduled date, please guide the provider to send a payment alert.
  • If the attendance has been submitted for over a week and the payment is still in the Processing status:
    1. Guide the provider to go to the KinderConnect home page for any announcements from TWC referring to payment delays. 
    2. Confirm if there is any existing overlapping care. For more information, review the Overlapping Utilization Report.
  • If the Provider wishes to have a resource or learning material, you can refer them to the Texas info site: Submitting Attendance (Payment Schedule)

Last Update On: 04/18/2023
100.question: Did this resolve the provider's concern?

2.button_text: No - Payment was not received over 7 business days.

3.button_text: No - Payment is still in Processing status. Review Overlapping Utilization Report

102.content:
When preparing to Submit Attendance, KinderConnect notifies the user if any records conflict with an established Professional Day. They appear in red, and there is no Submit check box. 

The status column on the Submit Screen will display a message indicating that Professional day cannot be used with any other type of submitted service as listed below.

Confirm with the provider if there is supposed to be a Professional Day entered for that week and continue with either of the following:

If a Professional Day was set up incorrectly 

  • Guide the Provider to identify the day that was incorrectly set as a professional day.
  • Guide the Provider to deselect the Professional Day for each child on that day.

If the Professional Day is correct  

  • Guide the provider to review the Attendance / Detail page and confirm if recorded attendance is conflicting on the Professional day. 
    • The Professional Day attendance code cannot be combined with regular attendance or any other attendance code.
  • If a conflict is found, Support should guide the provider to clear all the records for that day including the Professional Day previously set and then guide the provider to set the date as a Professional Day again.
    • All children enrolled in the program must be marked with the Professional Day for the date in question, including children that are no longer attending but are listed in the provider’s account.

What if a program submitted attendance and claimed a professional day, then a new authorization was added later for the same week?

  • The program must ensure all attendance is entered and complete for the week and wait for the payment sweep.  They will be unable to submit attendance and unable to select the professional day. When the payment auto-sweep takes place, the attendance is submitted, and the Professional Day will automatically be added.

Last Updated 03/19/2021

103.content:
How to Download KinderSign Texas on Android devices:

Tap the Play Store icon on the tablet's Home Screen.




In the top search field, type KinderSign Texas, then tap the search button.

Once the KinderSign app is found, tap the icon to select and finally tap Install to download. (Tap Accept to initiate a download if prompted to do so).

Depending on the tablet, upon completing the download, you might need to tap Continue and proceed to the Complete account setup screen. If asked for credit card information, tap Skip.

Once the download is complete, tap Open. A message will flash on the tablet, indicating that a shortcut to KinderSign has been added to the home screen.

KinderSign by KinderSystems will appear on the screen, and your tablet will be ready to scan the registration codes.

The provider can also tap the Home button on the lower portion of the tablet to return to the home screen, locate the KinderSign icon and tap it to open the app.


How to Download KinderSign Texas on an iPad (Apple Devices):

Tap the App Store icon on the iPad home screen. If the iPad asks if the App Store may access your location, tap Allow. If the iPad asks if you want to set up Family Sharing, tap Not Now.
In the search field (top right), type KinderSign Texas, then tap the search button.

Once the KinderSign app is found, tap GET or the icon, then Install to download it. If your iPad asks you to sign into the iTunes Store, enter your Apple ID and password, then tap OK.

Agree to the iTunes terms and conditions if asked to do so. If this is a new Apple ID, tap Next to go to a series of screens labeled Complete your Apple ID. Use these screens to provide additional information, including billing information such as your address. You are not required to provide credit card details.


Note: Agree to the iTunes terms and conditions if asked to do so. If this is a new Apple ID, tap Next to go to a series of screens labeled Complete your Apple ID.

Use these screens to provide additional information, including billing information such as your address. You are not required to provide credit card details.

Once the download is complete, press Open. 
KinderSign by KinderSystems will appear on the screen.
When the iPad asks, “Allow KinderSign to use your location ?” tap Allow Once. If it asks whether you want to set up Family Sharing, tap Not now.


Last Update On: 05/02/2023

105.content:
If the issue has not been resolved and requires escalation or further troubleshooting, refer to the steps below. 

Escalation process

  1. The Agent receives a call.
  2. The Agent collects relevant information.
  3. The Agent confirms the issue with the caller.
  4. The Agent should try to troubleshoot the issue while the caller is on the phone.
  5. The Agent will create a NetSuite Case and change the status to "In Progress":
    • Record the issue details.
    • Record the steps tried before sending the request. If no troubleshooting was completed, mention that in the case.
    • Record if the issue will be escalated to the BO, Ops Managers, or anyone else.
    • Confirm the contact number, do not depend on the contact info in NS.
    • Confirm the best times to call to the caller back.
    • If the County Call Form was used, copy/paste from the form to the NS case.
  6.  Fill out the request form to the Back-office below:

Notes:

  • After escalating an issue, Support Agents may continue to troubleshoot the issue without signing out of the queue. This will give the agent a chance to learn to troubleshoot in the future. Do not do any updates in Staging.
  • Before escalating, Support Agents should review the previous cases and verify if the issue has already been escalated.

For Device Issues, please obtain the following information:

  • Device type
  • App version
    • This can be found on the sign-in page of KinderSign, KinderSmart, KinderConnect
  • Operating System (iOS or Android)
  • Operating System Version Number
    • This can be found under Device Settings > About
    • Type N/A if not applicable. Example: Tablet is in Kiosk Mode
  • Screenshot error
  • First time of occurrence
  • Have they seen this issue before
  • Steps for reproduction
  • What happens when support reproduces
  • Are there any other customers experiencing the issue

Note: In normal circumstances, a Back Office Agent will get back to you within 24-48 hours.

Last Updated On: 04/17/2023

107.content:
Primary Sponsor (Subsidized Account)

Primary Sponsor records are created by TWC. The record can be identified by going to the Sponsor Detail page.

The primary sponsor's information cannot be updated except for their contact information. The children associated with the record cannot be unlinked.  

Note: If a record requires corrections other than their contact information, please refer them to their Local Child Care Services representative who informed them of their eligibility for care.

Additional/Non-Subsidized Sponsors

The Non-Subsidized sponsor accounts are created by the providers. The record can be identified by going to the Sponsor Detail page.

The additional/non-subsidized sponsor's information can be updated. The children associated with the record can be unlinked. 

If the Non-Subsidized sponsors are not shown in the search results, the sponsor may need to be created by the provider first.

Notes: 

  • When an update is made in KinderConnect, the support agent must always ask the provider if the sponsor is available to test during the call. 
  • If you notice there is no phone number listed in the search result, inform the caller that the Provider will need to log in and update the record with a phone number if the Sponsor wishes to use KinderSign.

Sponsors can experience different levels of account issues. The potential reasons for these issues are:

  • Sponsors are not able to log in to KinderSign
    1. Sponsor is locked out of account
    2. Sponsor is entering incorrect phone number
    3. Sponsor is using the wrong account
  • Sponsors unable to log attendance for children
    1. Childrens subsidy expired
    2. Child is not assigned to Sponsor in KinderConnect

Last Update On: 05/10/2024
107.question: What is the issue with the Sponsors account?

108.content:
Before adding a Sponsor, support should note that:

  • The Sponsor to be added does not already have an existing account. 
  • The child's record has already been added or already appears in the system first before adding a Sponsor. 
  • School-aged children can have their own Sponsor account to sign themselves and their school-aged siblings in and out.

Providers can add sponsors in KinderConnect by going to the Sponsor > Detail page.

How to Add a Sponsor

Select the Sponsor activity from the navigation bar. 
Select Detail from the dropdown menu.
Press New.
Note: It is important to ensure the provider is pressing New and the form has been cleared to avoid overriding information for another sponsor. 

If the Provider was previously looking at or working with another Sponsor record, Step 1 will default the Provider to the Detail screen for that Sponsor. 
Enter the information about the Sponsor into the fields.  You can navigate from field to field using the tab key or by clicking on each field. 
Note: All fields marked with a red star are required. The phone number is not marked with a red star, but a phone number is required for Sponsors using KinderSign to sign in.
Advise Provider to leave SMS Phone and Email Address blank. So the  Sponsor can choose their own Self-Unlock method.
Once all required fields are filled, press Add Children.
Use the search fields to enter specific information to locate the child or children related to the Sponsor that is being created. Press Search.
Select the child or children and press OK. 
Note: If the child has multiple records, the Provider must select all accounts. 
Next to the child/children's name, select the Relationship of the Sponsor to the child.
Press Save to complete registration.

Once the record is saved the tablet must be Online and refreshed for the update in KinderConnect to appear in KinderSign.

Last Updated 12/11/2023

109.content:
There are instances when a Provider starts providing childcare services while the subsidy authorization is being processed. To record attendance, the Provider must create a record for the child as Non-Subsidized. If there has never been a record, then the provider will also have to create the Sponsor record to record attendance.

Once the authorization has been processed, the record will be imported into KinderConnect. The child's record and the Sponsor will then have two records, one for subsidized care (that was automatically imported into the system by TWC) and another for Non-Subsidized care (which the provider created). 

When merging the two accounts, any attendance that was recorded using the created Sponsor account will be merged with the new Subsidy account, according to the authorization dates.

Note: A subsidized record cannot be merged with another subsidized record.


How to Merge Sponsor Records

To Merge a Sponsor account with the subsidized Sponsor record, follow the steps below:

Navigate to the Sponsor and select Merge in the drop-down menu or navigate to Provider and select Merge 

Click on the radio button next to the Authorized Parent name you would like to merge to generate a list of all Potential Matches.

If no matching Sponsor/Parent Records are found, the list displays all potential Records indicating the reason for this result in bold red letters.
Click on the radio button next to the Parent name under "Potential Matches" to select the record to be merged into the first Parent record selected.

If the correct record isn't available, select All eligible parents.
Press Accept Match 

Verify the Parent records to be merged are correct and press Confirm Merge to confirm the potential match.

KinderConnect issues a message informing you that the merge was successfully completed. Press OK.

Last Update On: 04/28/2023
109.question: Was the provider able to merge the sponsor records?

1.button_text: No- Sponsor not Listed on Merge page

114.content:
Before requesting a replacement tablet, support must diagnose the main issue and perform the required troubleshooting steps. Below are some of the common errors that providers are experiencing. 

Please complete the following troubleshooting steps if applicable.

Device Issue
Possible cause
Troubleshooting Steps
Recommended Solution

A broken tablet.

 

None. 

Send a request to replace the tablet. 

The screen repeatedly shows the Samsung Galaxy Tab A logo, which fails to boot. 

Cyclic reboot issue.

None.

Send a request to replace the tablet. 

The touchscreen doesn't work. 

Talkback mode enabled.


If the screen is pressed, the tablet vocalizes what was pressed; a message appears onscreen to swipe with two fingers, a blue box appears around pressed icons, and Talkback mode is enabled.


Option 1. If the "TalkBack shortcut" is ENABLED in the Settings (Accessibility > TalkBack):

Hold volume up and volume down simultaneously until a notification that Talkback mode is disabled appears.

Option 2. If the "TalkBack shortcut" is DISABLED in the Settings (Accessibility > TalkBack):


A. Guide the provider to go to the Settings >Accessibility > TalkBack > switch OFF 

B. Settings > Accessibility > Vision > Voice Assistant > switch OFF. 

They need to use two fingers to find Settings and double-tap to select an item in both cases. 

The browser crashes, "KinderConnect crashes"

The browser doesn't close the tabs on exit; multiple tabs fill up the available memory. 

Have the provider check for open tabs in the browser. 

Guide the provider through closing tabs, and encourage them to close tabs before exiting the browser. If closing the open tabs doesn’t resolve the problem,  proceed to 'Troubleshooting- Knox profile update" below. 

More than one tablet exhibits the same behavior in the same location. 

Likely a local cause, not the issue of the tablet. 

Take notes on the behavior of the devices. Ask the provider about other devices not related to CCBIS. Troubleshoot one tablet and see if your solution works on the next. 

Regular troubleshooting steps should be applied.

12000 code error.

Interrupted Knox update.

 

Factory reset. 

Tablet won't power on. 

Discharged battery. 

Ensure the charger and cable are working; test on other devices if possible. Plug the tablet into the known good charger, and watch for the lightning bolt or numerical charge indicator. Let it charge for 5-10 minutes before checking. 

Send a request to replace the tablet or charger, whichever is needed. 

An immersion warning appears when charging.

 

 

Power tablet on before charging. If the issue persists, replace the tablet.

App/Icons are missing.
The shortcut is removed from the home screen.
Search for the app by swiping up on the home screen to see all apps installed.
Suppose the app is present; long-press (Hold) on the app until a menu appears. Select add to home from the menu.
If the App is missing completely, proceed to 'Troubleshooting- Knox profile update" below.
The tablet is stuck on the download page with the message "Downloading Please Do Not Turn Off Device."

Force the tablet to shut down by pressing and holding down the following buttons in order: the Volume Down Button, the Home Button, and the Power Button. Once all three are held down, the tablet should restart and function normally.

The provider gets the error (Access denied) when using the tablet browser.
The error will be generated when the provider tries to access a website (not on
the white list).

Inform the provider about the restriction when loading a webpage aside from KinderConnect.
The tablet is stuck on a White Screen.

When accessing KinderSign, the app never loads; it just freezes on a blank white screen.
Exit the app completely (follow the same steps as when you refresh the app to ensure it is shut down fully and not just minimized), then re-open the app.
The tablet is stuck on the loading page during the KinderSign Registration
Poor or no internet connection.
Walk the provider through checking that the tablet is connected to wifi. If connected, follow the steps in handling the offline tablet.
Go to Device Offline.
The tablet is stuck on the loading page during the KinderSign Registration
It could be an issue with the App cache
Walk the provider through cleaning the KinderSign cache
Go to Clearing Apps Cache
The provider gets a message "Security Policy
Prevents use of Home Key" when pressing the Home key.
This appears when a Knox update is in progress or has not been completed.
Support should assist the provider to complete or do another Knox Profile update. Make sure that the tablet is connected to the internet. 
Go to  Troubleshooting - Knox Profile Update

Last Update On: 06/16/2022

0.button_text: Yes - Device Issue has been Resolved

120.content:
The purpose of customized schedules is to identify when the children are NOT in the provider's care because they're attending school or other activities. However, payment issues may arise in relation to these schedules, and below are the common issues that result in incorrect payments:


1. Provider entered incorrect hours to the customized schedule/ Provider mistakenly created a Customized Schedule for a non-school-age child.

2. Child has conflicting schedules.

3. Attendance swept with no customized schedule assigned to the child.


How to Troubleshoot:

Navigate to the Child > Search page and search for the child with a payment issue.
Click on the child's name. This will lead you to the Child > Detail page.
Check if the Customized Schedule was created correctly and if the hours are entered properly.
If the hours are not entered properly, press the Incorrect Hours in Schedule button.
If there are two schedules with conflicting dates and different hours, press the Child Has Conflicting Schedules button.
If there is no schedule at all, then click on Attendance Swept - No Customized Schedule button.


Last Update On: 03/03/2023

123.content:
Viewing Family Information

The TX3c Support Center nor the TWC help desk can make any changes to a family case in the eligibility system. Only the State workers/State Helpdesk workers can make case changes. The sponsor must contact their State Helpdesk workers to request changes. The changes made by TWC or the State workers/State Helpdesk workers take effect in KinderConnect the next business day. 

Note: If the caller has questions regarding the Family information or they are reporting that it needs correction, refer them to notify their Local Child Care Services representative who informed them of eligibility for care.


To view family information, follow the instructions below:

Select Provider > Cases from the navigation bar
Enter the date when the case became active or use the calendar button to select.
Press Search.
The "Search Results" show all active cases as of the selected date.
You can also view the family's co-pay history by clicking View under the Co-pay History column header.

Fees display the copayment amount the Parent needs to pay the Provider.


Last Update On: 05/09/2024

125.content:
The Child > Detail page contains all relevant information pertaining to the Subsidized Child's authorization. 

Child ID displays the unique ID number that the system generates for each Child.

First Name, Middle Name, Last Name, and Date of Birth display the child's information. This information came from the state system and cannot be modified. 

Phone Number is an optional field that can be added or updated by the Provider. 

Child Type displays the type of child, whether Subsidized or Non-Subsidized.

CIN displays the Child Identification Number. This information came from the state system and cannot be modified. 

Subsidized Schedules display the Subsidized Schedules that have been created for the selected Child.

Note: If the caller states that new authorizations have been added, but they aren't appearing on the Subsidized Schedule, support agents should ask when the authorizations were created. Authorizations that were added today will appear in KinderConnect the next day.

  • Provider displays the Program's name the child is authorized for.
  • Date Range  display the date range of the authorization. 
  • Status shows the state of the authorization. This could be Active (authorization is current), Expired (authorization ended).

Notes:

  • If the caller has questions regarding the Child's authorization information or they are reporting that it needs correction, refer them to notify their

    Local Child Care Services representative who informed them of eligibility for care.

  • If a subsidized child is not appearing in the system and the Provider states the child should have authorization or have paperwork that the child has an active authorization, please click on “JIRA Authorized Children not Appearing in KC.”


Last Update On: 05/10/2024

126.content:
Walk the Provider through the following steps:

1. Open your web browser and enter the web address
https://childcare.twc.texas.gov/KinderConnect/ Sign Up.

Note: Inform the caller we recommend NOT using Internet Explorer. Please use another browser such as Google Chrome, Firefox, Edge, or Safari
Step 1: Click on the appropriate radio button to indicate that you are registering as a Provider.
Step 2: Enter the information in the required fields.
    • First and last name of the person registering
    •  License number
    • Verification Code

After entering the required information, press Verify.


  • Step 3: Once all information is entered from the Step 2 match, it goes to the final step. 
Note: Username cannot contain special characters or spaces. Otherwise, whenever trying to reset the password the OTP will not be sent or received.
  • Enter all the required information. Take note of the password requirements to avoid errors. Password requirements:
  • Password length must be between 8 and 15 characters long.
  • Password must contain the required number of digits: 1
  • Password must contain the required number of lowercase and uppercase letters: Lowercase: 1 Uppercase: 1
  • Password must contain the required number of special characters: 1.
  • The password will expire every 365 days.
  • Press Create Account.

A message will appear indicating that the account was created successfully. It provides you with a link to return to the KinderConnect Login page.

After completing the registration, advise the Provider to sign in to confirm a successful login.


After successful registration. Support must verify the below to proceed with the following steps:

  • Relative In-Home Providers must set up an IVR. If needed, verify if the provider is on the Relative In-home Provider IVR list 
    • If the Provider is on the list proceed to  Yes- Relative In-home Provider
  • Non-API or not approved API users, select Yes - Provider was able to register and log in. Tablet Registration Steps. 
    • If the provider hasn't received the tablet yet and wants to start recording attendance, suggest that the Sponsors can use KinderSmart. Select Yes - Provider was able to register and log in. Proceed to KinderSmart Registration
  • Approved API users, select Yes - Provider was able to register and log in. Proceed to Set Up New API

Note: If the Provider states that they have not received a tablet, select Check Tablet Status.


Last Update On: 12/13/2023

128.content:
Currently, there is a high demand for tablets, and requests are being handled in the order they are received. The tablet team will send them out as soon as they become available. Support Agents can advise using a personal tablet or KinderSmart until the state-provided tablet is received.

Tablet Request Form

This form collects all the information needed for all your tablet requests (New tablet, Additional Tablet, Replacement Tablet, and tablet Returns).

  1. The Support agent who receives the email, call, voicemail, or chat regarding the tablet request will create the case. They will set the case to In Progress status.
  2. The Tablet Team monitors the request regularly.
  3. Once the request is completed, they will add any necessary notes to the case. The Tablet team will close the case once the request is completed.
    • Currently, there is a high demand for tablets, and requests are being handled in the order they are received. The tablet team will send them out as soon as they become available. Support Agents can advise using a personal tablet or KinderSmart until the state-provided tablet is received.
  4. We do not ship tablets to PO boxes. Signatures are required. 
  5. We do not ship tablets to an address that is not in Kinderconnect or KinderTrack. If an address change is needed, Providers must contact TWC first to update the address. If the Provider has shipment-related concerns or special requests, please contact Raul Tejeda. 

Proof of Delivery Request

1. If USPS shows that the package is in Delivered status, but the Provider is stating they have not received the package, explain to the Provider that a Proof of Delivery will be requested from the Inventory team.

2. Please make sure to fill out the Provider's first name, last name, and email address. 

3. Support Agents must enter all the information obtained in the case.

4. Once reviewed, the Inventory team will update the case.

Last Updated On: 12/07/2023

129.content:
An operator with a Provider Administrator operator type must log in to KinderConnect to add a new operator.

To add a new operator:

Click on Operator and select Detail from the drop-down menu in KinderConnect.
Press New to add a new record and enable the fields for editing.
Enter the information for the operator in the required fields.

Operator Type: 

Provider Administrator: Full access

Provider User: Limited access


Click on Add Provider to assign the operator to the provider.

In the Select Provider window, press Search to display all providers associated with the operator that is creating a new operator account.

Select one or more providers in the search results.
Press OK to proceed.
Verify that the provider was added to the Operator Detail page.
Press Save to proceed.
Click on Operator and select Account from the drop-down menu in KinderConnect.
Enter the Username and Password for a new operator.

The Password should meet the following criteria:
  • The password length must be at least 8 characters
  • The password must contain the required amount of digits: 1
  • The password must contain the required amount of lowercase letters: 1
  • The password must contain the required amount of uppercase letters: 1 
  • Password must contain the required number of special characters: 1
Check the Reset Password check box to force the operator to change their password the first time they log in. Advise the new operator to also change their secret question and answer for added security. 

Check the Registered check box to enable their account.
Press Save to complete.

Signing in for the first time:

Have the new operator enter their user name and password on the KinderConnect sign-in page to access KinderConnect for the first time.

Last Update on 10/04/2023
129.question: Is the new operator available to test signing in?

130.content:
Tablet Return

Providers may contact support to return tablets because they are ending their contract with the State or they will be using KinderBridge (API). 

Before sending the requests, make sure to identify and discuss the following with the provider:

  1. Confirm how the provider wants to receive the return label (email or mail).

    • If the provider wants the label emailed, ask for the Email address. 

    • If the provider wants the label mailed, ask for their mailing address and if they would like to receive a box to return the device.

      • Note: We cannot send return labels to an address not in KinderConnect or KinderTrack.  If the provider has concerns or special requests, please contact the Texas TL/CCSM. 

  2. Inform the provider that return labels and packages will be sent within 24-28 business hours of receipt of the request.

 KinderBridge (API) Providers

  • If the Provider received a tablet and they are using KinderBridge (API), Support must confirm the CCMS vendor is certified and integrated and proceed with the tablet return by clicking on the Proceed to Tablet Return Request button.
  • If the provider receives a tablet and is NOT an approved CCMS, support agents must advise the provider to KEEP the tablets until their CCMS vendor is certified and integrated with KinderConnect. 
  • If the Provider uses other CCMS vendors, they must ask their CCMS vendor to contact us at partners@kindersystems.com and request to certify with KinderConnect.

Providers with New Location/License Number

If the Provider keeps the same tablet and states the old location is closed and re-opened under a new license number, DO NOT proceed with the tablet return request. Instead, select the New Location/License Number button below to guide the provider with the re-registration of the tablet.

132.content:
An Operator can unlock their own account directly from the login page when the system locks access due to reaching the maximum incorrect login attempts. 

The steps are below: 


After unsuccessful login attempts to KinderConnect, a message displays
'Your account is locked.'
Press Unlock Account to proceed.
The system will issue a message informing you that an email has been sent to the email address on record for the account. 

If the operator did not receive an email to unlock the account,  have the provider check their spam inbox or press Resend Email to try again. 
Open the email and click on the link provided.
If the password reset link has expired, KinderConnect will generate a warning message. 
Click on 'Return to Login Screen' and follow the first step to initiate the process to unlock an account again.
Once the link is opened the Reset Password page displays. 
Enter a new password as instructed, then re-enter the new password to verify. 

Note: The Operator can choose to change their secret Q&A by selecting the secret question dropdown and enter the corresponding secret answer.

Press Reset Password to complete.
A message 'Your password has been updated' displays.
Press Close to return to log on screen.


Note: All passwords will automatically expire every 365 days and will require to be reset.

Last Update On 4/28/2023
132.question: Was the provider able to unlock their account successfully?

133.page_title: Provider | Linking a Child to a Sponsor
133.content:
Before proceeding to link a child to a sponsor, confirm the below two conditions are met:

  • The Child account exists and has active authorization. 
    • If the child record does not exist, then the provider can add a new Non-Subsidized child account. To do this, click on the Add Non-Subsidized Child button below.
  • The Sponsor Account exists.
    • If the sponsor account does not exist, then the provider can add a new sponsor account. To do this, click on the Add New Sponsor button below.

If the above two conditions are met, proceed to Linking Child to Sponsor.

Last Update On: 04/26/2023

134.content:
When there's an update made in KinderConnect, the provider should refresh the data from the KinderSign app. A stable Wi-Fi connection is required to refresh the KinderSign App successfully. The App will refresh automatically if a user successfully logs into the device automatically.

The App could be refreshed manually by Closing the App on the tablet and opening it back (a staff member or a sponsor can do this).

How to Properly Refresh the Tablet

Note: Depending on the model of the tablet, the button to show the Recent Applications may vary.
Models with Physical Buttons: Locate and press the Recent Applications button on the face of the tablet in the bottom left-hand corner.
Models with Digital Buttons: Tap the three vertical lines located at the bottom left-hand corner of the screen to open the Recent Applications.

Select Close All at the bottom of the screen.


Open the KinderSign app and attempt to log in.
Confirm with the caller that the KinderSign app is showing Online.


Other Ways to Refresh Tablet

When the steps above cannot be done by the caller, support can also suggest doing the following:

  1. The provider uses their telephone number & pin combination to access the Staff Menu and select the Refresh Data option.
  2. Turn the tablet off and then back on (a staff member or a sponsor can do this). 


Last Update On: 12/05/2022

150.content:
Notes: 

  • If the operator has a saved email address in KinderConnect, a one-time password (OTP) will be sent to their email before resetting the password. Otherwise, the operator will be asked to verify their secret answer.  
  • If the operator is not receiving the email/OTP, please refer to Password Reset Errors 3.

Use the guide below to instruct the operators to reset their passwords.

From the log-in page, Select Forgot Password? 
Type your username in the "User Name" field and press Continue.
FOR OPERATORS WITH EMAIL ADDRESS


A one-time password (OTP) will be sent to the operator's email address before resetting the password.
FOR OPERATORS WITH EMAIL ADDRESS


Ask the provider to go to the inbox of their email address, and look for an email with the subject Password Reset Requested. Copy or write down the OTP.

(Sometimes, the operator may have to check their Spam or Junk inbox if not found in their regular inbox.)

FOR OPERATORS WITH EMAIL ADDRESS

Go back to KinderConnect and type the 6 characters OTP that they received in their e-mail. Press Verify.

If the operator did not receive an e-mail, they might try again by pressing Resend Email. 

Note: OTP expires when a new request is sent or when the operator clicks on Resend Email. Therefore, operators must ensure they use the OTP from the last e-mail received. 

After the OTP was verified, the operator will be prompted to enter the new password in the "Password" and "Verify Password" fields. Press Reset Password.

Advise the operator of the password requirements listed at the top of the page. They also cannot use the same password they have used in their last four password resets.  Password requirements are also listed below.

Password length must be between 8 and 15 characters long.
Password must contain the required amount of digits: 1
Password must contain the required amount of lowercase and uppercase letters: Lowercase: 1 Uppercase: 1
Password must contain the required amount of special characters: 1
If the password entered meets all the requirements, you should be greeted with a message stating the password has been reset. Press Close to return to the log-in screen and attempt to log in.

Password Reset Errors

Error 1: Cannot Save Operator Data  
 
While resetting the password, you may receive this error message. This message will be displayed differently based on the caller's device but will retain the same message.  
  
This message appears if the password used does not meet one or more of the password requirements.  
  
Advise the caller to close the message and attempt to enter their new password again, paying close attention to the password requirements.  
Error 2: Cannot Save Operator Data  
  
While resetting the password, you may receive this error message. This message will be displayed differently based on the caller's device but will retain the same message.  
  
This message appears if the password used contains the word "password" or the operator's username.  
  
Advise the caller to close the message and attempt to enter their new password again, paying close attention to not use the word "password" or their username.  
Error 3: Unable to Verify OTP


If the operator receives this error, advise double-checking that they are correcting typing the OTP. This is not case-sensitive. 


If it is typed correctly, advise the operator to ensure that it is the OTP from the most recent e-mail received. Note that OTP expires when a new request is sent or when the operator presses Resend Email.

Error 4: Not Receiving email/OTP

If the Provider is not receiving their email/OTP Support Agents should verify the username on file is the one the Provider is using and ensure that the Provider is in the correct KinderConnect website (KinderConnect Texas in this case).

To verify the username select No - Provider Needs Username Assistance.

If the support agent verifies the username is correct, but the Provider still has not received the email/OTP, Support may offer the Provider to have the OTP sent to a different email. Support must verify the secret Q&A before updating the email address.

Please be advised a username cannot contain special characters or spaces; otherwise, whenever trying to reset the password the OTP will not be sent or received. 
Support Agents must assist in removing any special characters or spaces in the Username if necessary.


Note: If the operator no longer has access to the e-mail on file and or they need assistance with a password reset:

  • Verify the secret Q&A
  • Update the email on file

This will allow the operator to reset their password from the login screen and gain access to the system. Once completed, proceed by selecting No - Support has to unlock the account first. The operator can then follow the process to add their new e-mail address.


Last Update On 01/24/2024

159.content:
Aside from creating operators in KinderConnect, the Operator > Detail page is also used to maintain the Operator information, including name, email address, telephone number, photo, etc.

Updating Operator's Information

From Operator> Search, search, and select the operator you want to edit.

The Provider can make the necessary changes as desired, then press Save.

Note: If the operator account is locked, the operator cannot update the email address, the support agent can help and update the email address if the secret question was answered correctly.

A Provider Administrator operator can also update another operator account if needed. 

If the Operator Detail page is empty, it means their account was not set up completely.


Deleting an Operator/ Making Operator Inactive

  • This action should be done by the Providers. Support agents should never modify Live accounts.
  • Before deleting an operator account or making it inactive, support needs to confirm with the operator the account they are using and whether an account is set up for them to log in. The operator could be using the same account they want to be removed. 
  • It is recommended to make the operator's account inactive. 

From Operator > Search, search, and select the operator you want to delete.

Press Delete.

The system prompts you to confirm the deletion. Press OK to proceed. 

Note: Remind the provider that once the record has been deleted, the record can no longer be retrieved. 

Operators with any history in KC cannot be deleted, only made inactive to prevent future system usage.

If deleting the account cannot be done, suggest making the record inactive instead. 

From the Operator > Detail page, click inside the Inactive box to mark it as inactive.

 


A Record Saved message will be displayed to confirm the update. 


Updating Operator's Account

Support agents must not make any changes to the Operator's information. 

Support agents can check the Registered box if unchecked. Support agents must verify the secret question and answer with the Operator before making this update. 

A Provider Administrator operator can also update another operator account if needed. 

If the Operator Detail page is empty, it means their account was not set up completely.



Uploading Picture


From Operator > Search, search, and select the operator you want to upload the picture for.

Press Upload Picture.

Locate and select the picture you would like to upload and press Open.
The system uploads the selected picture to the Operator Detail page.


The Delete Picture button activates, allowing you to delete the picture anytime. You can repeat the previous steps to upload a different picture.

Last Update On: 11/03/2023
159.question: Was the provider able to update information successfully?

1.button_text: No. An error was found - Escalate Call

161.content:
The Attendance > Transactions activity of KinderConnect allows the user to review details of all attendance transactions performed at a Provider during a selected reporting period.

How to View & Export Attendance Transactions

Click on Transactions under Attendance.

Enter the desired search parameters to locate the transactions you want to review. Press Search.

To narrow the results, select the Start and End Date, Sponsor, Children, Status, etc. 
Note: The more criteria you add, the more specific your search results will be.
The Search Results show details of all attendance transactions matching the selected search parameters.
Press Clear if you would like to delete the current search parameters and enter new ones.


The Export button appears when a search completes if it generates Search Results—Press Export to open and export the results in CSV format for additional review.



The CSV export file displays on the lower left side of your screen. Click on the file name to open the Search Results using Microsoft Excel.

Note: Depending on your browser, the steps to open the file after the Export completes might differ.


Last Update On: 06/06/2023

162.content:
Support can assist an operator with their username in KinderConnect as long as the Operator meets the following requirements:

  • The secret question is answered correctly. 
  • The request was not made by chat or email.
  • The caller is the Operator of the account. If the person on the line is not the person listed in the account, support can say: "Our security policy is such that we must speak to the person who owns the account."
  • If the Operator has provided their username, Support can verify if it is correct. However, if the operator has the incorrect username or has no idea what their username is, Support will need to verify their secret question and answer before providing them with the correct username.

How to Verify the Operator's Username:

In KinderConnect, click on Operator and select Search to perform an operator search.
Enter the search criteria and press the Search button to find an Operator.
Remember, fewer criteria entered will give more search results.
Click on Account on the Operator record in the Search Results to access Operator Account.
Support needs to ask the Operator's Secret Question, and the Operator needs to answer it correctly to complete verification.
If the Operator forgot the answer to the secret question, please select Forgot Secret Answer.
After verification is successful, support can provide the username.

If able, assist the Provider in making sure they can log in with their credentials.

Last Update On:01/22/2024

164.page_title: Provider | Advance Searching For A Child (for Support only)
164.content:
There are various reasons why a child will not show up for a provider when they perform a search:

  • The child is authorized with a different location for the same provider
  • The child is authorized with a different provider
  • The Child has no Authorization

Before referring the provider to TWC regarding the child's authorization, you will need to follow the below steps to confirm if the child has authorization or not:

Select the Child > Search option from the navigation bar.


Press Clear before entering the search criteria.

Note: The provider's name & the scheduled date will be blank.

  • Enter the child's first & last name.
  • The more information you enter, the fewer results you will see.
  • Spaces before and after search criteria will affect search results.
  • For hyphenated names, it is recommended to only enter the first name(before the hyphen).
  • Press Search.

Children who meet the search criteria are displayed in the Search Results.

Note: Focus on the subsidized accounts.



Scenario 1

The child has only one account:

  • Click on a child’s name in the Child Name column to navigate to the corresponding Child > Detail page.




Confirm the Authorization dates and the provider name:

  • If the child's authorization expired, refer the provider to TWC.
  • If the child has active authorization, ensure the provider doesn't have a second location, or the child might be authorized with a different provider.
    • If one of the above applies inform the provider that the child has active authorization but not with them or the child is not assigned to the correct location, and refer the provider to TWC.
Note: If the child is attending at a different provider, do not share where the child is attending care.
Scenario 2
The child might have more than one account:
  • Confirm the provider's name.
  • Click on a child’s name in the Child Name column to navigate to the corresponding Child > Detail page.


Confirm the Authorization dates and the provider name:

  • If the child's authorization expired, refer the provider to County TWC.
  • If the child has active authorization, ensure the provider doesn't have a second location, or the child might be authorized with a different provider. 
    • If one of the above applies, inform the provider that the child has active authorization but is not with them or the child is not assigned to the correct location, and refer the provider to TWC.

In the example shown on the left, the child has active authorization at Rug Rats Care (1234)


If a Provider states they are not seeing a child, Support agents must check to see if the Provider is listed in multiple regions. If so, they may need to select a different location to be able to view specific children.



Last Update On: 07/21/2023

0.button_text: Child has an active authorization. End of Call.

165.content:
Sometimes, providers call in requesting a status update for their delivery. When the Tablet Team ships an item, a tracking number is created. This tracking number can be used to update the provider regarding their delivery. 

Support can provide the Provider's tracking number following the steps below:

Finding the Tracking Number in NetSuite

From NetSuite, search for the Customer using the Global Search. 
Go to the Customer Record.
From the Customer record page, select the Sales tab, under Items Purchased in the drop-down menu select KS Item Orders.
Under the KS Item Orders, it will list the Tracking Number & serial number in this section.

Copy the tracking number and open up a web browser.

Note: If you cannot find the tracking number, it is possible that the tablet was shipped during the early stages of shipments, which requires a different method to track. Please refer to the steps below to proceed with the alternative tracking method.


Finding the Tracking Number in NetSuite (Alternative Method)

In Netsuite, search for the Customer using the global search. 
Scroll down to the subtabs and select Communication. Under Communication, select User Notes.

If the tablet was shipped, the tablet shipping information will be posted in this section as shown below.

The memo contains the tracking number for the tablet. The provider must be given this information by the support agent.

If the Communication > User Notes section does not have any tablet shipping information, Support Agents must check the Support Notes to verify if a Support Agent has already submitted a Provider Information Form. If the first note was one week or older, the Agent must submit a Back Office ticket.

Note: Currently, there is a high demand for tablets, and requests are being handled in the order they are received. The tablet team will send them out as soon as they become available. Support Agents can advise using a personal tablet or KinderSmart until the state-provided tablet is received.

Tracking USPS Package

Using a web browser, search for Track USPS. 

NOTE: Return Box Tracking is normally not tracked. If follow-up is needed regarding a return box, contact the Tablet team by Teams. 

BingGoogle
Type or Copy & Paste in the tracking number and press Track.

For Quick Information, you can provide details from this search page.
For more detailed information, you can click on the data from the usps.com link.
You can provide the current status and select more details from the drop-down like tracking history.


  • If you cannot find the tracking number or there is no tablet request, contact the Tablet Team via email between 7 am - 5 pm CT. 
    • If the Tablet Team confirms there is no tablet request, then the Provider needs to contact State Helpdesk at tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov
    • If the Tablet Team is unavailable during the call or the call is outside the operation hours, send an e-mail to the Tablet Team
  • If USPS shows that the package is in Delivered status, but the provider is stating they have not received the package, explain to the provider that a Proof of Delivery can be requested from the Tablet team. 
  • For any other tablet delivery issues that are not mentioned above, send an e-mail to the Tablet Team.


Last Update on 11/14/2023
165.question: Was the caller's issue resolved?

2.button_text: No - Request for Proof of Delivery.

3.button_text: No - Send Email to Tablet Team

167.content:
Relative In-home providers are family members who are eligible to care for subsidized children at home. The provider will only use Interactive Voice Recognition or IVR a phone-based system that does not require access to the Internet, to track attendance. IVR can be used on a cellphone or a landline phone. Ex. Press 1 to clock the child in. IVR only logs live attendance and cannot enter backdated times.

New Relative In-home Provider

When a Relative In-home Provider calls in for the first time, Support Agents will need to assist the new Relative In-home Provider to receive an email with a verification code to be able to register in KinderConnect. Select New Relative In-home Provider for the following steps.

Requirements for Using IVR

IVR requires the sponsors to call from the Provider's phone and to be able to log their children in and out of care:

  • Must be a Landline or Mobile phone
  • Active Phone Service
  • IVR attendance must be recorded at the provider's location
  • Each provider staff using IVR must have an Operator Account with a phone number saved. 
  • When troubleshooting, note that providers may need to use a different phone for guidance with IVR.
  • After the IVR setup is completed, KinderSmart and KinderSign cannot be used for tracking attendance.

Initial IVR Provider Steps

  1. After KinderConnect Registration, the Support Agent must check that the Provider has a phone number saved in the Provider > Detail page. Select IVR Provider Setup for the steps.
  2. The Provider must check that the Sponsor has the correct phone number in their account saved in the Sponsor > Detail page. Select IVR Sponsor Setup for the steps.

Note: Relative In-Home Providers will not receive a tablet. IVR Providers are not allowed to use KinderSign or KinderSmart and must use IVR. In case they have further questions regarding this policy, Support Agents should refer the Provider to contact the State Help Desk.

Last Update On: 04/04/2024
167.question: Select the best option related to the provider's question

6.button_text: Update / Change Provider IVR Phone Number

168.content:
Before using IVR, the Provider must self-register first to KinderConnect. Support Agents must confirm the IVR phone number that they will use.

Click Search under Provider.
Enter the appropriate search criteria into the available fields, then press Search.
Click on the Provider name to select.
On the Provider Detail page, the phone number displayed in the IVR Phone Number field shows the number that the Sponsors will be calling from.

Note: The telephone number cannot be blocked. It can be a landline or a mobile phone.

After the Provider confirms the IVR phone number in the system is correct, Support Agents must do the following steps:

  1. Delete the existing IVR phone number
  2. Save the change
  3. Re-enter the IVR phone number
  4. Save the change again
  5. Advise the Provider that this resets the IVR phone number in the system to activate it, but it will take up to 10 minutes for the reset to update. 
  6. Support Agent must advise once the reset is done, the Provider must set up their IVR PIN (This is currently not needed in TX, once Professional Days are instated, please follow this step).

Note: For further assistance, contact Support. The Provider may need to use a different phone line in order for the Support Agent to assist. 

Last Update On 02/02/2024

Before a sponsor can record attendance using IVR, verify with the provider if a phone number is added in KinderConnect. If the phone number needs to be added or updated, walk the provider through the steps using the instructions below:


Click Search under Sponsor.

Note: If the Sponsor is not found, the Provider may need to add a new Sponsor record in KinderConnect that includes the Sponsor’s telephone number. 

For instructions on creating an additional sponsor account, go to Adding New Sponsors.
Enter the Phone Number the Caretaker/Sponsor will use to authenticate identity.

Press Save.

170.content:
There may also be technical issues in KinderSign app, Support must identify the following:

  • Confirm the error message that the Sponsor is seeing
  • Confirm the actions that the Sponsor is doing every time they encounter the issue
  • Confirm if the tablet is connected to the internet
  • Confirm that the KinderSign app is showing online

Note: The troubleshooting steps and resolution can only be made if the provider is available. 

Issue/Error

Description

Solution

Time Sync ErrorTablet requesting to re-register and or showing offline after scanning and won't allow re-registration of the tablet.Advise Provider this is a current issue and we are working to resolve it as soon as possible no further action is needed.
Sponsor Phone Number Not Found
Scenario 1:  The sponsor is entering a phone number that is not in the system.1. Ask for the phone number entered by the sponsor.
2. Go to KinderConnect and make sure that the phone number provided matches the one in the system.
3. Advise the provider to update the phone number if needed.
4. If the phone number already matches, advise refreshing the KinderSign app.
Scenario 2: The sponsor is signing in a child with no valid subsidized or Non-Subsidized schedule.1. Follow the above Steps (1-4)
2. If the error still exists, search for the sponsor using the child's name to confirm that there are no multiple or new accounts.
3. If there is one account, confirm that the child has an active schedule.
Scenario 3: The sponsor's account is inactive1. Search for the sponsor's account and confirm if the inactive box is not checked.
2. Guide the provider through unchecking the Inactive box. Click Save.
3. Advise the provider to refresh the KinderSign app. 
Time Zone
This indicates that the tablet is not set in the state's time zone (Central Time).

Kiosk Mode

A factory reset is needed.


Regular Tablet Configuration

1. Go to Settings.
2. Tap General Management and go to Date & Time. 
3. Select the correct time zone from the selection.
4. Guide the provider through refreshing the KinderSign app.
5. Open KinderSign and the keypad screen will appear.
Incomplete RegistrationThe provider is getting an error "Device must be registered" or the provider is stating that it's asking to scan the QR code even after scanning the code.Guide the provider in registering the tablet correctly. For registration steps, go to KinderSign Registration.
When a sponsor signs in and attempts to submit without a child appears. 1. This could mean that the Sponsor does not see a child when they sign in. If so, verify the child's authorization is active.
2. This could mean the sponsor may have submitted a time but did not select an action in KinderSign. (example: selecting sign in, sign out, entering note)
Kiosk Mode TabletThe tablet is in Kiosk ModeA Factory Reset is needed
Storage is FullWhen a user signs in KinderSign, this message appears. Send an email to the Tablet team at tablet@kindersystems.comcontaining the information below:
  • Provider's Name
  • License Number
  • Contact Number
  • Case Number
The Provider gets the message "We have detected an untrusted connection. For your protection, please switch networks, close and reopen the app, or contact support. REF: 6500"    

This occurs when the Providers PERSONAL tablet has an out of date KinderSign version.



Go to the App Store(Apple)/Play Store(Android) > Type KinderSign Texas in the search bar > select the KinderSign Texas app > tap the button that says Update.

The entire phone number is not visible on the Phone keypad screen
When a user enters their phone number in KinderSign, the entire phone number is not visible on the screen. This does not stop the user from signing in.

This error occurs when the font size selected in settings is too large. 
Guide the Provider to go to Settings > Display > Font Size. 
Move the selector to the middle of the line for the recommended settings. 

Last Update On 04/16/2024
170.question: After identifying the issue, select the next best action below

173.content:
The system uses color backgrounds on the cells:

Gray Cells

  • This backdate limit (Six (6) calendar days) has been reached, and the Sponsor can no longer enter attendance for those days.

Empty Cells

  • This indicates that the date does not have a subsidy or Non-Subsidized schedule. Thus, the Sponsor is not able to enter or edit attendance. 

Yellow cells

  • Mean after entering attendance, indicate missing information or that the In or Out time pairs are incomplete.  
  • Though we encourage complete attendance to be entered, a correction is NOT necessary, as only one in or out time is required.

Red cells

  • Mean after entering attendance, indicate an error such as incorrect information like an Out Time before an In Time.  
  • Though we encourage complete attendance to be entered, a correction is NOT necessary, as only one in or out time is required.

Green cells

  • Indicate that the attendance has already been submitted to the state.

Magenta cells (JIRA #1611)

  • If support agents see magenta cells, there is a JIRA Issue. 
  • The cells are magenta when a Provider is able to enter both in/out times and it registers as approved. Any magenta cells should be reported to Team Leads.
  •  Support Agents should advise the Provider of policy, and let the Provider know that the issue is currently being worked on.

Last Updated On: 08/14/2023
173.question: Does the information above answer the provider's question?

174.content:
***This step is currently not needed. Providers will take this step when they need to track Professional Days.***

After the provider sets up the designated phone number to use for IVR, the provider will call the IVR Phone number: (713) 242-1606

Creating an IVR PIN for Providers

Once the IVR number is dialed, follow the steps below:

  1. After the initial greeting,  
    • Press 1 for English
    • Press 2 for Spanish
  2. Follow the instructions to enter the caller’s Phone Number and PIN to confirm identity. If there is no PIN registered for that Provider account, IVR prompts you to tap  # (pound sign).
  3. Follow the instructions to create a new PIN. IVR repeats the newly entered PIN to verify.
    • Press 1 to accept
    • Press 2 to re-enter
  4. Upon acceptance of the new PIN, the system verbally confirms that the PIN was successfully changed and prompts the Provider to restart the login process.

Resetting IVR PIN (For Providers)

Both Operators and Sponsors can change their PIN using the IVR System by following the prompts as long as they remember their old PIN.

If a user forgets their PIN, Support can help the user reset the PIN in KinderConnect, and the user can change it the next time they access IVR.

Click on 'Operator' and select 'Search' from the drop-down menu in KinderConnect
Enter the first and /or last name in the corresponding search field and press Search to locate their profile.
In the Search Results, click on Account to access the Operator Account page.
Support must verify their secret question and answer with the account owner. 
Once verified, Support will enter and provide a temporary 6-8 digit PIN. 

Advise the Provider that they can change this the next time they access IVR.

Last Update on 11/30/2023
