180.content:
Sponsor Definition 

A sponsor is anyone authorized to drop off or pick up a child from a program's facility. It can be a parent, relative, neighbor, babysitter, etc. A school-age child can also be their own sponsor and a sponsor for their school-age siblings.

Before assisting with any sponsor-related issues, you must search for the sponsor account. Sponsors should not share accounts. Agents should recommend that sponsors contact the providers to create an account for them.

How to Search for a Sponsor

Select the Sponsor > Search option from the navigation bar.
Enter your search criteria.
  • It is recommended to always hit clear before entering search criteria.
  • The more information you enter, the less results you will see.
  • Spaces before and after search criteria will affect search results.
  • For hyphenated names, it is recommended to only enter the first name(before the hyphen).
Support agents must search for an account using the phone number the sponsors are using to sign in first.

If there are no results, support agents can search using sponsor's name or the child's name for each criterion individually.
Press Search.
Sponsors who meet the search criteria are displayed in the Search Results.
Click on a Sponsors' name in the Sponsor Name column to navigate to the corresponding Sponsor > Detail page.
Click on Account to navigate to the corresponding Sponsor > Account page.
Inform the provider that all results are listed in alphabetical or numerical order by default. It is possible to change the order of the results by clicking on the column heading.
Press Clear to clear the search criteria previously entered. 

Last Update On: 08/02/2023
180.question: Are you able to locate the account?

181.content:
When a provider has issues or concerns regarding payment, support must identify the following:

  • Which billing cycle are you inquiring about? 
  • Which child are you inquiring about?
  • Was the attendance submitted correctly for the child(ren) in question?

Once you have identified this information, proceed with reviewing the payment. 

How to Search for Payments

Payments will show depending on the criteria that you selected.
  • Press Select >> to enter the desired criteria to search for the name of the Child to which the payment corresponds to.
  • Select the Start Date and the End Date range by typing the dates in the corresponding fields or use the Calendar button.
  • Press the drop-down arrow and select the desired Date Filter to indicate whether you would like Start Date and End Date to apply to the Service Period, Settlement Date, or Processed Date to the Payments.
    • Service Period: The date that the child was in care and service was provided. 
    • Settlement Date: The date that OFIS gets that the payment went to their bank.  (The date the bank reported the payment).
    • Processed Date: The date that the payment was processed. 
  • Press the drop-down arrow to select the Payments Status you would like to include, whether All Payments, Processing, Paid, or Rejected.

Press Select >> to choose which Reconciliation type you would like to include. You can also click on the Select All checkbox to select Reconciliation types. Click again to deselect.

  • Canceled - Warrant has been canceled, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Payment Issued - Payment deposited within 2-4 days.
  • Rejected - Banking information error and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Stopped - Warrant has been stopped, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Unreconciled - Warrant has been issued and mailed but not yet deposited.
  • Voided - Payment error has occurred, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Waiting - Payment deposited within 5-7 business days.
Once you have selected the desired fields, press Search.


Last Updated 10/10/2022
181.question: Does the information above answer the provider's concern?

182.content:
Removing Child's Record

A provider can only remove/delete Non-Subsidized children's accounts.

Search for the Child on the Child > Search page.  

For assistance searching for the child, click on the Search for Child button.


Open the Child Detail page by clicking on the child's name under the Search Results.

If the Non-Subsidized child does not have any attendance recorded in the past, the provider can delete the record by pressing Delete at the top of the page.
A confirmation message will be displayed. Press OK to confirm.
Note: If the Non-Subsidized child has attendance recorded, the system will not allow to deletion of the record. 
In this instance, guide the provider through shortening the schedule to the date after the attendance was last recorded. 


From the Child > Detail page, locate for Non-Subsidized Schedule at the bottom and select Edit. 

Change the End Date to any date after the attendance was last recorded by typing the date or selecting the date from the Calendar icon.


Press OK. Press Save at the top.

The child's record will not show on the Attendance > Detail page.

If the date selected to end is at the end of the week, the child's record will disappear from the page.


Note: If the Provider is requesting to remove a child subsidy record, Support Agents will refer them to the State Helpdesk. Child subsidy records cannot be removed by the Provider, the subsidy will remain until expired.

Last Update On: 07/11/2023
182.question: Was the Provider Issue resolve?

185.content:
When a Provider has issues or concerns regarding payment, support must identify the following:

  • Which billing cycle are you inquiring about? 
  • Which child are you inquiring about?
  • Was the attendance submitted correctly for the child(ren) in question?

Once you have identified this information, proceed with reviewing the payment. 

How to Review Payments

The Search Results grid contains all payments issued to the provider depending on the specified criteria.

Payment ID is the payment number referring to the specific payment line or information. 

Status Date refers to the payment date when the payment was processed or submitted. 

  • If the payment is in Processing status, the status date refers to when the attendance was submitted. The Processing status changes to Paid Status on the following Sunday after the attendance was submitted. 
    • If the payment is still in Processing status past Sunday, this means that there is an overlapping attendance. Click on the Overlapping Utilization Report button below. 
  • If the payment is in Paid status, the status date refers to when the payment was processed. 

Status Date refers to the payment date when the payment was processed. The payment must be in Paid status.

Note: If the payment is still in Processing status, the amount displayed is not final and will change once the status is changed to Paid.

Period Start & End Date refers to the service week when the attendance was collected.

Family Name, Child Name & Case Number refer to the child information that the payment line is related to. 

Amount refers to the payment amount that the provider received for the child for the given period.

Co-pay refers to the payment that the sponsor needs to make to the provider. 

  • For more information regarding Co-pay, providers can click on the Details link. The co-pay information is found under Payment Summary. 
    • The Ceiling Rates are the maximum allowed rates for each type of service that is authorized for reimbursement. Reimbursement is the amount paid out by ODTWC.

  • Co-pay Information can also be found under Provider > Cases. Click View for Co-Pay History.  Any issues or questions regarding copay must be referred to TWC.


Reconciliation refers to the payment status with TWC. This is available once the payment is processed (Paid status). 

  • Canceled - Warrant has been canceled, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Payment Issued - Payment deposited within 2-4 days.
  • Rejected - Banking information error and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Stopped - Warrant has been stopped, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Unreconciled - Warrant has been issued and mailed but not yet deposited.
  • Voided - Payment error has occurred, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Waiting - Payment deposited within 5-7 business days.

Details is the link that the provider will select if they want to know more details of a specific payment.

Send Alert is the link that the provider will select if they want to send a payment alert. 

Total Amount is the total of the payment amount received for the selected date range and other criteria when searching for payments. 

Note: Providers can update the bank information on REMOVE THIS. Refer to TWC for further assistance

Co-Pay Updates

TWC will soon be re-instating co-payments for the families and will be notifying Providers by email of the changes. If a caller is asking how to see co-payment information Support must guide them on how to see this information in Kinderconnect. If the caller has any questions regarding how or when the co-payments will resume, please refer them to TWC. 

Last Updated 3/13/2023
185.question: Does the information above answer the provider's concern?

2.button_text: No - More information about Provider Cases

187.page_title: Sponsor | Recording Attendance using IVR (For Sponsors)
187.content:
The Sponsor can also use the IVR to update the attendance. The updates include recording real-time In and Out times by the sponsor. Backdating attendance cannot be done using IVR. 

Note: It is only possible to call from numbers that are not blocked. Attendance cannot be recorded from blocked telephone numbers. The telephone can be a landline or a cell phone.


How to Record Sign-In and Out Times

  1. When signing in using IVR, Sponsors will use the Provider's phone at the location with the designated Provider's IVR Phone number listed in

    KinderConnect. 

  2. Sponsors will call the IVR (713) 242-1606.

  3. After the initial greeting,  
    • Press 1 for English
    • Press 2 for Spanish
  4. Follow the instructions to enter the Sponsor's Phone Number and PIN to confirm identity.
    • Note: If the sponsor has not yet set up a PIN, IVR will require them to configure a PIN the first time they call
  5. Make the appropriate selection(s) from the following Menu Options: 
    • Press 1 to sign in all children
    • Press 2 to sign out all children
    • Press 3 to enter attendance separately for each child (In, Out, or Skip)
    • Press 4 to change the PIN
  6. Upon completion, the system verbally confirms that the Attendance has been Saved.
  7. For Support: Go to KinderConnect and ensure that the sponsor's attendance entry was recorded.

Note: Sponsors need to record at least one In or Out time.

Last Update On: 11/30/2023
187.question: Was the sponsor able to update attendance successfully?

2.button_text: No - IVR PIN must be Set Up

188.page_title: Provider | Clearing Apps Cache in Personal Devices
188.content:
Clearing the cache is recommended when a provider has issues loading the KinderSign app. The provider may also need to clear the cache when having browser issues. Support can guide the provider to clear the cache by following the steps below:

Clearing Cache for KinderSign App on Personal Devices

Press and hold on to the KinderSign application.
A pop-up will appear with a list of options.
Tap App Info.
Note: If App Info is unavailable by holding the KinderSign App, you can also go to Settings > Apps > KinderSign to get to this page.


From the App Info screen, Tap Storage, then tap Clear Data.

Open the KinderSign app and confirm if the issue has been resolved.


Clearing Cache for Internet Browser (Google Chrome)

Note: The button to show the menu button may differ depending on the browser the provider uses. The state-provided tablet has Samsung Internet and Google Chrome.

Tap the 3 black dots at the screen's upper right-hand corner.  
When the browser menu appears, tap on Settings. 
From Settings, look for Privacy and Security, then select Clear Browsing Data. 
Clear Browsing Data screen lets the provider customize their selections for which cookies to delete by selecting a specific time range.

  1. Select All time for the Time Range.
  2. Ensure that Cache (Cached Images and Files in this example) is checked. Uncheck all the other items.
  3. Once the provider has made their selections select Clear Data. 

Open the browser and confirm if the issue has been resolved.


Last Update On 04/26/2023
188.question: Did the above troubleshooting steps fix the provider's issue?

189.content:
When there's an update made in KinderConnect, the provider should refresh the data from the KinderSign app. A stable Wi-Fi connection is required to successfully refresh the KinderSign App. The App will refresh automatically if a user successfully logs into the device automatically.

The App could be refreshed manually by Closing the App on the tablet and opening it back (a staff member or a sponsor can do this).

How to Properly Refresh the Tablet

Note: Depending on the model of the iPad, the steps to show the Recent Applications may vary.
Earlier Models with Physical Buttons: From the Home Screen, double-click the Home button or swipe up from the bottom of the screen and pause in the middle of the screen to show your most recently used apps.
Current Models with Digital Buttons: From the Home Screen, swipe up from the bottom of the screen and pause in the middle of the screen.
Swipe up on the KinderSign app's preview to close the app.
If you cannot find the KinderSign app, you may need to swipe right or left to find the app that you want to close.
Open the KinderSign app and attempt to log in.
Confirm with the caller that the KinderSign app is showing Online.

Other Ways to Refresh Tablet

When the steps above cannot be done by the caller, support can also suggest doing the following:

  1. The provider uses their telephone number & pin combination to access the Staff Menu and select the Refresh Data option.
  2. Turn the tablet off and then back on (a staff member or a sponsor can do this). 


Last Update On:  4/22/2021
189.question: Is the sponsor able to log in?

190.content:
Creating an IVR PIN for Sponsors

Note: If a Sponsor has already set up a PIN with another provider in KinderSign, there is no need to create a new one. The IVR PIN will remain the same.

  1. When signing in using IVR, Sponsors will use the Provider's phone at the location with the designated Provider's IVR Phone number listed in

    KinderConnect.

  2.  Sponsors will call the IVR (713) 242-1606.

  3. After the initial greeting,  
    • Press 1 for English
    • Press 2 for Spanish
  4. Follow the instructions to enter the Sponsor's personal Phone Number and PIN to confirm identity. If there are multiple Caretakers/Sponsors who share a  telephone number, the system may prompt them to select your name from a list. If there is no PIN registered for that  Caretaker/Sponsor account, IVR prompts to tap # (numerical sign).
  5. Follow the instructions to create a new PIN. IVR repeats the newly entered PIN to verify.
    • Press 1 to accept
    • Press 2 to re-enter
  6. Upon acceptance of the new PIN, the system verbally confirms that the PIN was successfully changed and prompts the Sponsor to restart the login process.

Resetting PIN for Sponsors

Sponsors can change their PIN using the IVR System by following the prompts as long as they remember their old PIN.

If a user forgets their PIN, Support can reset the PIN in KinderConnect, and the user can change it the next time they access IVR.

Notes: 

  • Support Agents must be speaking with the Account Owner in order to reset the PIN.
  • Support Agents cannot reset an IVR PIN in response to a chat or email.
  • Sponsors must answer their secret questions for their IVR PIN to be reset..
Click on Sponsor and select Search from the drop-down menu in KinderConnect.
Please enter the first and /or last name in the corresponding search field and press Search to locate their profile.

In the Search Results, click on Account to access the Operator Account page.

Support will verify the secret question and answer with the Sponsor.
Once verified, Support will enter and provide a temporary 6-8 digit PIN. 

Advise the sponsor that they can change this the next time they access IVR. 

Last Update On 01/11/2024

191.content:
A new license number will be issued to providers who change locations. When the provider calls and states that the old location is closed and re-opened under a new license number, the support agents need to verify which scenario applies to the call:

1. The new license number does not have authorization. 

Support should not proceed with registering the tablet to the new license number. The provider can contact State Helpdesk to ensure that the authorization will be moved to the new license number. Advise the provider to review the attendance from the old license number. If any children are still showing under the old licenses, the Support Agent must refer the caller to the State Helpdesk at tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov. 

2. The new license has authorization, but there is no registered Operator.

Support should not proceed with the process of registering the tablet to the new license number. The Provider must contact State HelpDesk to validate their account.

3. The new license number has authorization, has a registered Operator, and the provider is ready to register the tablet. 

Support can assist the Provider with re-registering the tablet to the new license number. Ensure that the provider has a second device like a laptop or a desktop, aside from the tablet. Using the second device, the provider must log on to KinderConnect and download the necessary registration codes.

If the Provider registers the new account, the Support agent can offer to link the operator's existing account to the new account with the new license number.

Note: Providers who change locations will be issued a new license number by State Helpdesk. If the provider does not receive a new license number or the new address does not show in KinderConnect after more than 24 hours, the support agents should refer the caller to State Helpdesk at tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov. 



Last Update On 05/03/2024
191.question: Based on the scenarios above, select the next best action:

0.button_text: Provider met all requirements. Proceed to registering the tablet with new license number

1.button_text: No child authorization found in the new program yet. Refer to State Helpdesk

2.button_text: New Location/License Number does not have Registered Operator

3.button_text: New License Number not found/New license number not received. Refer to State Helpdesk

192.content:
The Provider > Remittance page summarizes the details of all payments made to a Provider during the selected time period. The Search Results will list separate child and provider level grids, if available.  The system only shows remittances made within the past 12 months.

How to Search for a Remittance


From the Navigation Bar, select Provider > Remittance.


Press Select to enter the criteria to search for a Provider. 

Press the drop-down arrow to select the type of Reconciliation you would like to review. Once selected. Press Search.

Note: Depending on the Operator type or previous selection, the Provider field may be already populated. 
 
The system will generate the Search Results grid containing all Remittances issued to that Provider that matches the specified criteria.

Date Created is the date when the remittance was created.
The amount is the actual amount that the provider is going to receive for the corresponding remittance.
Reconciliation is the status of remittance with TWC.
  • Canceled - Warrant has been canceled, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Payment Issued - Payment deposited within 2-4 days.
  • Rejected - Banking information error and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Stopped - Warrant has been stopped, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Unreconciled - Warrant has been issued and mailed but not yet deposited.
  • Voided - Payment error has occurred, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Waiting - Payment deposited within 5-7 business days.
Reconciliations Status Date is the date the reconciliation status change.
Issuance ID is the unique payment batch number assigned to payments in Kindertrack by the provider. Each time a payment is sent from Kindertrack to the financial system, a new issuance ID will be assigned to all payments made to a specific provider on a given day.


To review the details of a Remittance, click on the corresponding Details to view further information regarding the remittance.

To create an alert message related to a Remittance, click on the corresponding Send Alert. 

Note: If the provider uses the Payment Alert button, the support agent should remind the provider to include all the details, including the child's information, as this button is not linked to any child in particular. Results will only show on this page if the payments are already in PAID status.
 
If the search criteria generate Search Results, the Export button allows you to review the details of a Remittance. Click on the corresponding Details.

Note: Depending on your browser, the steps to follow might differ.


How to Review Remittance Details

By clicking on Details, the provider can see further information regarding the remittance that they are going to receive or will receive. 
Service Period Start and Service Period End show the cycle that the remittance is related to.
Family Fees are fees that the family is responsible for as determined by TWC.
Invoice is the actual amount that the provider is getting paid for the corresponding child.
Adjustment Code will be added if TWC assigns one as applicable. Regular child care payments will not have an adjustment code.
Export Details allows the provider to open and export the remittance details in CSV format for additional review. 


Last Update On 03/20/2023
192.question: Does this answer the provider's question about payment?

194.content:
Before considering doing a factory reset, depending on the issue you are troubleshooting, the provider should have turned the tablet on and off, turned the Wi-Fi on and off, forgotten and reconnected to the network, and applied the latest Knox profile (if applicable), made sure the app and tablet are up to date and tried to view and troubleshoot the tablet using Rescue.

All state-provided tablets do NOT have access to Factory Reset in the settings menu. However, they can still reset the device using the physical buttons (boot menu).

Note: If the Factory Reset is taking longer than expected, agents should schedule a callback after 15 minutes. If the agent is unable to get ahold of customer, send instructions. 

When to Factory Reset?

  • Error 12000 - This error happens when the device loses internet connection during a Knox update.
  • When the provider selects the wrong choice instead of "Fully Managed Device" while setting up a tablet.
  • The forced factory reset didn't complete.

How to Factory Reset:

How To Factory Reset (For Tablet Without Access to Settings) +

 When to Use: This method is recommended if the user cannot factory reset using the settings.

Power off the tablet. 


Hold the volume up and the power button at the same time. Once you see the Samsung welcome screen, release both of the buttons.

Press the power button twice to see the menu

For T350 (tablets with a physical home button), the provider must hold the Home button, volume up, and the power button all at the same time.
For Controls: Use the Volume Up and Down buttons to scroll up and down and the Power button to select a menu option

The menu on the left will be displayed. 


Select Wipe data/factory reset and press Power button once to select 


A warning message will appear that states, “Wipe all user data? This cannot be undone”.

Highlight the option “Factory Data Reset” and press the Power button once to select.

For T350 (tablets with a physical home button), highlight the option "Yes" and press the Power button to select.

Once accepted, confirm that the Reboot System is highlighted, then press the power button once. 

Please allow a few minutes for the reset procedure to complete.


Close

How To Factory Reset from the Settings+

When to Use: This is recommended if the provider is using their personal tablet. 
Reminder: A factory reset will almost always cause all data on the tablet to be erased. There is no way to retrieve the data. Make sure that the provider understands this before continuing.
Select Settings.

Tap General Management to reach the Reset options. On other tablets, it may be under About.
Tap on Reset.


The Provider will select the kind of reset they would like to do; in this case, they are doing a factory data reset.

Tap Reset. The tablet may ask the Provider to confirm after informing them that all data will be permanently erased. If the provider agrees, they will tap Next to confirm that they would like to continue.


Close

For Support Agents

If the Support agent knows the troubleshooting steps, but troubleshooting is taking longer than expected to complete (i.e., factory reset), the Support agent initially handling the call should schedule a callback after 15 minutes. The Support agent must set the case to In Progress status and document the troubleshooting steps.

If the Support agent cannot reach the customer, they must email the additional instructions and close the case.

Additional instructions must include: 

(1) MDM Kiosk Migration instructions.pdf

(2) QRC for Provider KinderSign Registration - https://tx3c.info/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/KSign-QRC-Provider-Device-Registration-TX-0523.pdf

Last Update On: 08/01/2023
194.question: Did the factory reset resolve the issue?

0.button_text: Yes - Proceed to setting up tablet after factory reset

195.page_title: Provider | Setting Up Tablet after Factory Reset
195.content:
Once a factory reset is done to the tablets affected by the KinderSign App crash issue (T290 and T220), the provider will need to set up the tablet and re-register the device. 

Support should follow the steps below and walk the provider through reconnecting and re-registering their device. 

How to Set Up the Tablet after Factory Reset

Once the provider has set up the Wi-Fi connection, they should see the screen shown on the left.

Press Next.
Press the Fully Managed Device button to continue with the setup.

Please make sure that providers are going to select “Fully Managed Device.” If they select the other option, they will not have the option to go back, and they will be required to factory reset again.

If the provider is prompted to put in account information, please let them know the credentials are:
Username: TXenrollment@controltec.com

Password: Welcome21!

Press Accept & Continue.
Press Next.
Tap on the left arrow located at the bottom left.

Enable the location services. 
Press Done.
The home screen will now appear with the available applications.

The provider should first press the green circle symbol located on the left corner of the app icon before using an application. This will prompt the provider to request installation.
Press OK to complete the process.

 If the factory reset didn’t complete, assist the provider with Factory Reset.

196.content:
Kiosk mode limits the functions that the provider will have access to. The provider will only have access to KinderSign, KinderConnect bookmark, and Knox Remote Support. This feature lets IT assist the Provider directly with troubleshooting problems (this new update replaces RescueMe).


What Does Kiosk Mode Look Like?

Tapping the “(i)” in the lower-left corner will access the settings menu.
The Provider can press Settings to view the available options. The provider can press OK to exit.
After pressing OK, the options under Settings will be displayed.

Press the desired option to select. Press OK to exit.


Because the Provider's access is limited, the provider may call support related to this display. Support should explain that this display is normal after the recent update. 

  • For Common Issues Affected by Kiosk Mode and Resolutions, select Technical Issues (Kiosk Mode)
  • To assist the Provider in setting up the tablet to kiosk mode, select Switch the Tablet to Kiosk Mode
  • If it is noted that a blocked functionality does prevent a critical function related to the use of the system, please make a HelpDesk request.
  • If the Provider states the tablet is physically damaged or broken, select Tablet Replacement.

Last Update On: 09/18/2023

Webinars are live presentations where attendees (providers, sponsors, and state workers) can join in. It usually includes a presenter and a support agent who answers questions from the attendees. The previous webinars will also be available on the Texas info site: https://tx3c.info/

If there is an upcoming webinar, a registration link will be available on the Texas info site to those who want to join the webinar. 

To watch or attend a webinar, guide the provider to follow these steps.



Direct the caller to the Texas info site https://tx3c.info/ and direct them to the Home page.

At the bottom of the home page, you will find the info site's recent updates.

If available, the registration links for the TX live webinars are available.

Support Webinars


To watch the previous webinars, the Provider will go to Providers page.

To find a webinar by date, the Provider can go to Support Webinar Recordings.

Program Webinars


To find a webinar by product (KinderConnect, KinderSign, or KinderSmart), the provider can select from the list under Providers and select Start Here/Video Guides.

This is recommended for newer providers or operators who want to learn more about the TX3c system.

200.content:
A factory reset should be your last resort. Before even considering doing a factory reset, depending on the issue you are troubleshooting, you should have turned the tablet on and off, turned the Wi-Fi on and off, forgotten and reconnected to the network, uninstalled and reinstalled the app, applied the latest Knox profile (if relevant), made sure the app and tablet are up to date and tried to view and troubleshoot the tablet using Go To Meeting or Rescue.

After performing all the above steps, it may be time to consider doing a factory reset if the issues continue.

Notes: 

  • If this is a provider’s personal tablet, a factory reset will almost always cause all data on the tablet to be erased. There is no way to retrieve the data! Make sure that the provider understands this before continuing.
  • If the Factory reset is taking longer than expected, agents should schedule a callback after 15 minutes. If the agent is unable to get ahold of customer, send instructions. 

Tablets with Knox on them will not erase everything when a factory reset is done.  It will boot and load the app as defined by Knox. Different tablets will have different steps to perform a factory reset. The following steps should be used to give you a general idea of where to go.

How To Factory Reset - Apple Device

1. Tap Settings from the menu.
2. Tap General. Scroll down and tap Reset.
3. Tap on Erase all Content and Settings.

4. The Provider will be asked to confirm that they would like to reset the tablet and that all data will be erased. They will tap Erase to confirm that they do.

Last Updated On: 07/31/2023

When troubleshooting technical issues, support must diagnose the main problem and perform the troubleshooting steps. Before troubleshooting, the Agent must identify which device the Provider is using.

Kiosk Mode Configuration
Regular Tablet Mode

Note: All state-provided tablets are in Kiosk mode.


The tablet is in Regular Tablet Configuration if they can access regular tablet applications such as clock, calculator, internet browser, settings, etc.

Technical issues (Kiosk Mode)

Before requesting a replacement tablet, it is essential that Support diagnose the main issue and perform common troubleshooting steps. Below are some of the common errors that Providers are experiencing. Please complete the following troubleshooting steps if applicable.

Click on the link or the + button to learn more about the common issues in a Kiosk mode tablet:

 Switching to New License Number (Clearing the App Cache)+

Providers can switch to the new license number by signing in to KinderSign with their staff account. Select the Scan QR Code from the menu. This allows the provider to scan the QR codes of the new location. The device ID will automatically be removed from the old program and will switch to the new program.

A Factory Reset is needed.

A Factory Reset is needed.

Incorrect Date and Time+

Tap the “(i)” button located in the lower-left corner to access the settings menu.
Tap Settings to view the available settings options.

Disable the Automatic Date and Time option. 
Tap Set Date to adjust the date. Tap Set Time to adjust the time. 

Tap Done to save the changes. 
Once adjusted, tap the Home button to return to the Home screen.
Close

Talkback Mode (TouchScreen not working)+

TalkBack mode is not enabled in Kiosk Mode however, as an accessibility function, this could be enabled by the user by holding the volume up and down buttons at the same time. If this happens, hold the volume up and volume down buttons at the same time until a notification that says "Talkback mode is disabled." appears.

Select the Setting Up a Tablet to Kiosk Mode
Possible Cause
Troubleshooting Steps

Due to security, Providers will only have access to KinderConnect, KinderSign and Knox Remote Support applications in Texas. This may change in the future.		Select Tablet on Kiosk Mode for more information.
Close

The tablet needs to be set up after a Factory Reset+

Select Setting up Tablet to Kiosk Mode button below.
Close

Display Settings on Kiosk Tablet+

Tap the “(i)” button located in the lower-left corner to access the settings menu.
Tap Settings to view the available settings options.
Tap on the Display option.

If the Provider has not enabled Display settings before, they will need to tap on Change System Settings, then enable the Allow Knox Manage option.
Tap the Back button, tap OK. Reopen the Display menu.

Locate the Screen Timeout setting and adjust it as needed.

In this example, the Tablet setting is set to timeout after 30 seconds.


Once adjusted, tap the Home button to return to the Home screen.
If the Provider states that they are not seeing the options as pictured above, ensure that the Allow Knox Manage option was enabled.

Close

Error Code 12000+

Possible Cause
Troubleshooting Steps
Recommended Solution
Interrupted Knox update. The device lost connection while doing a Knox Update.
Select Factory Reset.
Close

Broken Tablet+

Possible Cause
Troubleshooting Steps
Recommended Solution

NoneSend a request to replace the tablet.

Possible Cause
Troubleshooting Steps
Recommended Solution
Cyclic reboot issue.NoneSend a request to replace the tablet.

The browser crashes, KinderConnect crashes+

Possible Cause
Troubleshooting Steps
Recommended Solution
Browser doesn't close tabs on exit, multiple tabs fill up available memory.Have the provider check for open tabs in the browser.

Guide the provider through closing tabs, and encourage them to close tabs before exiting the browser.		Follow the Troubleshooting Steps.

Possible Cause
Troubleshooting Steps
Recommended Solution
Likely a local cause, not the tablets.Take notes on the behavior of the devices. Ask the provider about other devices not related to TX3c system. Troubleshoot one tablet and see if your solution works on the next.Regular troubleshooting steps should be applied.

Troubleshooting Steps

Discharged battery.Ensure the charger and cable are working, test on other devices if possible. Plug the tablet into the known good charger, and watch for the lightning bolt or numerical charge indicator. Let it charge for 5-10 minutes before checking.Send a request to replace the tablet or charger, whichever is needed.

Power tablet on before charging. If the issue persists, replace the tablet.

204.page_title: Provider | Technical Issues - Regular Tablet Mode
204.content:
Below are some common errors Providers may experience with their personal tablets. Please complete the following troubleshooting steps if applicable. If the issue is outside of the TX3C system, refer the Provider to contact the Provider's internet service provider or the device's manufacturer. 

Device Issue
Possible cause
Troubleshooting Steps
Recommended Solution
 Incorrect Date and Time

Support should assist the provider in updating the date and time. 
Samsung Tablets: Tap General Management > Date and Time. If the tablet shows an incorrect date and time and is set automatically, have the Provider disable the Automatic Date and Time option. Next, adjust the time zone, date, and time as needed.

iPad: Go to Settings  > General > Date & Time. If the tablet shows an incorrect date and time and is set automatically, have the Provider disable the Set Automatically option. Next, adjust the time zone, date, and time as needed.

The touchscreen doesn't work. 

Talkback mode is enabled.


If the screen is pressed, the tablet vocalizes what was pressed, or a message appears onscreen to swipe with two fingers, a blue box appears around the pressed icons; Talkback mode is enabled.


Option 1. If the "TalkBack shortcut" is ENABLED in Settings (Accessibility > TalkBack):

Hold the volume up and volume down buttons simultaneously until a notification that Talkback mode is disabled appears.

Option 2. If the "TalkBack shortcut" is DISABLED in Settings (Accessibility > TalkBack):


A. Guide the provider to go to the Settings >Accessibility > TalkBack > Switch OFF 

B. Settings > Accessibility > Vision > Voice Assistant > Switch OFF. 

They need to use two fingers to find Settings and double-TX3c to select an item in both cases. 

Browser crashes, "KinderConnect crashes. "

The browser doesn't close tabs on exit; multiple tabs fill up the available memory. 

Have the provider check for open tabs in the browser. 

Guide the provider through closing tabs, and encourage them to close tabs before exiting the browser. If closing the open tabs doesn’t resolve the problem,  proceed to 'Troubleshooting- Knox profile update" below. 

More than one tablet exhibits the same behavior in the same location. 

Likely a local cause, not the tablet's problem. 

Take notes on the behavior of the devices. Ask the provider about other devices not related to CCBIS. Troubleshoot one tablet and see if your solution works on the next. 

Regular troubleshooting steps should be applied.

12000 code error.

Interrupted Knox update.

 

Factory reset. 

The tablet won't power on. 

Discharged battery. 

Ensure the charger and cable are working; test on other devices if possible. Plug the tablet into the known good charger, and watch for the lightning bolt or numerical charge indicator. Let it charge for 5-10 minutes before checking.


The tablet is stuck on the download page with the message "Downloading Please Do Not Turn Off Device."

Force the tablet to shut down by pressing and holding down the following buttons in order: the Volume Down Button, the Home Button, and the Power Button. Once all three buttons are held down, the tablet should restart and function normally.

The provider gets the error (Access denied) when using the tablet browser.
The error will be generated when the provider tries to access a website (not on
the white list).

Inform the provider about the restriction when loading a webpage aside from KinderConnect.
The tablet is stuck on a White Screen.

When accessing KinderSign, the app never loads; it just freezes on a blank white screen.
Exit the app completely (follow the same steps as when you refresh the app to ensure it is shut down fully and not just minimized), then re-open the app.
The tablet is stuck on the loading Page during KinderSign Registration.
Poor or no internet connection.
Walk the provider through checking that the tablet is connected to wifi. If the tablet is connected, follow the steps in handling the offline tablet.
Click on Device Offline.
The tablet is stuck on a loading Page during KinderSign Registration.
It could be an issue with the App cache.
Walk the provider through cleaning the KinderSign cache.
Click on Clearing Apps Cache.
The Provider gets a message "Security Policy.
It prevents the use of Home Key" when pressing the Home key.
This appears when a Knox update is in progress or has not been completed.
Support should assist the provider to complete or do another Knox Profile update. Make sure that the tablet is connected to the internet.
Go to  Troubleshooting - Knox Profile Update
The Provider gets the message "We have detected an untrusted connection. For your protection, please switch networks, close and reopen the app, or contact support. REF: 6500"The Providers tablet has an out of date KinderSign version

Support should guide the Provider in updating to the most recent version of KinderSign for Texas.

Go to the App Store(Apple)/Play Store(Android) > Type KinderSign Texas in the search bar > select the KinderSign Texas app > tap the button that says Update

Last Update On: 02/14/2024

207.page_title: Provider | Attendance Disappeared from KinderConnect (Viewing Attendance History)
207.content:
A provider might report that attendance was already recorded in KinderConnect and then disappeared.  If attendance is already recorded at one point, it will show in the Attendance History. Support can verify if the attendance was deleted.

Support can verify if the provider had already entered a transaction for the day and if corrections are needed.

Note: Providers do not have access to this function.

How to Review the Attendance History

If there is no History button, it means that attendance has NEVER been recorded for that day.

If there is a History button displayed on a day without attendance entered, this means that attendance has been entered for that day at some point but has been erased.

Click on History for the day in question.

The Attendance history will display the attendance details. 

The support agent can use History to confirm information related to attendance that disappeared. 

Note: If the attendance doesn't show on the Attendance > Detail page or the history, and the provider insists that attendance disappeared but no indication the attendance has been deleted, escalate the call for further review. 

Last Update On: 04/26/2023

210.content:
What the Support Agents Need to Know

Identifying the payment the provider is inquiring about:

  1. What is the billing cycle that the provider is inquiring about?
  2. Which child or children does the provider have questions about?
  3. Was the attendance submitted? 

After identifying the payment in question, start reviewing the possible causes of the issue. For example:

  1. Incorrect Attendance
  2. Incorrect Child Age Group
  3. Incorrect Customized Schedule

If the provider has issues with the payment amount, identify the following:

  1. Is the child in question a School-Aged child?
    • Search for the child's information and determine if the child is school-aged. 
    • If the payment is related to a School-aged child, proceed to the next step.
  2. Is there a customized schedule?
    • Check if the customized schedule associated with the payment is correct. 
    • This can be reviewed on the Provider > Payment page by clicking on the Details link associated with the payment in question. 

Troubleshooting Common Payment Issues

IssuesDetailsResolution
Attendance
(Payment Amount)		Review the attendance and check that it has been entered correctly on the specified period.

If the attendance entered is incorrect, guide the provider in sending a Payment Alert.

 Absences 
(Payment Amount)
Review the attendance and check if the absence is the first attendance submitted when the authorization started. 


Ex: The authorization started on 7/5/2021, and the provider entered absence from 7/5 to 7/9. 

According to the policy, an absence cannot be the first attendance submitted. Therefore it will not be paid. An absent day cannot be paid until a child has attended the program and payment has been identified for tapped attendance.

Explain the policy to the provider and refer to TWC Helpdesk for Policy questions.
Customized Schedule
(Payment Amount)		Review the customized schedule and check that the hours and the category do not affect attendance.

If the schedule is not affecting the attendance, proceed with guiding the provider in sending a Payment Alert.

If the schedule is affecting attendance because the customized schedule is incorrect, guide the provider in correcting the schedule before helping with sending the payment alert. 

Age Group
(Payment Amount)		Review the age group of the child in question

If the age group is incorrect, refer to contact their County TWC office

Provider Rates
(Payment Amount)
Click the Detail link associated with the payment in question on the Payment page. Review the Detail page and check if the rates are not $0 (for both customary and ceiling rates). 
If the Customary Rate is $0, then the provider needs to fix the rates (especially effective dates) on OCLQS - this can be confirmed on the Provider > Rates page.

If the Ceiling Rate is $0, refer the provider to contact the county.
Payment Amount - General
 No Issues foundIf there were NO issues found on attendance, customized schedule, age group, and/or the provider has questions regarding payment calculation, guide the provider in sending a Payment Alert.
Payment Not Received – Payment in Paid status
Review the Payment > Search page and check if the payment in question is in Paid status

If the Payment is in Paid status, review the reconciliation status.

Click on the Review Reconciliation Status button below to learn more about the statuses. 

Providers will receive payment 5 to 7 business days from the status date. If not received, Providers will need to send a Payment Alert.


Payment Not Received – Payment in Processing status
Review the Payment > Search page and check if the payment in question is in Processing status
If the Payment is in Processing status, proceed with checking the Payment Schedule.
Payment Not Received – Payment Not showing up in Payment Search
Review the Payment > Search page. If the payment does not show on the Payment page, review if they have submitted the attendance and whether it included complete authorized time pairs
If not submitted correctly, guide the provider through the process of correcting and submitting the attendance
Payment Stuck in Processing Status
Review if there's any existing overlapping attendance.If the provider submitted attendance correctly, but the payment is stuck in Processing status, review and check the Overlapping Utilization Report.
Child Authorization Information 
Review the child's authorization category and period. If the authorization category is incorrect or needs to be updated, the parent needs to contact the caseworker or County TWC office.


Co-Pay Updates

TWC will soon be re-instating co-payments for the families and will be notifying Providers by email of the changes. If a caller is asking how to see co-payment information Support must guide them on how to see this information in Kinderconnect. If the caller has any questions regarding how or when the co-payments will resume, please refer them to TWC. 

For more information on how to guide the caller to see co-payment information please select More Payment Questions > Payment Review.

Notes: 

  • Attendance is automatically swept after 35 days if the program does not submit attendance. Attendance is automatically calculated the Sunday after it has been submitted or swept. Guide the program to search for and read payments.  
  • If the Provider has not received a response and it’s been over 30 days or still has payment concerns after previously sending a payment alert, the Provider can contact the TWC Business Unit.
  • If the payment issue is discussed and no action is required, click on No Further Questions - Confirm Resolution
  • Providers can update the bank information on REMOVE THIS. Refer to TWC for further assistance


Last Updated 10/17/2023

0.button_text: Payment Schedule needs to be checked

1.button_text: Provider needs to send a Payment Alert

211.page_title: Provider | Changing the Language in KinderSign
211.content:
If the Provider or Sponsor wants to switch the language in the KinderSign app, they can follow the steps below:

Sign in on KinderSign with their telephone number and PIN code.
Tap Settings from the menu.
Tap Language to view the language options they can select from.
Select the desired language and tap Back. 
Note: The languages available are English, Spanish, and Vietnamese. 


Note: When changing a language, it will only be applied to the user of that account, once they sign out of the account, it will go back to English.

Last Update On: 09/07/2022
211.question: Was the sponsor able to change language in KinderSign?

212.content:
Sponsor Definition 

A sponsor is anyone who is authorized to drop off or pick up a child from a provider's location. It can be a parent, relative, neighbor, babysitter, etc. 


New Sponsors:  Will need assistance getting their account registered.

Newly Registered Sponsors:  will need assistance getting familiar with the system and its functionalities. They may need a general overview of the basics of navigating and performing different actions in our system, such as signing in /out, backdating transactions, approving transactions, etc.

Previously Registered Sponsors: are typically familiar with the system but may need assistance from time to time.

Use the search function to locate the registered account. To narrow your search results and ensure accuracy enter as much information as the sponsor can provide in the search fields.


  1. If available, enter the Sponsor's First Name. 
  2. If available, enter the Sponsor's Last Name. 
  3. If available, enter the User Name used by that Sponsor.
  4. If available, enter the Child's First Name.
  5. If available, enter the Child's Last Name. 
  6. If available, enter the Phone Number.


After searching for the sponsor using the entered criteria, navigate to the desired information by using the links in the Search Results, and from the options below, select the one that best describes the current sponsor scenario. 


Last Update On 04/22/2023
212.question: Is the caller a new sponsor or a registered sponsor?

2.button_text: Refer to TWC for policy questions or non-system related issues

213.content:
Support can perform a Sponsor search to locate a Sponsor record. (Steps: KinderConnect > Sponsor > Search > press Clear > enter search criteria > press Search button) 

Types of Sponsor Records


Subsidized Sponsors

The main parent (Primary Caretaker) gets imported into KinderConnect by TWC.

Subsidized Sponsors will have the documents link under account.

To confirm if an account was imported, or created, click on the Sponsor's name in the search records; this takes you to the Sponsor Detail page. The Sponsor Detail page will tell you if it was imported from the TWC system or created by an Operator.  


Additional/Non-subsidized Sponsors

Non-subsidized Sponsors will not have the Documents link under Account.


Adding or Updating Sponsor Accounts

When a Sponsor needs information added or updated in their Sponsor accounts, Support must advise their Provider to make the changes in their Sponsor account. 

  • If the Provider is available, the Support Agent can speak to the Provider and guide the Provider to make the changes by selecting:
    •  Sponsor Account Needs Creation - Provider Available
    • Sponsor Record Needs Updating - Provider Available
  • If the Provider is not available to make the changes during the call, the Support Agent must inform the Sponsor that the changes will have to be made by the Provider. The Provider can contact Support for assistance in making the changes if needed. Select Sponsor Record Needs Updating - Provider Not Available

Last Update on 11/14/2023

3.button_text: Registration to More Than One Program

5.button_text: Sponsor Account Needs Creation - Provider Available

6.button_text: Sponsor Record Needs Updating - Provider Available

7.button_text: Sponsor Record Needs Updating - Provider Not Available

216.content:
What Support Agents Need to Know

  • Ensure that you state the problem to ensure you understand what the sponsor needs
  • If the Sponsor's account is locked, inform them you can unlock their account and can test logging in before resetting the PIN/Password.
  • Only assist with the PIN reset process if you are speaking to the account owner. 
  • If a Sponsor has already set up a PIN with another provider in KinderSign, there is no need to create a new one. The IVR PIN will remain the same.

If the Sponsor is having difficulties trying to reset the PIN, you must confirm the secret answer with the sponsor on the phone.

Follow the steps below to verify the secret answer with the caller:

Search for the sponsor on the Sponsor > Search page using the identifying information the caller can provide. 

Click the Account link. 
Ask the caller to verify the secret answer. Secret answers are case and punctuation sensitive. Check for any spelling or punctuation errors, including spaces either before or after the answer. These can be corrected by support.

Example: The caller states their mother's maiden name is "Smith" but the answer on file shows "Smith  "(with space/s after). Support should remove the error and save it. Notify the sponsor of the correction.

Note: If the sponsor is trying to reset the KinderSign PIN, the App must be refreshed if the secret answer is updated.

Last Update On: 01/11/2024
216.question: Select the best option:

4.button_text: Caller is not the account owner

217.content:
Locked Account Policy

Notes:

  • Support staff must speak to the Sponsor who is locked out.  
  • Providers cannot call in to request unlocking a Sponsor's account.
  • We do not unlock generic accounts (ex. CentralPark, ABC Daycare, etc.). The Sponsor must use their first and last name. Support can say, “Our security policy is such that we must speak to the person who is locked out.”
  • We cannot unlock a Sponsor account in response to a chat or Email.
  • Support Agents must not provide any information on the account.
  • Sponsors must answer their secret questions for their accounts to be unlocked.

How to Unlock a Sponsor Account

Click Account corresponding to the sponsor account in question.


Ask the caller to verify the secret answer.

Note: The Support Agent CAN NOT give any clues or hints to the sponsor regarding what their secret answer is. If the caller is unable to verify the secret answer, click on "Forgot Secret Answer" below.

Click to uncheck the "Locked" checkbox.


If the account is NOT showing locked, advise to refresh the tablet and ensure that the KinderSign app is showing Online.

Press Save.

Note: Sponsors can use the same pin if not expired. They do not need to change their PIN just because their account was locked.

Note: If there is more than one account for the same sponsor: 

  • Confirm the phone number on the correct account
  • Advise the sponsor to ask the provider to remove the phone number or inactivate the duplicate account/s. 
  • If the provider is the one who called, notify them of the issue and explain how to solve it.

Last Update On: 11/30/2023
217.question: Is the sponsor available to sign in?

2.button_text: No - Caller is Not Account Owner/Sponsor is not at the location

218.content:
Attendance is the time a child spends at the program/daycare. 

Sponsors can only enter or backdate attendance with KinderSign or KinderSmart. 

Before proceeding, please confirm which application the sponsor is using.

KinderSignThe tablet application - is normally referred to as the TX3c system.
KinderSmartThe smartphone application.


Attendance Policies

  • Sponsor must be the one to enter attendance 
  • Attendance can be backdated six (6) days from the service date by the Sponsor
  • Only ONE time must be entered for the state to accept the attendance. Sponsors only need to enter an IN or OUT time. A full-time pairing is not required for the day to be paid by TWC.
    • Agents should encourage the Sponsors to enter at all times
  • If the Provider transports the child, they may take the tablet so the sponsor can sign the child in or out. But if the tablet needs to stay at the location for others to sign in, the Provider can contact Support to request for tablet.

API Location 

When a Sponsor calls about a location where the Provider uses API to record attendance, please advise the Sponsor to contact their Provider for any attendance questions.   

Last Update On 12/21/2023
218.question: Which application is the Sponsor currently using?

219.content:
Support Agents can assist the Sponsor (account owner) if they need assistance with their secret answer. Support agents cannot assist when a request is sent by chat, email, or voicemail.

Support agents cannot give the Sponsor any clues or hints regarding their secret answer. However, below are some exceptions where Support Agents can assist:

  • Incorrect spelling
    • Support agents should verify the spelling of the secret answer with the Sponsor.  If the answer is missing a letter or some letters are switched, the Support agent must update the secret answer on file. The tablet needs to be refreshed before the Sponsor attempts to sign in again. 
    • Example 1: The answer on the system is mike, but the Sponsor enters Mike. The support agent can correct this answer.
    • Example 2: The answer on the system is Smth, but the Sponsor enters Smith. The support agent can correct this answer.
  • Letter Case
    • Support agents must inform the Sponsor that the secret answer is case-sensitive and that the Sponsor is entering the correct letter case (upper case or lower case). 
  • Hidden spaces
    • Support agents must inform the Sponsor that there is extra space. Support agents should offer to remove the spaces, but must obtain their permission first. If changes are made, the tablet needs to be refreshed before the Sponsor attempts to sign in again.
  • Having a full name (first and last name) instead of just part of the name
    • If a Sponsor provides a part of the secret answer, Support agents will need to obtain the full answer. They can tell the caller that the answer is incomplete.
    • Example: Sponsor says Jane, but it shows Jane Doe in the system
  • Having part of the name (first and last name) instead of the full name
    • If a Sponsor provides an extra name or word, Support agents can accept the answer and inform the Sponsor of what’s on the system.
    • Example: Sponsor says Jane Doe, but it shows Jane in the system 
  • If you are unsure of the next actions, please contact your manager. 

If a sponsor completely forgets the secret answer, Support agents will proceed with the Additional Verification.

Note: If the Sponsor is reporting that the secret question is different than what they set up and the secret question is set to "What is your mother's maiden name?", click on the Incorrect Secret Answer button below.

Additional Verification:

1. Subsidized Sponsor

  • Sponsors can verify themselves by providing their case numbers.
  • If the sponsor does not remember the case number, they can have the Provider Administrator validate their identity by providing them with their case number.
  • The case number can be located on the Provider page Attendance Detail under the corresponding Child Name in KinderConnect as shown below:

  • If the Provider Administrator cannot provide the case number, You must speak to the Provider Administrator and verify their secret answer.

2. Non-Subsidized or Secondary Sponsor account

  • The Support Agent must speak to the Provider Administrator and ask them to answer their security question in KinderConnect.

When the Sponsor is Verified:

  • Support should ask the Sponsor if they would like to update the secret question.
    • Support can provide the current secret answer if the Sponsor asks for it.
    • If you are changing a secret answer, make sure you confirm the spelling with the caller.
    • Support can only verify or update the secret question with the account owner.
  • Advise refreshing the tablet only if changes were made to KinderConnect.
  • If the Sponsor is at the location, click on the Pin Reset button below. 
  • If the Sponsor is NOT at the location, go to the Sponsor > Detail page to verify if the Sponsor's account is set up to the Self-Reset Feature:
    • If the Sponsor is already set up, they will reset the PIN using the recovery link
    • If the Sponsor is NOT already set up, they will reset the PIN with their secret answer. Recommend setting up their account to the Self-Reset Feature

When the Sponsor is NOT Verified:

If the Sponsor or the Provider Administrator cannot verify the sponsor's account using the Additional Verification method above, refer the Sponsor to contact TWC.

Last Update On: 08/18/2023
219.question: Was the sponsor able to verify the additional information?

5.button_text: No - Provider Admin is not available, Sponsor Will Callback.
