220.content:
Once a Sponsor signs in, they will see all the children authorized under their account. If the Sponsor is not seeing the child/ren, there could be a mismatch in the sponsor's account information, like a duplicate account or an expired authorization.

How to Check the Sponsor's Account Information:

Click Search under the Sponsor Menu.
In the Sponsor > Search form, enter the following:
  • "Child First Name"
  • "Child Last Name"
  • "Provider"
Press Search.

Note: The phone number should not be used to search because there may be a new account that has not yet been updated.
Confirm the phone number being used is related to the correct Sponsor record.

If the Sponsor's account has the correct phone number, is linked to the correct child, and there are no other sponsor records linked to the same number, select the "Information Match" button below for the next steps.

If the Sponsor's account does not have the correct phone number,  is not linked to the correct child OR  if the phone number is linked to the  Sponsor's account, but there are other sponsor records linked to the same phone number, select the "Information Does Not Match" button below for the next steps.


Note: If Sponsor proceeds to submit signature the error message below will appear below.


Last Update on 07/07/2023
220.question: Check the sponsor's account information. Does the information match?

221.content:
What is KinderSmart?

KinderSmart is a mobile application for iPhone and Android devices that allows parents/sponsors to check their children in and out of care using their smartphones.  The app contains all of the same functionality as KinderSign without the need to use the childcare facilities' tablet, enter a PIN, or take a verification photo. 

Parents/sponsors must be at the childcare location to enter attendance but may access other functions from any location with an internet connection.

Note: KinderSmart registration is not associated and not related to the sponsor's phone number in KinderConnect. 

Click here to review the minimum system requirements.


KinderSmart Registration form

To register KinderSmart, a parent/sponsor must register their app using their unique KinderSmart Registration Form. The provider can access this by following the steps below:

  1. A provider will need to search for the Parent/Sponsor under the Sponsor>Search page
  2. Remind the Provider to press the Clear button to remove previously entered criteria.
  3. Provider then enters the appropriate search criteria into the available fields. 
    • NOTE:The more criteria you add, the more specific your search results will be.
  4. Once found, click on the sponsor's name.
Once in the sponsor record, press the Print KinderSmart Registration Form button.

A pop-up will appear.
Press Print.
This will download the Registration Form to the Provider's computer.

Note: Providers cannot use the TWC-provided tablet to download the Form. The Provider should check that the name on the form matches the Sponsor who is registering.

 


Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet

When entering or backdating attendance within 150 feet of the Provider location the KinderSmart app will work without asking the Sponsor to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet. Otherwise, the Sponsor will have to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet, please ensure the Provider has it handy or they will have to print it.

 Note: The Provider should not allow Parents/Sponsors to have a copy of the Mobile Sign-in Sheet. This would allow the parent/Sponsor to register attendance from anywhere outside of the Provider's location.


The Provider will navigate to the Reports > Reports page.
They will then press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Mobile Sign In Sheet from the Report menu.

Once selected, Press View.
Once downloaded, open the file and either use the tablet (KinderSign) or the smartphone (KinderSmart) camera to scan.


Note: For Multi-board Providers, the Provider must make sure when printing out the Mobile Sign-in Sheet for the Sponsor it is associated with the board the Sponsor resides in. For more information, select Multi-board Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet.

Last Update On 09/22/2023
221.question: What issue is the Caller having with KinderSmart?

5.button_text: Deregistering Device (Lost Device or Wrong QR Code used)

223.content:
All PINs expire after one year. The system will automatically alert the sponsor when it's time to change the PIN. 

Reset Pin (KinderSign)

Use the steps below to guide the Sponsor through resetting their PIN on the KinderSign application. After successfully changing the PIN, ask the Sponsor to test their access using the new PIN. If the Sponsor is not at the location, the support agent should make sure to provide the steps below.

Note: Support should confirm if the Sponsor has the self-unlock/self-reset option set up by reviewing the Sponsor Detail page and verifying if there is an SMS or Email associated with the account.  If they do not have it set up, Support should then offer to assist with setting up their account for the Self-Unlock account feature. If the sponsor wants to do this during the call, click Yes - Assist with Self-unlock Account Setup.

From the home screen, tap the KinderSign icon to open the application. 
Enter the 10-digit telephone number associated with your KinderSign account and tap Next.
Tap the Change PIN button in the top right-hand corner of the screen.  
Using the tablet's digital keyboard, enter the answer to the secret question using the on-screen keyboard and tap Confirm.

Note: If you have confirmed the Sponsor is typing in the correct answer with proper spelling and they are still receiving an error saying their Secret Answer is incorrect, Support should check to see if there is an extra "Space" saved in the Secret Answer field in KinderConnect. Usually, it will be after the answer. If found, Support can either instruct the Sponsor to add a space after typing their answer or take the Sponsor's permission to remove the extra space in the system. 
You will now be prompted to enter a new PIN number. Type the new PIN on the phone pad and tap Confirm.


  • PIN codes must be at least 6 digits
  • PIN codes must not have sequential or repeating numbers (ex: 123456 or 111469). 
  • Although the system allows using the previous PIN codes, Support Agents must not recommend it. 
The next screen will ask you to confirm your new PIN by typing it again and tapping Confirm.

Last Update On: 05/05/2023
223.question: Is the sponsor able to log in?

0.button_text: Yes - Assist with Setting up Self-Unlock Account

1.button_text: Yes - Self-Unlock Already Setup/ Sponsor will skip Self-Unlock Account Setup

2.button_text: No - Sponsor forgot the secret answer

225.page_title: Sponsor | Entering Attendance and Recording Absent (KinderSign)
225.content:
How to Enter Attendance in KinderSign

Entering attendance means signing a child in or out of the program. The sponsor can do this by following the directions below.

If the tablet is Online, it will automatically upload all attendance to KinderConnect. If the tablet loses its internet connection, the status will display the message Offline. Parents and sponsors can still use it to sign children in/out of care. When the tablet reconnects to the internet, it will automatically upload all attendance data collected to KinderConnect. 

Notes: 

  • Attendance entered by any sponsor will be automatically approved. There is no need for the primary sponsor to approve attendance.
  • The Sponsor cannot correct or edit attendance once time stamp has been entered.  
Each time the sponsor logs in, a message will appear with terms for using the system. Tap Agree to move on to the menu.
On the Sponsor Activities screen, tap Attendance.

The Sponsor can check the internet connection status for KinderSign in the top left corner.
The tablet will take a picture of the sponsor who is signing the children in/out of care. Tap Authenticate to capture the picture.
When the child list appears, select Sign In or Sign Out by tapping the corresponding box(es) for one or more children. The system will highlight the selections. 
If the child is Absent, the sponsor will select the Absent box and add a Note to explain the reason.

If no children appear, then please select the appropriate button below.
The sponsor must Sign in to the provided area and tap Submit to automatically transmit the attendance to KinderConnect. The tablet needs to be online.
A message will appear confirming the Attendance was saved.


After attendance is entered, KinderSign will return to the telephone keypad and is ready for the next caretaker/sponsor to sign in. 

Note: If the sponsor is at the location, Support should confirm in KinderConnect that the attendance was added successfully. 

Last Update On 11/2/2023
225.question: Was the sponsor able to enter Attendance?

2.button_text: No - Sponsor is not at the location

226.content:
Backdating Attendance means signing the child/ren in and out of the program for time/days that have passed. The Sponsor can do this by following the directions below.

If the tablet is Online, it will automatically upload all attendance to KinderConnect. If the tablet loses its internet connection, the status will display the message Offline. Parents and sponsors can still use it to sign children in and out of care. When the tablet reconnects to the internet, it will automatically upload all attendance data collected to KinderConnect. 

You can check the internet connection status for KinderSign in the top left corner.

Notes: 

  • Caretakers/sponsors can only backdate up to 6 days in the past.
  • Caretakers/sponsors cannot correct or edit attendance once time stamp has been entered.  

How to Backdate Attendance

Upon signing in, a pop up will appear with the terms of using the system. Tap Agree to continue.
From the Sponsor Activities screen, tap Attendance.


The sponsor can see if the tablet is online by looking at the top left side of the tablet.

The tablet will take a picture of the caretaker/sponsor who is signing the children in or out of care. Tap Authenticate to capture the picture and proceed to the check-in screen.
The child list and the check-in screen will appear, as shown in the image on the left. The Sponsor will be taken to the All tab where they freely select any date and time they want to enter. Tap on the Date to open the calendar.

If no children appear, click on the Child Not Appearing button below.


Select the date, and time of the day by scrolling up or down. Press OK.

The date now appears in red. This indicates that the attendance will be a backdated transaction.
The sponsor can now tap to make a selection by tapping   Check In or Check Out. 

The sponsor must sign their name and click Submit.

A pop-up stating, “The attendance you submitted contained backdated transactions. Would you like to enter more attendance?”

  • Tap Yes to continue checking children in and out without reauthenticating.
  • Tap No, and the app will return to the telephone keypad login screen, ready for the next parent or sponsor to use.


How to Backdate Attendance Using the "Missed" tab

To easily view the attendance missing a time pair, the Sponsor can select the Missed tab. 

Note: Sponsors are not required to complete a time pair

A list of all attendance with a missing time pair will be displayed. This list does not include complete days where attendance was not entered.


The Sponsor can easily backdate the attendance by tapping the button that corresponds to the missing time. 

A calendar will pop up for the sponsor to select the correct time.
Select the date, and time of the day by scrolling. 
Press OK.

Review the selected time. Tap Edit 

Note: Edit is only available for editing missed times. Sponsor cannot make edits for completed timestamps.

A message that says "Attendance successfully submitted for missed days" to confirm notification.

A pop-up stating, “The attendance you submitted contained backdated transactions. Would you like to enter more attendance?”


  • Tap Yes to continue checking children in and out without reauthenticating.
  • Tap No, and the app will return to the telephone keypad login screen, ready for the next parent or sponsor to use.

Last Update On 12/4/2023
226.question: Was the sponsor able to Backdate Attendance?

3.button_text: No - Attendance is dated from over 6 days ago

4.button_text: Sponsor not at the Location/Will do it Later

227.page_title: Sponsor | Children Not Appearing: Information Match
227.content:
Information Matches and Children are Still Not Appearing

If the phone number is linked to the correct account (most recent case number) and there is no other record for the sponsor then proceed to the instructions below:

How to view the most recent case number:

Navigate to the Attendance > Detail page.
Search for the child in the "Search" field.
Find the child and obtain their case number. 
Confirm that the date being selected for entering, backdating, or approving attendance is within the timeframe the child is authorized for.
Search for a child under the Child > Search page.
Check the child's authorization on KinderConnect under the Child > Detail page. 
For Secondary Sponsors:

If the issue occurs when the Secondary sponsor signs in, guide the provider through adding all available records for the child. 

Click on Add Children > enter the child's name in question > press Search. Check the boxes next to the name and click OK. 
Both child records will show up under Add Children. Select the appropriate Relationship to Child and press Save. 
If Child Authorization is Active But at the Wrong Location

If the child's authorization is on a different provider location, Sponsors must contact their caseworker to make a change.
  • If all information matches and the date is within an authorized timeframe, inform the sponsor to refresh the app and try again. For more details on how to refresh the tablet, select Refresh Tablet.
  • Once refreshed, confirm that the tablet is online and proceed to Confirm Resolution. If not, proceed to "Device Offline."
  • If the sponsor is not at the location, inform the sponsor to refresh the tablet before signing in again.


Child Authorization Questions

  • If the caller has questions regarding the Child's authorization information or they are reporting that it needs correction, refer them to notify State Helpdesk.

  • If a subsidized child does not appear in the system but the Provider states the child should have authorization or have paperwork that the child has an active authorization, please click on “JIRA Authorized Children not Appearing in KC.”

 Last Update On 11/22/2023
227.question: Is the sponsor able to see the children now?

1.button_text: Sponsor Not at Location - Confirm Resolution

2.button_text: JIRA Authorized Children Not Appearing in KC

3.button_text: Child Authorization Questions. Refer to State Helpdesk

228.content:
iOS or Android?  

                       

The instructions to install KinderSmart on a sponsor's smartphone will differ based on their phone's operating system. KinderSmart is currently supported on both iOS and Android devices. 


iOS (iPhone)

Minimum System Requirement: iOS (version 16) or the last two versions (15,14), Rear-Facing Camera 

Tap the App Store icon on the iPhone

Please note the iPhone must be connected to the internet, and the sponsor must be signed in to their Apple account.
In the search field, type in KinderSmart Texas
Tap the 'GET' button beside KinderSmart Texas.
The app will download and appear on the home screen.


Android

Minimum System Requirement: Android (version 13) or the last two versions (12,11), Rear-Facing Camera

Tap the Play Store icon on the Android smartphone.

Please note the smartphone must be connected to the internet, and the sponsor must be signed in to their Google account.
In the search field, type in KinderSmart Texas.
Tap the KinderSmart Texas in the search results.
Tap the Install button to proceed.
The app will download and appear on the home screen.


Does the Sponsor's phone use a different operating system?

If the sponsor has a phone with an operating system other than iOS or Android, advise them that their device is not currently supported and recommend that they utilize KinderSign or IVR to track their child/children's attendance.

Last Updated On 09/26/2023

229.page_title: Sponsor | Registration to more than one program
229.content:
Using KinderSmart at Multiple Providers


Scenario 1:
The sponsor has multiple subsidy authorizations at different providers that were imported into the system from the state.
The sponsor needs to register their KinderSmart once at any of the providers. Then, the sponsor uses the Mobile Sign-in sheet to check the child in and out of care, whether at the same provider or a different one. If the sponsor is within 150 feet of either provider, the Mobile Sign-In sheet will not need to be scanned.

Scenario 2:
The sponsor has multiple subsidy authorizations at different providers that were imported into the system from the state and also an account that was manually created.
The sponsor needs to register their KinderSmart once for the subsidy accounts and also register for the manual account, then use the Mobile Sign-in sheet to check the child in and out of care.

Last Update On 04/28/2023
229.question: Select an option below:

230.content:
QR Code - KinderSmart Registration Form

A QR code (abbreviated from quick response code) is a type of matrix barcode (or two-dimensional barcode).

This is the sample of the KinderSmart Registration Form (Texas)


Before registration begins, please confirm that the sponsor has the correct form with them. 

The registration form needs to include the following information:
1. Sponsor's name
2. Provider's name & address

If the Sponsor has the incorrect registration form, refer the sponsor to the Provider to obtain the correct form.


Please note that this QR code can be scanned from a device or printed.

Registration (KinderSmart-Texas)

After the app is downloaded successfully, have the Sponsor tap the KinderSmart icon on the home screen.

"Please ensure the smartphone is connected to the internet and the location is available."
Press ALLOW. Selecting this will allow KinderSmart to take pictures and record videos to proceed. 
Another pop-up notification will ask to allow the app to have access to the device location.
Both options require selecting Allow
Current version 2.1.71
Tap Scan to proceed.
Use the rear-facing camera to scan the registration QR code on the top-left corner of the KinderSmart Registration Form.
Once the QR code is successfully scanned, the 'Device Registered' message will appear.
Tap OK to proceed.
The sponsor will be taken to the Activities screen.

Registration is complete.

Last Updated On 09/06/2023
230.question: Is the sponsor able to register KinderSmart on their Device?

2.button_text: No - Sponsor not at the location

232.page_title: Sponsor | Sponsor not at the Location
232.content:
If the sponsor is not currently at the childcare location:

  • Inform the sponsor the tablet should be refreshed before attempting to use it again.

If the sponsor asks how to refresh the tablet, you can briefly explain that the tablet can be refreshed by:

  • By closing the app on the tablet and opening it again (a staff member or a sponsor can do this).
  • Turning the tablet off and then back on (a staff member or a sponsor can do this). 
  • The provider using their telephone number & PIN combination, can access the Staff Activities screen and select the Refresh Data option.

Note: If the sponsor stated that they do not know their PIN or they will need help resetting the PIN. Go to Assist with PIN reset.

Last Update On: 04/20/23
232.question: Please choose the best Option

236.page_title: Setting Up New Account in KinderSign
236.content:
Before assisting with an account setup in KinderSign, confirm the following:

  • The Sponsor must have their phone number in KinderConnect. 
  • If the phone number has just been added/edited in KinderConnect, the tablet must be refreshed before the Sponsor can attempt to sign in to set up their KinderSign account.
  • The tablet must be Online for the account set up to take place.

All new users will be required to complete their security settings in KinderSign.

The steps are as follows:

Before a user enters their 10-digit number, please ensure the screen shows Online in the top left corner.
Use the keypad to enter the phone number.
Tap Next to proceed.

If the user has never set up their account, the following message will appear:

'Complete your account by creating a personal PIN and Security Answer/Question' 

Tap Activate Account to proceed.
Advise the user to click on the drop-down arrow to select their secret question. 
Please remind the user that the answer is case-sensitive and ensure there are no spaces before or after the answer.

Tap Next to proceed.
Create a 6 - 8 digit PIN

Tap Confirm to go to the next page.

Type in the 6 - 8 digit PIN again and tap Confirm again (after the 2nd confirmation, the page will return to the initial log-in page).

Note:  The Sponsor PIN expires after 1 year
Signing in for the first time:
Use the keypad to enter the phone number.

Tap Next to proceed.
 Enter their 6-8 digit PIN.
Tap Verify to proceed and set up the Self Unlock Feature.


The Set-Up Account Verification screen appears for the Sponsor. The Sponsor will Tap Verify with Email or Verify with SMS to select their desired verification method.

Tap Skip for now if they do not wish to verify now, and KinderSign will direct the Sponsor to the Sponsor Activities screen. 

Note: The Setup Account Verification message will continue to show until they set their account up.


Verifying with Email

Verifying with SMS

After entering an email address or a telephone number, tap Send Verification.
The Email Sent or Text Sent screen appears, verifying the Sponsor's email address or phone number. Tap Go to Home to go to the main menu.
A Verification Email or Verification Text will be sent with a link depending on the Sponsor's previous selection.
The Sponsor will click on the link to verify their email or phone number. 
For Email: The Sponsor should tap the words "Verify Your Email" if they indicate there is no link.
 A notification appears for the Sponsor showing that the email or phone number they entered was verified successfully.

Once the email address or phone number is verified, the email address or SMS phone number used for setup will appear in KinderConnect under Sponsor > Detail.

Note: If the Sponsor wants to update the email address or SMS phone number used for the self-unlock/self-reset process, SUPPORT can update this information in KinderConnect after verifying the Sponsor's secret question & answer. Support must speak to the account owner. 

The Sponsor can open KinderSign and proceed with signing in.


Last Updated On 04/24/23
236.question: Was the user able to register in KinderSign successfully?

237.content:
When there's an update made in KinderConnect, the provider should refresh the KinderSign app. A stable Wi-Fi connection is required to successfully refresh the KinderSign App. The App will refresh automatically if a user successfully logs into the device.

The App could be refreshed manually by Closing the App on the tablet and opening it back (a staff member or a sponsor can do this).

How to Properly Refresh the Tablet

Note: Depending on the model of the tablet, the button to show the Recent Applications may vary.
Models with Physical Buttons: Locate and press the Recent Applications button on the face of the tablet in the bottom left-hand corner.
Models with Digital Buttons: Tap the three vertical lines located at the bottom left-hand corner of the screen to open the Recent Applications.


Select Close All at the bottom of the screen.


Open the KinderSign app and attempt to log in.
Confirm with the caller that the KinderSign app is showing Online.


Other Ways to Refresh Tablet

When the caller cannot do the steps above, support can also suggest doing the following:

  1. The provider uses their telephone number & pin combination to access the Staff Menu and select the Refresh Data option.
  2. Turn the tablet off and then back on (a staff member or a sponsor can do this). 

Once the Sponsor is signed in, Support agents must offer to assist with setting up their account for the Self-Unlock account feature. If the sponsor wants to do this during the call, assist with Self-unlock Account Setup.

Last Update On: 09/21/2023
237.question: Is the sponsor able to log in?

0.button_text: Yes - Assist with Setting up Self-Unlock Account

1.button_text: Yes - Self-Unlock Already Setup/ Sponsor will skip Self-Unlock Account Setup

4.button_text: No - Account Locked (Support Unlocking the Account)

8.button_text: No - Sponsor will try to log in later

9.button_text: No - Issue Not Resolved. Escalate Call

239.page_title: Sponsor | Using Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet QR Code
239.content:
How to use the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet QR Code

When a Sponsor is using KinderSmart, they need the Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet to enter attendance. Only the Provider has access to the Provider Mobile Sign-In QR code.

If the Sponsor is with a Provider, you can assist the Provider with the instructions below:

Press Reports under Reports.
Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Mobile Sign In Sheet from the Report menu.
Press View Report to download the pdf.
Once downloaded, open the file and have the sponsor use their smartphone camera to scan in the KinderSmart app.
Last updated: 05/3/2023
239.question: Was the Sponsor able to use the Mobile Sign-in Sheet?

2.button_text: No - Sponsor is not at the location

240.page_title: Sponsor | Child Not Appearing - Information Does Not Match
240.content:
An information mismatch prevents the Sponsor from seeing the correct child/ren records. They will not be able to see them under their account.

If the Sponsor's account does not have the correct phone number,  is not linked to the correct child OR  if the phone number is linked to the Sponsor's account, but there are other sponsor records linked to the same phone number, read the instructions below.

How to Check and Resolve Sponsor's Mismatched Information

Recommend that the Provider searches for Sponsors using the child's name to confirm if there are multiple records for the child.
By using the child/relationship column, find the newest record for the child. This is the account the Sponsor should use.

Guide the Provider to select the account that needs to get updated by clicking on the Sponsor's name:

Scenario 1: If a phone number is missing or incorrect, have the Provider add the correct phone number to the Sponsor record.
Scenario 2: If it is a subsidized child record and the wrong sponsor is linked to the account or the child's account authorization has expired, the Sponsor will need to contact TWC/State Helpdesk.
Scenario 3: If the Sponsor's phone number is correct but there are other sponsor records linked to the same phone number, the Sponsor is selecting the incorrect account when signing into KinderSign. Advise the Sponsor to select their own name when signing in. 


Note: If there are any updates made in KinderConnect, Support agents must advise the Provider and/or Sponsor to refresh the tablet before signing in. 

Last Update on 04/27/2023
240.question: Is the provider able to troubleshoot?

242.content:
A user may not be able to register their account for multiple reasons:



Error Message - Phone Number Not Found

Support should look up the phone number to see if the phone number entered matches what the user is entering. If it doesn't match, the phone number needs to be updated. If it matches, advise the Sponsor to refresh the tablet before signing in.

For Sponsors, they will have to contact the Provider to add/update the phone number. 

              If the phone number entered matches what is in the system, check to see if the tablet is 'Online' in the top-left corner of the KinderSign screen. If not, refer the sponsor to the program to connect the tablet to the internet.

    

Last Update On 05/15/2023
242.question: Did troubleshoot help fix the issue?

1.button_text: No - Phone Number needs an update (Provider Available)

2.button_text: No - Phone Number Needs An Update (Provider NOT Available)

243.content:
Backdating Attendance means signing the child/ren in and out of the program for time/days that have passed. 

Notes: 

  • Caretakers/sponsors have up to 6 calendar days to enter attendance 
  • Caretakers/sponsors cannot correct or edit attendance once time stamp has been entered.  

How to Backdate Attendance in KinderSmart

If a provider needs assistance with viewing/downloading the Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet QR Code, please click on the appropriate button below.


Open the KinderSmart app on the phone. Note that the phone must already be registered with the Provider.

Once the Activities screen displays, tap Attendance.
Tap Scan to enable the camera.
If the Sponsor is within 150 feet of the location this screen will be skipped.


Move the QR code into the view of the phone camera so that it can be clearly seen on the phone screen. As soon as the whole QR code is visible to the phone camera, the phone scans the code automatically.
The check-in screen will appear as shown.

Tap on the date to open the calendar.
Scroll up/down to select the desired date and time.

Tap OK to confirm.
You can now tap to make your selection (Sign In, Sign Out, or Absent). 

Note: The Date turns red when it is in the past
The Sponsor must sign their name and tap Submit Attendance
A message confirming attendance was submitted will appear
A pop-up stating, “The attendance you submitted contained backdated transactions. Would you like to enter more attendance?”

  • Tap Yes to continue checking children in and out
  • Tap No to return to the Activities screen.

Last Update On: 04/27/2023

When entering or backdating attendance within 150 feet of the Provider location the KinderSmart app will work without asking the Sponsor to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet. Otherwise, the Sponsor will have to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet, please ensure the Provider has it handy or they will have to print it.

If approving attendance, the Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet is not required.

Please select one of the topics below:

Signing into KinderSign

246.page_title: Sponsor | Entering Attendance and Recording Absent (KinderSmart)
246.content:
To enter attendance, a Sponsor will need to be within 150 feet of the center. If the device the sponsor is using is not within 150 feet the sponsor will need to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet.

Note: If the Provider is present and needs assistance with viewing/downloading the Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet QR Code, please click on the appropriate button below.

Open the KinderSmart app on the phone. Note that the phone must be already registered with the Provider.


Open the KinderSmart app on the phone. Note that the phone must be already registered with the Provider.



Once the Activities screen displays, tap Attendance.
IF requested, tap Scan to enable the QR Code reader.


Note: If the GPS of the phone reads that the device is within 150 feet of the location, it will skip scanning the Mobile Sign-in Sheet. 

Move the QR code into the view of the phone camera so that it can be clearly seen on the phone screen. As soon as the whole QR code is visible to the phone camera, the phone scans the code automatically.
When the child list appears, select Sign In or Sign Out by tapping the corresponding box(es) for one or more children. The system will highlight the selections. 
If the child is Absent, the sponsor will select the Absent box and add a Note to explain the reason.

If no children appear, then please select the appropriate button below.
The Sponsor should Sign and click Submit Attendance at the bottom of the screen.
A message will appear confirming the Attendance was saved.


The system again displays the Sponsors Activities screen.




Notes:

  • Attendance is automatically transmitted to KinderConnect, and the system confirms the transaction.
  • Caretakers/sponsors cannot correct or edit attendance once time stamp has been entered.

251.content:
Troubleshooting a Device that is Offline

A provider will have to troubleshoot a device that is offline. 

An Agent can ask the provider to confirm the following:

  • If the tablet is showing an offline status, confirm if the internet is working.
    1. Ask the provider if there are other devices that are connected to the same Wi-Fi network and if the internet is working on said devices 
      • If other devices are connected, the issue might be from the tablet. Go to step (2)
      • If other devices have the same issue connecting to the internet, try resetting the modem/router, but most likely, the provider will need to contact their internet service provider
    2. Ask the provider to click on the KinderConnect bookmark.
      • If the page loads, that means the tablet is connected to the internet
      • If the page doesn't load, you will need to troubleshoot the Wi-Fi connection.

Confirm what device the caller is using: 


 Android
iOS


Last Update On: 11/07/2023
251.question: What Device is the Caller Using?

252.content:
Troubleshooting Android Connectivity Issues

Tap the Settings icon on the tablet home screen.

Tap Connections, then tap on the slider next to the Wi-Fi option to turn it on.

Tap on the Wi-Fi option to display a list of available networks. 

Tap on the name of the network you would like to connect to.

Enter the password if it is a secure Wi-Fi network. The Connect option enables once the password is entered. Tap Connect.


"Connected, no internet" may display. 
It is part of the process and should change to "Connected" within a couple of minutes. If it does not change, proceed to Troubleshoot.

Once the connection is established, the status will change to Connected. 

You can check the strength of your connection by looking at the status bar at the top of the tablet: the more bars, the better the signal.

Once you confirm the connection, tap the Home button on the lower portion of the tablet to return to the Home screen.


Troubleshooting Connectivity Issues - Tablet on Kiosk Mode
Tap the “(i)” button located in the lower-left corner to access the settings menu.
Tap Settings to view the available settings options.
Tap on the Wi-Fi option to select and display a list of available networks. 
Press OK to exit.




Tap on the name of the network you would like to connect to.
Enter the password if it is a secure Wi-Fi network.  Tap Connect.
Once the connection is established, the status will change to Connected. You can check the strength of your connection by looking at the status bar at the top of the tablet.
Once you confirm the connection, tap the Home button to return to the Home screen.

Last Update On: 08/11/2023
252.question: Did Troubleshooting Resolve The issue?

2.button_text: No - Provider Not at Location or Cannot test.

253.content:
If the provider says, they are still having trouble connecting their tablet to the internet, first verify whether other devices connected to the same Wi-Fi network are working or not. If none of the other devices are working, they may need to reset their router/modem or contact their ISP for assistance with their internet connection. 

If other devices are connecting properly, but their tablet is not, proceed with the following troubleshooting steps:

Device Connected. No Internet Troubleshooting

↘️ Android Devices

Ask the Provider to tap the KinderConnect bookmark on the home screen or open any page on the web browser. 
If the selected site loads, the Provider has a working connection.
If the site does not load, try the troubleshooting steps below:
1. What is the signal strength indicator showing? Ask the provider to move closer to their router if it is not at full strength.
2. Turn off the Wi-Fi connection, turn it on again, and reconnect.
3. Forget the Wi-Fi connection and then reconnect to it.

4. Tap on the name of the network you would like to connect to. 

Enter the password if it is a secure Wi-Fi network. The Connect option enables once the password is entered. Tap Connect.

5. Restart the tablet.
Close

↘️ Kiosk Mode Devices

Ask the Provider to tap the KinderConnect bookmark on the home screen or open any page on the web browser. 
If the selected site loads, the Provider has a working connection.
If the site does not load, try the troubleshooting steps below:
What is the signal strength indicator showing? Ask the provider to move closer to their router if it is not at full strength.
2.Click on the lowercase "i" in the bottom left-hand corner of the tablet
 From the settings menu, select Wi-Fi
Turn off the Wi-Fi connection, turn it back on again and reconnect.
From the list of Available WiFi Networks, click on the Network Name of the currently connected network.
Click on "Forget" with the Trashcan icon in the bottom right-hand corner.
Note: Forgetting the network means they will have to re-enter their Wi-Fi password. Please make sure the provider knows their Wi-Fi password before pressing forget.
The page returns to the list of available networks. Click on the desired network name.
Enter the password if it is a secure Wi-Fi network. The Connect option enables once the password is entered. Tap Connect.
Restart the tablet.
Close

↘️ Apple Devices

Ask the Provider to sign in to KinderConnect on the home screen or open any page on the web browser. 
If the selected site loads, the Provider has a working connection.
If the site does not load, try the troubleshooting steps below:
1. What is the signal strength indicator showing? Ask the provider to move closer to their router if it is not at full strength.
2. Turn off the Wi-Fi connection, turn it on again, and reconnect.
3. Forget the Wi-Fi connection and then reconnect to it.

4. A list of available networks appears. Tap the name of the secure Wi-Fi network you would like to join to select.  

Enter the password for the secure Wi-Fi network, then tap Join. The Join option activates once the password is entered.

5. Restart the tablet.
Close



Last Update On 12/15/2023
253.question: Did the troubleshooting resolve the issue?

254.content:
Troubleshooting iOS Connectivity Issues

Tap the Settings icon on the iPad home screen.

Tap on the Wi-Fi settings option.

Tap the slider to turn the Wi-Fi on.

A list of available networks appears. Tap the name of the secure Wi-Fi network you would like to join to select.

Enter the password for the secure Wi-Fi network, then tap Join. The Join option activates once the password is entered.

Once the iPad connects, you will see the name of the network you connected to with a checkmark next to it. To confirm the iPad is connected to Wi-Fi, verify the signal strength that appears in the top right corner of the iPad screen.

Once connected, tap the Home button on the lower portion of the iPad to return to the Home Screen.
If the provider says they still have issues connecting to the internet, click on the Troubleshoot button below.


Last Update On: 04/18/2023

255.page_title: Sponsor | Deregistering a Smartphone in KinderConnect
255.content:
If a Sponsor's smartphone is lost, stolen, given to someone else, or has been registered with the wrong QR code, the Sponsor's device will have to be deregistered (the device must be removed from their Sponsor account) in KinderConnect.

There are two scenarios where a smartphone will need to be deregistered from KinderConnect:

1. KinderSmart app is registered to the incorrect Sponsor account

  • The Provider needs to provide the correct QR code to the Sponsor.
  • If the Support Agent is speaking to a Provider the Support Agent will need to explain how the Provider can deregister the phone from the Sponsor Detail page.
  • If the Support Agent is speaking to the Sponsor, the Support Agent will give two options to the Sponsor:
    • The Sponsor can ask the Provider to deregister the smartphone.
    • The Support Agent can send an email to the State Operations Manager to deregister the smartphone.
      • The State Operations Manager will email the Support Agent back once deregistered and ask them to please call back the Sponsor to let them know. If a caller asks how long this process should take, inform them about 48 hours.

2. KinderSmart app is registered to the correct Sponsor account

  • If the Support Agent is speaking to a Provider the support agent will need to explain how the Provider can deregister the phone from the Sponsor Detail page
  • If the Support Agent is speaking to the sponsor the Support Agent will give two options to the Sponsor:
    • The Sponsor can ask the Provider to deregister the smartphone.
    • The Support Agent can send an email to the State Operations Manager to deregister the smartphone.
      • The State Operations Manager will email the Support Agent back once deregistered and ask them to please call back the Sponsor to let them know. If a caller asks how long this process should take, inform them about 48 hours.


How Providers Can Deregister a SmartPhone:

Select the Sponsor > Search option from the navigation bar.
Enter your search criteria.
Sponsors who meet the search criteria are displayed in the Search Results.

Click on a Sponsor's name in the Sponsor Name column to navigate to the corresponding Sponsor > Detail page.
The provider can see all Registered Devices. The provider will Press Delete to deregister the smartphone.
The provider must press Save.

Last Update On: 05/03/2023
255.question: Select the best option below:

0.button_text: The provider was able to deregister the sponsor smartphone

1.button_text: Escalate to the Operations Manager to deregister the smartphone

259.page_title: Device Offline No Internet - Further Troubleshooting (Android & iOS Devices)
259.content:
If none of the steps so far have worked, try the following:

Android

Tap the Settings icon on the tablet home screen.

  1. In the Settings menu on the left, tap:
    • General Management for an Android Device
  2. Select the Date and time from the options that appear on the right.

On Android devices the setting we are looking for is called "Automatic date and Time"
Skip this step if the caller says the setting is on.
If the caller says the setting is off. Ask them to turn it on and restart the tablet. If the issue is not fixed proceed with the instructions below.
If the setting is already on or the above step didn't work, ask the caller to turn it off, and then on again, then restart the tablet.
Close Section

Kiosk Mode

Tap the “(i)” button located in the lower-left corner to access the settings menu.

Tap Settings to view the available settings options.



Tap on the Date and Time option.

Disable the Automatic Date and Time option. 

Tap Set Date to adjust the date. Tap Set Time to adjust the time. 

Tap Done to save the changes. 



Once adjusted, tap the Home button to return to the Home screen.


Close Section

iOS Devices


Tap the Settings icon on the tablet home screen.
  1. In the Settings menu on the left, tap:
    • General for an iOS device
  2. Select Date and time from the options that appear on the right.
On iOS devices it just says "Set Automatically".


Skip this step if the caller says the setting is on.

If the caller says the setting is off. Ask them to turn it on and restart the tablet. If the issue is not fixed proceed with the instructions below.
If the setting is already on or the above step didn't work, ask the caller to turn it off, and then on again, then restart the tablet.
Close Section

Last Update On: 12/15/2023
259.question: Did the tablet connect to the Internet?

268.page_title: Sponsor | Unlock Account with Self-Reset Help - KinderSign
268.content:
After a Sponsor sets up the self-reset, they can self-unlock. Use the steps below to guide a Sponsor on how to unlock their KinderSign account with the self-unlock setup. 

Unlock Account with Self-Reset


After entering their PIN incorrectly five times, KinderSign notifies the Sponsor that "Your Account is Locked."
Tap Send Recovery PIN.

Note: Depending on how the Sponsor sets up their Self Reset, they will be sent an Email link or Text link.
The Email Sent or Text Sent screen appears, verifying the Sponsor's email address or phone number.

Tap Go to Home to go to the main menu.
A Verification Email or Verification Text will be sent to the Sponsor with a link depending on their previous selection.

They need to click on the link to reset their PIN.
The Sponsor will enter their new 6-8 digit PIN. Re-enter their 6-8 digit PIN and tap Update PIN.
A notification appears for the Sponsor showing a successful PIN change.
Ask the sponsor to sign in to KinderSign with their 10-digit telephone number and updated PIN to confirm.


Note: If the sponsor is not at the location or not available to troubleshoot the issue, the support agent must ask the sponsor to answer the secret question to unlock their account in KinderConnect

Last Update On: 05/19/2023
268.question: Was the Sponsor able to unlock their account with the self-reset?

3.button_text: No - Proceed to support unlocking the account

269.page_title: Sponsor | Updating PIN without Self-Reset Set Up - KinderSign
269.content:
If a sponsor did not set up the KinderSign self-reset, the sponsor would be prompted to update the PIN with Email or SMS, depending on their desired verification method. Follow these steps to guide the Sponsor on unlocking their account. 

Note: This automatically sets up the sponsor's account for the Self-Reset/Self-Unlock feature. 

Updating PIN without Self-Reset Set-Up


After entering their PIN incorrectly too many times, KinderSign notifies the Sponsor that "Your Account is Locked" and displays their Secret Question.

The Sponsor will enter the answer to their Secret Question and tap Confirm.

The Update your PIN through Email or SMS screen appears for the Sponsor.
 
The Sponsor will select Update with Email or Update with SMS depending on their desired verification method.


Updating PIN with Email

Updating PIN with SMS

The Sponsor will tap Send Verification after entering an email address or a telephone number.
The Email Sent or Text Sent screen appears for the Sponsor, confirming a link was sent to their email address or phone number.
Tap Go to Home to go to the main menu.
A Verification Email or Verification Text will be sent with a link depending on their previous selection.
The Sponsor needs to click on the link to update their PIN.
The Sponsor will enter their new 6-8 digit PIN.
Then re-enter their 6-8 digit PIN and tap Update PIN.
A notification appears for the Sponsor showing a successful PIN change.
Ask the sponsor to sign in to KInderSign with their 10-digit telephone number and updated PIN to confirm successful login.

Last Update On: 8/11/2023
269.question: Is the sponsor now able to sign in?

4.button_text: No - Sponsor is not at the location

271.content:
All PINs will need to be reset every 365 days. The system will automatically alert the sponsor when it's time to change the PIN. 

If the Sponsor enters their phone number and receives a notification that their PIN has expired, you will need to use the steps below to guide the Sponsor through resetting their Expired PIN on the KinderSign application.

Check if the Sponsor Account has an Email Address/SMS Number Setup in KinderConnect. 

Click on the method below that matches the Sponsor's scenario:

Sponsor with Email Address/SMS Number+

After entering the phone number in KinderSign, the sponsor will be notified that the PIN has expired. Tap Update PIN. 
The Email Sent or Text Sent screen appears confirming a link was sent to your email address or phone number.

Tap Go to Home to go to the main menu.
The support agent will ask the Sponsor to go to their email or SMS inbox. A Verification Email or Verification Text will be sent with a link.

Click on the link to reset the PIN.
From their device, the sponsor will enter and confirm their new 6-8 digit PIN.

Tap Update PIN.
 A notification appears showing a successful PIN change on the Sponsor's device.
After the Sponsor updates the PIN, the Support agent will ask the Sponsor to close and re-open KinderSign then, sign in with their telephone number and new PIN.


Close

Sponsor without Email Address/SMS Number+

After entering the phone number in KinderSign, the sponsor will be notified that the PIN has expired. Tap Update PIN. 
Using the tablet's digital keyboard, the sponsor will enter the answer to the secret question and tap Done. When the keyboard disappears, tap the "Confirm" button. 

Note: If the sponsor says that the Confirm button is not working, please make sure that they are tapping "Done" first on the digital keyboard. 
 The sponsor will now be prompted to enter a new PIN. Type the new PIN on the phone pad and tap "Next."
The next screen will ask to confirm the new PIN by typing it again and tapping Next.
The sponsor will then be prompted to sign in with their telephone number and new PIN.

If the sponsor is available, recommend setting up their account for the Self-Reset process.



Close

273.content:
KinderSign is a tablet-based mobile application designed for the provider to collect child care attendance from parents and other authorized adults when signing their children in and out of care at their childcare providers. All attendance records obtained via KinderSign are uploaded to KinderConnect via a Wi-Fi connection. 


Real-time stamp information is available for time-and-attendance tracking, reporting, and provider reimbursement.

Last Update On: 04/20/23
273.question: Select the topic that best describes the provider's issue or question.

5.button_text: Sponsor Setting Up Account in KinderSign

274.content:
If a sponsor reports that the link to update their PIN is expired, support should follow the guidelines below to assist the sponsor in continuing with the self-reset process.

Why does the link expire?

  • The link automatically expires when the sponsor sends another request to send a recovery link by email or SMS. Each request will send a new e-mail. 
  • The link expires after 72 hours.

How to fix the issue?

  • Advise the sponsor to look for the most updated email or SMS from KinderSign. 
    • Some email applications, such as Gmail, group all the messages under one sender. If this is the case, recommend deleting all the emails sent from KinderSign. Then, advise the sponsor to click on Resend Email link.
  • If the sponsor is still having trouble loading the recovery link using email after following the steps above, recommend switching the method to SMS, but the guidelines below must be followed:
    • Support must speak to the account owner.  
    • Support must verify the sponsor's secret question and answer. 
    • After verification, support can delete the email address and add the SMS number. Press Save.

Last Update On: 04/22/2023
274.question: Select the best option below:

275.content:
KinderSign offers a Self-Reset or Self-Unlock feature that allows Sponsors to verify or unlock their account with their email or SMS number.

Last Update On: 4/18/2023
275.question: Select the topic that best describes the sponsor's concern:

277.content:
A Sponsor's account gets locked out when they enter an incorrect PIN in the KinderSign app 3 times. Before assisting with locked accounts, verify the phone number and the Sponsor's name to ensure you look at the correct account.

  • Self-Unlocking an Account (Account Already Setup)
    • Select this if the Sponsor has already set up their verification email or verification SMS number. 
    • Support Agents should assist the Sponsor with the Self-Unlock Account process.
  • Self-Unlocking an Account (Account Not Setup)
    • Select this if the Sponsor has not yet set up their verification email or verification SMS number (no email or SMS phone number in KinderConnect).
    • Support Agents can assist the Sponsor with the Self-Unlock Account (Account Not Setup) process. If the Sponsor is available, Support Agents should recommend and help the Sponsors in setting up the Self-Reset/Self-Unlock process.


Last Update On 4/24/2023
277.question: Which method is the sponsor going to use to unlock the account?

278.content:
Sponsors must follow the steps below when setting Self-Reset/Self-Unlock Set Up for the first time. Support Agents cannot add an email or SMS phone number when the Sponsor is setting up Self Reset/Self Unlock for the first time.

Self-Reset/ Self-Unlock Set Up


Enter the 10-digit telephone number, followed by the 6-8 digit PIN, then tap Verify.

The Set-Up Account Verification screen appears for the Sponsor. The Sponsor will Tap Verify with Email or Verify with SMS to select their desired verification method.

Tap Skip for now if they do not wish to verify now, and KinderSign will direct the Sponsor to the Sponsor Activities screen. 

Note: The Setup Account Verification message will continue to show until they set their account up.


Verifying with Email

Verifying with SMS

After entering an email address or a telephone number, tap Send Verification.


The Email Sent or Text Sent screen appears, verifying the Sponsor's email address or phone number. Tap Go to Home to go to the main menu.


A Verification Email or Verification Text will be sent with a link depending on the Sponsor's previous selection.
The Sponsor will click on the link to verify their email or phone number. 

 A notification appears for the Sponsor showing that the email or phone number they entered was verified successfully.
The Sponsor can open KinderSign and proceed with signing in.


Once the email address or phone number is verified, the email address or SMS phone number used for setup will appear in KinderConnect under Sponsor > Detail.

Note: If the Sponsor wants to update the email address or SMS phone number used for the self-unlock/self-reset process, SUPPORT can update this information in KinderConnect after verifying the Sponsor's secret question & answer. Support must speak to the account owner. 

Last Update On: 01/10/2023
278.question: Was the Sponsor able to set up their account for Self-Reset/ Self-Unlock?

1.button_text: No - Verification email address /SMS number needs an update

2.button_text: No - Sponsor will skip Self-Reset/Self-Unlock Setup

281.content:
When there's an update made in KinderConnect, the provider should refresh the data from the KinderSign app. A stable Wi-Fi connection is required to successfully refresh the KinderSign App. The App will refresh automatically if a user successfully logs into the device automatically.

The App could be refreshed manually by Closing the App on the tablet and opening it back (a staff member or a sponsor can do this).

How to Properly Refresh the Tablet

Note: Depending on the model of the iPad, the steps to show the Recent Applications may vary.
Earlier Models with Physical Buttons: From the Home Screen, double-click the Home button or swipe up from the bottom of the screen and pause in the middle of the screen to show your most recently used apps.
Current Models with Digital Buttons: From the Home Screen, swipe up from the bottom of the screen and pause in the middle of the screen.
Swipe up on the KinderSign app's preview to close the app.
If you cannot find the KinderSign app, you may need to swipe right or left to find the app that you want to close.
Open the KinderSign app and attempt to log in.
Confirm with the caller that the KinderSign app is showing Online.

Other Ways to Refresh Tablet

When the steps above cannot be done by the caller, support can also suggest doing the following:

  1. The provider uses their telephone number & pin combination to access the Staff Menu and select the Refresh Data option.
  2. Turn the tablet off and then back on (a staff member or a sponsor can do this). 

Once the Sponsor is signed in, Support agents must offer to assist with setting up their account for the Self-Unlock account feature. If the sponsor wants to do this during the call, assist with Self-unlock Account Setup.

Last Update On:  09/21/2023
281.question: Is the sponsor able to log in?

1.button_text: Yes - Sponsor will skip Self-Unlock Setup

6.button_text: No - Issue Not Resolved. Escalate Call

282.content:
When a caller has issues while using the KinderSmart app, Support must identify the following:

  • Confirm the error message that the Sponsor is seeing
  • Confirm the actions that the Sponsor is doing every time they encounter the issue
  • Confirm if their smartphone is connected to the internet
  • Confirm in KinderConnect that the Sponsor's account is active
IssueIssue DescriptionSolutions
Time Sync Error
Phones will request to scan QR code give error and to call support.
Advise caller this is a current issue and we are working to resolve it as soon as possible no further action is needed.
Connection ErrorError when Scanning the Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet
Confirm the phone has an internet connection. The sponsor can test by opening any website.
Locked accountA sponsor is getting a Locked Account error when scanning the Provider Mobile Sign-In SheetThe account is inactive. The provider will have to activate the account.
Locked accountA sponsor is getting a Locked Account error when scanning the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet, but in KinderConnect, the account is not locked.

The sponsor registered the KinderSmart app with a different account. Search for Multiple accounts for the same family using the child's name under the Sponsor > Search. 

A) Check all accounts to see which account is locked. Verify if the account used is the most recent and belongs to the same person who called.  Ask the secret question to unlock the account.
B) If the account is under someone else, recommend the sponsor to ask the provider to print the correct QR code for their account.
App Download IssuesA sponsor is getting an error: Unable to download this application in this country when downloading the KinderSmart app.The sponsor's Google Play Store (Android phones) and App Store (iPhones) country setting is not set to the United States. (TX3c system cannot be accessed outside the country.)

Guide the sponsor through changing the setting to the United States and try again. 
Can't BackdateThe date is not appearing on the sign-in/out pageThe sponsor is using an older version of KSmart. Ask the Sponsor to update the app.
Location services turned off.The sponsor receives an error message stating location services are turned off.
  • Check that the smartphone has location services enabled.
  • Check the KinderSmart app has location permissions enabled.
    • Enable both Smartphone and Kindersmart app
  • Refresh the app by closing or restarting the device and test
    • If the error still persists, escalate the call. 
Wrong Account Registered to Sponsor's Device/ Wrong Children AppearingWhen a Sponsor signs in, they are not seeing the children associated with them. 

The KinderSmart device was registered with the wrong QR code.
The Sponsor must obtain the correct KinderSmart Registration code from their Provider, then scan the correct QR code. 

If needed, advise the Sponsor to re-install the app and scan the correct QR code.
Incomplete RegistrationThe Sponsor is getting an error "Device must be registered" or the Sponsor is stating that it's asking to scan the QR code even after scanning the code.Guide the Sponsor in registering their smartphone correctly. Sponsors can ask the Provider for the QR codes needed. 

For more information, click on the KinderSmart Registration button below.
When a sponsor signs in and attempts to submit without a child appearing, this Warning message will appear. 

1. This could mean that the Sponsor does not see a child when they sign in. If so, verify the child's authorization is active.

2. This could mean the sponsor may have submitted a time but did not select an action in KinderSign. (example: selecting sign in, sign out, entering note)



Multiple Sponsors Asked to Scan Provider Mobile Sign-In SheetWhen multiple sponsors at a daycare location are being asked to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-In sheet, there could be an issue with the geocode that was set during registration.Support Agents need to be speaking to a listed Provider Administrator before proceeding.
1. Support Agents will need to go to the Provider > Detail Page and make sure the "Reset Geolocation" checkbox is checked. 
2. Support Agents will guide the Provider though registering the tablet for KinderSign again. Click on Reregister The Tablet for KinderSign button below for the next steps.
"Device must be registered" error
This occurs for Sponsors of multi-board providers when the Provider prints a Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet for a board the Sponsor is Not associated with. Support Agents must guide the Provider to find and print the correct board Mobile Sign-in Sheet for the Sponsor. And then, have the Sponsor scan the new Mobile Sign-in Sheet associated with the board the Sponsor resides in.
For more information, click- Multi-board Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet


The Sponsor gets the message "We have detected an untrusted connection. For your protection, please switch networks, close and reopen the app, or contact support. REF: 6500"

The Sponsors phone has a version of KinderSmart that is out of date

Support should guide the Sponsor in updating to the most recent version of KinderSign for Texas.

Go to App Store(Apple)/Play Store(Android) > Type KinderSign Texas in the search bar > select the KinderSign Texas app > tap the button that says Update

Smartphone in Developer Mode
When the Sponsor opens KinderSmart, they get the error message above, preventing them from using the application.

This error means that developer mode is enabled. 
Explain the issue to the Sponsor and advise that they cannot access KinderSmart if the developer mode is on.
If they agree to disable this on their phone, assist the Sponsor in disabling the Developer mode. 

Android:

Go to About Phone > Software Information > Tap Build Number 7 times (A notification at the bottom will appear indicating how many more times to tap until the device switches into developer mode) > Enter your phone PIN number. 

In Settings, a menu for Developer Options will appear. Tap on the menu and un-toggle the “On” option. Close out the settings menu and re-open KinderSmart; it will open without the error message.

  If the caller states they are having issues not listed above, please select Smartphone Error Codes to view a list.

Last Update On: 04/16/2024

Before selecting a topic: If you are talking to a Provider or a Sponsor, and you found that the account in question is not a subsidy account, use the child's first and last name and check if the Sponsor has a subsidized account.

285.content:
When searching for sponsors, it is important to understand that the search criteria being used could give you different results. For example:

When searching by Phone Number, we do not see any duplicate accounts.
When searching by Sponsor Name, we find that there are multiple records with the same name. We see that a phone number isn’t associated with the records.
When searching by Child Name, the search result will show the sponsor/s associated with the child. 
Make sure you search using the correct provider.

Note: TWC sets up the primary caretaker accounts. If you cannot find an account for the sponsor in question, the program will have to create a new sponsor account manually.


If the Provider states they cannot see a Sponsor with an active schedule/authorization, the Provider can check if the Sponsor is assigned to a different location.

If the Sponsor is not found in other locations, the Provider can advice to create a Sponsor account under the desired region/board. 

Last Update On: 10/06/2023
285.question: Are you able to find the account?

286.content:
Which account to choose?

When searching for Sponsors, it is important to understand that the search criteria being used could give you different results. 

Agents must confirm by checking the active authorization records for the children. The current authorization can be confirmed by matching the case number on the sponsor and child search grid.

Scenario 1

In this scenario, one of the accounts is Active, and one is Inactive. The Support Agent should use the active account.

Scenario 2

In this scenario, there are two accounts. One account is a Subsidized account, and one is a Non-Subsidized account. If the child has active authorization, the account that the Sponsor should use is the Subsidized account.

If the sponsor is showing 2 accounts for the same name there are 2 things that can occur:
  1. One record is subsidized and the other was created by the provider
    • Solution: The provider can change the non-subsidized records number/make inactive
  2. Both sponsor records are subsidized and added by the state
    • Solution: The sponsor would need to contact the state to let them know the sponsor is on 2 subsidized records, and confirm the locations the child attends.

Check child authorizations by selecting the child's name in the Sponsor > Search page.

Scenario 3

In this scenario, there are three accounts. The support agent needs to confirm the name on the account.


For Support Agents:

  • Confirm the phone number on the correct account. 
  • Advise the sponsor to ask the provider to remove the phone number or inactivate the duplicate account/s.
  • After updates, ensure the sponsor refreshes the tablet before attempting to sign in again.

Other Notes:

  • If you are talking to a Provider or a Sponsor, and you found that the account in question is not a subsidy account, use the child's first and last name and check if there are other accounts that the Sponsor should be using. Confirm the correct account by using the No - Advanced Search Techniques button below.

  • A sponsor might use KinderSmart. If the account changes, inform the sponsor to ask the provider to get a new KinderSmart registration form.

Last Update On 04/27/2023

287.content:
Self-Reset/ Self-Unlock

For Support: 

Support Agents should offer to assist with setting up their account for the Self-Unlock account feature. If the Sponsor is not at the location, inform them of the self unlock feature. If the sponsor is available to do this during the call, support should assist with the steps. This will make it easier for the Sponsor to unlock their account and reset their PIN anytime.

Before assisting with any Sponsor-related issues, you must search for the Sponsor account. Sponsors should not share accounts. Agents should recommend that Sponsors contact the Providers to create an account for them.

How to Search for a Sponsor

Guide the Provider through the instructions below:

Select the Sponsor > Search option from the navigation bar.
Enter your search criteria.

If the provider has difficulties searching, remind them of the following: 
  • It is recommended to always hit clear before entering search criteria 
  • The more information you enter, the fewer results you will see
  • Spaces before and after search criteria will affect search results
  • For hyphenated names, it is recommended to only enter the first name(before the hyphen)
Note:
You can search using the Sponsor name, Sponsor phone number, or the Child's name and are able to search each criteria individually.
Press Search.
Sponsors who meet the search criteria are displayed in the Search Results.
Click on a Sponsor's name in the Sponsor Name column to navigate to the corresponding Sponsor > Detail page.
Click on Account to navigate to the corresponding Sponsor > Account page.
Inform the provider that all results are listed in alphabetical or numerical order by default. It is possible to change the order of the results by clicking on the column heading.
Press Clear to clear the search criteria previously entered.

Last Update On: 05/03/202

290.content:
If a Sponsor runs into sign-in issues preventing them from successfully accessing KinderSign it is important to locate the correct account.

Select the Sponsor > Search option from the navigation bar.
1. It is recommended to search for the account using the Phone Number. This is the first option to locate the account. Once the account is located, confirm the sponsor's first and last name. 
Note: Do not give the phone number or the name. You must ask for this information. 

2. If there are no results, use one of the following criteria:

  • Sponsor First/ Last Name
  • Child's First / Last Name
Note:
  • It is recommended to always hit clear before entering search criteria 
  • The more information you enter, the fewer results you will see
  • Spaces before and after search criteria will affect search results
  • For hyphenated names, it is recommended to only enter the first name(before the hyphen)


Note: If the Sponsor's account does not have the phone number or the phone number needs to be changed, the Sponsor needs to ask the Provider to make this update in KinderConnect.

296.content:
When the Sponsor reports an issue related to the link for Self-Reset/ Self-Unlock, the Support Agents must ask the Sponsor's secret question & answer before updating the email address/SMS phone number in KinderConnect.

Notes: 

  • Support should not assist the Provider in updating this information in KinderConnect. The Support Agent must speak to the account owner
  •  Advise the Provider not to update the Sponsor's SMS Phone and or Email Address so that it does not affect the Sponsor's Self-Unlock method if they updated this information previously. 

Potential Scenarios

  • If the Sponsor reports that they did not receive the link via email or SMS, the Support Agent needs to verify the phone number or email address on file is correct.
    • If it is correct, the Support Agent should ask the Sponsor if they would like to resend the recovery link during the call. 
    • If it is incorrect, the Support Agent should confirm with the Sponsor the method they want to use for Self-Reset/Self-Unlock and make the necessary updates.
  • If the Sponsor requests to update the email address or SMS phone number.
  • If the Sponsor does not have access to the email address or SMS number.

How to Change or Remove the Email Address or SMS Phone Number

Click the Account button corresponding to the Sponsor account in question.
Verify the Sponsor's secret answer.
Email
Once the Sponsor has been verified, navigate to the Sponsor > Detail page and proceed with changing or removing the Email Address or SMS Phone Number and press Save.

Note: The Support Agent can choose one of the options below:
  • Add a new email address or SMS number in KinderConnect
  • Help the Sponsor in setting up their account with Self-Reset again
SMS

Sponsors Without Access to Email or SMS

If the Support Agent removed the email address or SMS number and the Sponsor does not have access to the email or SMS during the call:

Resolution: The Sponsor account must not have an email address or SMS number in KinderConnect. The Support Agent will advise refreshing the tablet, then help the Sponsor reset the PIN on KinderSign. After the Sponsor signs in successfully, the Support Agent should recommend to the Sponsor to set up the Self-Reset/Self-Unlock email or SMS later. 

When the Sponsor is Verified

  • Support Agents must advise refreshing the tablet before Sponsors attempt to log in if any changes have been made in KinderConnect. 
  • If the Sponsor is at the location, advise them to refresh the tablet then, assist them with the self-unlock/self-reset process. 

Last Update On: 06/21/2023

298.content:
The Message Center is a function used in KinderConnect to send and view all messages. Only those Operators with appropriate permissions can send messages to other Operators. Some might only be authorized to receive and review messages. 

If the Operator has unread messages, they will be visible on the Home page.

Open Messages

KinderConnect displays a list of all the messages you have received. All unread messages appear in bold letters. The New, Delete, and Reset buttons identify the actions that a user can do.

To open, hover over and click on the Subject of the message you want to view. Sending and receiving messages is permission-based; therefore, not all Operators have access to this feature. Once opened, the message will disappear from the Home Page.



Last Update On 09/08/2023

299.content:
Open Messages

To open, hover over and click on the message you want to view. The message will be highlighted in a light blue color.

Not all operators have access to this feature. Once opened, the message will disappear from the Home Page.

Note: Sponsors do not have access to the message center. 

KinderConnect displays a list of all the messages you have received. All unread messages appear in bold letters. The Delete and Reset buttons identify the actions that a user can do.
Once you click on the message you want to view, the message will appear to the right of the list of messages

300.page_title: Provider | Delete and Reset a Message
300.content:
It is possible to Delete messages from the list and Reset a message to its original Unread status.

Delete Messages


1. Click on the checkbox left of the header row to select or deselect all messages. You can select individual messages by clicking on the respective checkboxes corresponding to the specific message.
2. Once selected, you can Delete all messages at once or just one at a time.
3. Press Delete to remove all selected messages.
Note: Once deleted, messages cannot be retrieved.


Reset Messages


1. Click on the checkbox left of the header row to select or deselect all messages. You can select individual messages by clicking on the respective checkboxes corresponding to the specific message.
 2. Once selected, you can Reset all messages at once or just one at a time.
3. Press Reset to return all selected messages to the Unread status. The text will again be in bold, and the message will display on the Home page.

Last Update On 04/26/2023

302.content:
The Tablet Team is sending out a letter or notification to the Providers who do not have an active child's authorization. If a provider calls TX3c Support about this letter, follow the directions below:

Verify the Provider's Eligibility

  • Providers are eligible to use the system if they have at least one (1) active child authorization.
  • To verify the active authorization, Support agents must go to Provider > Families in KinderTrack.
  1. If the Provider is Eligible
    • Advise the provider to disregard the letter and click on the Contact the Tablet team button below.

2. If the Provider is NOT Eligible

    • If the provider agrees to return the tablet, click the Tablet Return Request button below and then, select Tablet Return.
    • If the provider wishes to keep the tablet or has concerns about returning the tablet, click on the Contact the Tablet Team button below.

342.page_title: Device Offline - Tablet on Kiosk Mode
342.content:
Troubleshooting Connectivity Issues - Tablet on Kiosk Mode

Tap the “(i)” button located in the lower-left corner to access the settings menu.
Tap Settings to view the available settings options.
Tap on the Wi-Fi option to select and display a list of available networks. 

Press OK to exit.
Tap on the name of the network you would like to connect to.
Enter the password if it is a secure Wi-Fi network.  Tap Connect.

Once the connection is established, the status will change to Connected.

You can check the strength of your connection by looking at the status bar at the top of the tablet.

Once you confirm the connection, tap the Home button to return to the Home screen.

344.content:
As per a recent upgrade on 10/19/2022 to Texas KinderConnect, Providers can view their 1099s Tax Forms directly from KinderConnect. A 1099 form will generate for Providers who reported a threshold of $600 or more for this tax year. 

Notes: 

  • Only Providers with the Program System Owner Operator Type can view the Tax Information page. 
  • Providers are not able to view reports on TWC-provided tablets. Reports can only be viewed on a device that has a PDF viewer installed.

Please use the following steps to guide the Provider in accessing this information.

Providers Accessing Tax Information

 The Provider will navigate to the Provider > Tax Information page.
The Program will automatically be shown next to the required Provider field. If you are a Program System Owner of more than one Program, select the Program on the drop-down menu of 1099 you wish to view. 
Once on the Tax Information Page, Providers will click the checkbox next to the document they want to download and press Download.
Once the Document generates, press Open from your browser to review. 
Note: Depending on your browser, it might be different.
Once Downloaded, a box will pop up requesting a password; this password is the Provider’s six-digit CCP Number. They will need to enter the number and press OK.

CCP ID Number is the six-digit Child Care Portal ID number used to log into CCIDS Provider Portal.

The 1099 Form will automatically display on your screen once the correct password has been entered.


Note: Support Agents should never provide the CCP number, or guide the Provider to find this information in KinderConnect for any reason. Always refer these calls to the TWC Helpdesk.

Last Updated On: 3/3/2023
