349.content:
Self-Reset/ Self-Unlock

For Support: 

Support Agents should offer to assist with setting up their account for the Self-Reset/Self-Unlock account feature. If the Sponsor is not at the location, inform them of this feature. If the Sponsor is available to do this during the call, support should assist with the steps. This will make it easier for the Sponsor to unlock their account and reset their PIN anytime.

Before support agents begin assisting the Sponsor, the Support Agent must search for the Sponsor's account. Support Agents need to identify if the Sponsor account is set up to Self-Reset/Self-Unlock feature in order to assist the Sponsor with their account issues accurately.

Confirm if the Sponsor's account is already set up for the Self-Reset/Self-Unlock feature on the Sponsor > Detail page. From the Sponsor > Detail page, check the SMS Phone number and Email address fields.

Sponsor with Self-Reset SetupSponsor without Self-Reset Setup
If there is an SMS Phone number or an Email address, the Sponsor's account is set up to Self-Reset/Self-Unlock.
If there is NO SMS Phone number or Email address, the Sponsor's account is NOT set up to Self-Reset/Self-Unlock.  
Locked Accounts: If the sponsor's account is already set up to Self-Reset, Support agents should assist the sponsor with self-unlocking their own account. 
Select the Locked Account (Sponsor Self-Unlock) button below for the next steps.		Locked Accounts: If the sponsor is not set up to Self-Reset, Support agents will unlock their account first and then, will explain the self-unlock feature. 
Select the Locked Account (Support Unlocking Account) button below for the next steps. 

Adding or Updating Sponsor Accounts

When a Sponsor needs to have information added or updated in their Sponsor accounts Support must advise their Provider has to make the changes in their Sponsor account. 

  • If the Provider is available, the Support Agent can speak to the Provider and guide the Provider to make the changes by selecting Adding/Updating Sponsor Account Info (Provider Available)
  • If the Provider is not available to make the changes during the call, the Support Agent must inform the Sponsor that the changes will have to be made by the Provider. The Provider can contact Support for assistance in making the changes if needed. Select Adding/Updating Sponsor Account Info (Provider Not Available)

351.content:
Co-Pay Updates

TWC will soon be re-instating co-payments for the families and will be notifying Providers by email of the changes. If a caller is asking how to see co-payment information Support must guide them on how to see this information in Kinderconnect. If the caller has any questions regarding how or when the co-payments will resume please, refer them to TWC. 

For more information on how to guide the caller to see co-payment information please select Payment Review.

Yearly Registration Fees

Yearly registration fees for providers in Texas were sent out starting on February 14th, 2023. If Providers call in asking about the payment, Support Agents should inform the provider they can expect to receive this payment in their accounts within 3-5 business days from the 14th. This will be a separate deposit from their weekly submittal payments. The registration fee is an annual fee of $25 to each program for every child served through the Publicly Funded Child Care program, with at least one day of actual attendance (not absent or PD days) in 2022.

Note: The program has to have been open on 1/1/2023 to receive the Yearly Registration Fees payments. If they closed prior to 1/1/23 then no registration fees would be paid out for the 2022 year. The provider can review these payments on the Provider > Payments page.

Additional Questions

Any additional questions from providers or parents regarding the information above can be referred to the Business Unit at TWC.

Last Update On: 02/24/2023
351.question: Does the information above answer the provider's question/concern?

352.content:
When a Provider has issues or concerns regarding payment, support must identify the following:

  • Which billing cycle are you inquiring about? 
  • Which child are you inquiring about?
  • Was the attendance submitted correctly for the child(ren) in question?

Once you have identified this information, proceed with reviewing the payment. 

How to Review Payments

The Search Results grid contains all payments issued to the provider depending on the specified criteria.

Payment ID is the payment number referring to the specific payment line or information. 

Status Date refers to the payment date when the payment was processed or submitted. 

  • If the payment is in Processing status, the status date refers to when the attendance was submitted. The Processing status changes to Paid Status on the following Sunday after the attendance was submitted. 
    • If the payment is still in Processing status past Sunday, this means that there is an overlapping attendance. Click on the Overlapping Utilization Report button below. 
  • If the payment is in Paid status, the status date refers to when the payment was processed. 

Status Date refers to the payment date when the payment was processed. The payment must be in Paid status.

Note: If the payment is still in Processing status, the amount displayed is not final and will change once the status is changed to Paid.

Period Start & End Date refers to the service week when the attendance was collected.

Family Name, Child Name & Case Number refer to the child information that the payment line is related to. 

Amount refers to the payment amount that the provider received for the child for the given period.

Co-pay refers to the payment that the sponsor needs to make to the provider.

Co-Pay Updates

TWC will soon be re-instating co-payments for the families and will be notifying Providers by email of the changes. If a caller is asking how to see co-payment information Support must guide them on how to see this information in Kinderconnect. If the caller has any questions regarding how or when the co-payments will resume, please refer them to TWC. 

  • For more information regarding Co-pay, providers can click on the Details link. The co-pay information is found under the Payment Summary. 
    • The Ceiling Rates are the maximum allowed rates for each type of service that is authorized for reimbursement. Reimbursement is the amount paid out by ODTWC.

  • Co-pay Information can also be found under Provider > Cases. Click View for Co-Pay History.  Any issues or questions regarding copay must be referred to TWC.


Reconciliation refers to the payment status with TWC. This is available once the payment is processed (Paid status). 

  • Canceled - Warrant has been canceled, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Payment Issued - Payment deposited within 2-4 days.
  • Rejected - Banking information error and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Stopped - Warrant has been stopped, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Unreconciled - Warrant has been issued and mailed but not yet deposited.
  • Voided - Payment error has occurred, and a new issuance will be generated.
  • Waiting - Payment deposited within 5-7 business days.

Details are the link that the provider will select if they want to know more details of a specific payment.

Send Alert is the link that the provider will select if they want to send a payment alert. 

Total Amount is the total of the payment amount received for the selected date range and other criteria when searching for payments. 

Note: Providers can update the bank information on REMOVE THIS. Refer to TWC for further assistance


Last Updated 2/22/2023

362.content:
To use KinderSign, the Provider must register their tablets. They will need to register each tablet one time only. To register the tablet, the Provider must complete steps in both KinderConnect and KinderSign. 

If KinderSystems provided the tablet, then KinderSign should already be installed on the device. If the Provider uses their own tablet, they must first download KinderSign to register their device. If that is the case, click on the Download KinderSign button below to walk the Provider through downloading the app first.

Notes:

  • Device must be online in order to complete tablet registration.
  • Only Operators with the Provider Administrator type in KinderConnect can view and download reports.
  • Providers should only register their tablets while at their daycare location lobby so the geocode that is set will not affect KinderSmart Proximity Attendance of 150ft.


In KinderConnect

1. To use KinderSign on a tablet, the Provider must first register with KinderConnect using a computer. 
Next, log in to KinderConnect using the username and password created during registration. Navigate to the Reports >Reports page.
2. Press the drop-down arrow and select KinderSign Tablet Registration Form from the menu.

3. Press View. A document that contains the Quick Response (QR) code is downloaded to your computer. The download may start automatically, or the Provider may have to press the Save button or open it to start it. An icon with the file name appears in the screen's lower left or right corner. 

Note that the exact location may be different depending on the browser.
4. Click on the icon to open the PDF document. When the .pdf opens in a new tab, maneuver between the two tabs at the top of your screen as needed

5. The PDF document contains a scannable QR code. This PDF can be used from the computer screen or can be printed and used in paper form. 

In KinderSign

6. Verify the tablet is connected to wireless internet (Wi-Fi), and then open KinderSign by tapping on it. The app icon may be in a different location on the caller's tablet.

7. If it's the first time, KinderSign may display a message requesting permission to allow KinderSign access to take pictures and record videos. Tap While Using the App.

8. Select Precise location
9. Tap Scan on the tablet screen, which switches the tablet to scan mode. You either have to:

  • Scan the KinderSign Tablet Registration Form QR code on the computer screen.
OR
  • Scan the KinderSign Tablet Registration Form QR code from a printed copy.
10. To scan, move the QR code into the view of the tablet camera so that the QR code is visible on the tablet screen. As soon as the whole QR code is visible to the tablet camera and in focus, the tablet scans the QR code automatically.

Note: To adjust the focus so that the QR code is seen clearly, slowly move the tablet closer or farther from the screen/paper that the code is on. At some point, the camera will auto-focus on the code, and any blurriness should disappear.
11. Once the scan is successful, the tablet will be registered to the Provider and displays the following message: "Device Registered. Your device has been registered and is ready to use."
12. Another message will appear requesting permission for KinderSign to access the device's location. Click on Allow

In KinderConnect

13. Now that tablet is registered, return to KinderConnect on the computer and click on Reports under Reports to finalize registration and track attendance. Press the drop-down arrow and select Provider Mobile Sign In Sheet to complete the setup

14. Repeat steps 3 to 9, scanning the  Provider Mobile Sign In Sheet code. Upon successful completion, the telephone keypad displays, and KinderSign is ready for Caretakers/ Sponsors to use for checking their children in and out of care.

Last Updated On: 12/11/2023

364.content:
Kindersystems has developed KinderBridge®, an Application Programmable Interface (API) that facilitates the transfer of attendance data to KinderConnect by CCMS vendors.

CCMS (Child Care Management System) is a third-party software solution providers use to manage their day-to-day operations. Some companies that provide this service include Procare, Lillio, and BrightWheel.

KinderBridge allows Providers using the CCMS for daily operations to report their subsidy attendance to the State. KinderBridge is landing the attendance records captured from the CCMS into KinderConnect, where the providers can do their normal submission process.

KinderBridge Attendance Policies

  • The system will sweep attendance after one week from the last day of the billing period.
  • Attendance collected in the CCMS (third-party software) must be uploaded into KinderConnect at least once a week to void attendance being swept while incomplete. 
  • Providers should NOT be entering attendance in KinderConnect or in their 3rd party software. Only Sponsors should be entering attendance. For further questions regarding policies, please refer to the State Helpdesk at tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov

Notes: 

  • Support is unable to assist with setting up KinderBridge via chat or email. 
  • To enable KinderBrige, the Provider must call in to request the activation. 
  • Support must speak to a Provider Administrator to enable KinderBridge in KinderConnect.
  • KinderBridge must be disabled if the Provider switches from KinderBridge to Tablet to track attendance. 
  • Providers should NOT use KinderSign or KinderSmart if API is enabled. Select Disable KinderBridge (API) for detailed steps.
  • Providers MUST upload attendance into KinderConnect, attendance does NOT get automatically uploaded from the Providers CCMS to KinderConnect.

Last Updated: 05/16/2024

  • If the Provider has one license number with multiple regions, please ensure the API is enabled on all regions.

From KinderConnect, search for the provider's account using the available criteria on the Provider > Search page.

This section displays the information of the Provider.

Check the Enable Provider API.
Next, ask the caller what attendance collection software they will be using.

After getting this information, select the software name by clicking on Attendance API Source and choosing the software from the dropdown menu.

Note: If the API vendor has not yet been added to the drop-down list, the Support Agent must select "Vendor Interface."

Next, press Save at the top of the page.

371.content:
How to Set up a New Group Password and Provider ID for One New Location:


From the Operator Menu choose Search
Search for the Operator name with Adminstrator Role.
Click on the Operator Name

Navigate to Provider > Groups
You will notice the Group Password is Numeric.

The Group Password will reset to eight characters for all locations with the same password. The group password generated is case-sensitive.

Click Save

Give the Provider the Group Password and Provider ID.

375.content:
Attendance Issues

No attendance is passing to KinderConnect to submit:

  1. Ensure that the Provider is uploading the attendance into KinderConnect.
  2. Validate the CCMS they are using. (Document this in the case.)
  3. Ensure the API box is checked in the Provider > Detail page.
  4. Ensure the proper software is listed in "Attendance API Source" on the Provider > Detail page.
  5. Ensure the Provider ID and Group Password are entered correctly. (Document this in the case.)
  6. Ensure the Agency ID is set correctly (it should be 1 in TX).
  7. Validate the children have active authorization (Subsidized). (Document this in the case.) 
  8. Assure the provider knows how to find the active authorization of Subsidized children. (Document this in the case.)
  9. Review if the active utilization (Subsidized) Children IDs are updated in the Providers CCMS. (Document this in the case.)
  10. Some providers must have all children's IDs updated correctly for active utilization (Subsidized) before the information will upload to KinderConnect (Providers who use Sage, for example)

To find Child IDs, Support Agents must guide the Provider to go to Child > Search to find the child ID number. Do not use the CIN. 

Some attendance passing to KinderConnect to submit:

  1. Validate the CCMS they are using. (Document this in the case.)
  2. Validate the children that have active utilization (Subsidized). (Document this in the case.)
  3. If the Provider has multiple regions, please ensure the API is enabled on all of them.
  4. Ensure the provider knows how to find the active authorization of Subsidized children. (Document this in the case.)
  5. Review if the active utilization (Subsidized) children IDs are updated in the Providers CCMS. (Document this in the case.)
  6. If those children whose attendance is not transferring have valid authorizations, check that their DOB, Child Names, and child IDs match in both KC and in their CCMS.
  7. Some providers must have all children's IDs updated correctly for active utilization (Subsidized) before the information will upload to KinderConnect (Providers who use Sage, for example)

To find Child IDs, Support Agents must guide the Provider to go to Child > Search to find the child ID number. Do not use the CIN.

Note: If unable to resolve after going through the lists above, follow the steps below:

  • All KinderBridge (API) issues must be escalated through BO, and Support agents will follow the BO escalations process. 
    • Luis Barroso will handle all KinderBridge (API) escalations within 48 hours. If your case remains open after 48 hours without updates, please follow up with Luis.

If the Provider Has Procare

After completing the troubleshooting steps above, Support Agents must confirm that the Provider has selected the checkbox with the name of their location before uploading attendance. The system will not warn or indicate they have missed this step and will not upload attendance. Below is an example of what the Providers should see.



Multi-Board Providers (Providers Serving Multiple Boards)

At this time, there is an issue with setting up new providers with multiple locations. This is a known issue, the vendor is making code changes, at this time we do not have an ETA. Please keep the case open; the subject must be KinderBridge- Multiple locations.

  • For Procare Users: Procare Support are instructed to use a workaround in their system to edit their accounts and allow them to have multiple IDs under the same location. Support should refer customers to Procare Support team at 800-964-1729 or support@procaresoftware.com.
  • For Other Vendors: Please do not refer the providers to contact their API Vendor regarding this issues as they are aware and actively working on this issue.

JIRA - Authorized Children not found in KC

If a subsidized child is not appearing in the system and the Provider states the child should have authorization or have paperwork that the child has an active authorization, select the JIRA Authorized Children not Appearing in KC button below for the next steps.

Assistance with third-party Party Software (CCMS)

If the Provider has questions related to the process in their third-party software, please refer to contact their CCMS vendor.

376.content:
Q: What are the best practices in recording attendance using CCMS?

A: Providers using their CCMS should review attendance and make corrections in their CCMS before exporting to  KinderConnect. Only days without previous attendance entered (empty cells) can have attendance re-exported to KinderConnect.


Q: When should attendance get uploaded into KinderConnect?

A: Attendance collected in the third-party software must be uploaded into KinderConnect before the end of the billing cycle (Two weeks). The system will sweep attendance after one week from the last day of the billing period.


Q: What if a provider has trouble configuring their third-party software or uploading attendance?

A: The provider must contact their software manufacturer. The information gathered for Provider Groups must be entered into their third-party software. If the provider does not know how or encounters problems, they should contact their software manufacturer.


Q: What is my Agency ID?

A: Please note that for every provider, the answer is: The Agency ID is 1.


Q: Can Providers using KinderBridge (API) enter or edit attendance in KinderConnect?

A: Per state policy, KinderBridge providers should NOT be entering attendance in KinderConnect or their 3rd party software. Only Sponsors should be entering attendance. For further questions regarding policies, please refer to the State Helpdesk at tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov


Q: What if a provider doesn’t have one of the software packages currently supporting KinderConnect?

A: Please refer to the Policies page for policy questions and the CCMS Implemented and Active list. Support agent must say the following: If you want your software vendor to interface with our system (KinderConnect), please ask them to contact us for you. We need to make sure their system can integrate with our system. The API Vendor must contact KinderSystems to get certified at partners@kindersystems.com. 


Q: I am using Procare but cannot integrate with KinderConnect?

A: Currently, we are only integrated with the Desktop app version of Procare. If the Provider has the web app version, the integration will not be successful.


Q: If I am using CCMS can I enter attendance on behalf of a sponsor?

A: The state does not allow providers to enter attendance on behalf of a subsidy child in any system. If a provider is not in compliance with this policy, they may be put on a Service Improvement Agreement (SIA) or Corrective Action Plan (CAP) and could even lose their agreement and ability to care for subsidy children. Please send any questions about this issue to tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov.

For Frequently Asked Questions Support Agent can direct the Providers to info site Frequently Asked Questions – TX3C Information Site

Last Update on 05/15/2024
376.question: Does this answer the Provider's question?

377.page_title: Provider | Child not Showing in Attendance Detail Screen
377.content:
If the provider reported that a Subsidized child is not showing up on the attendance detail page, the authorization for the child might be expired. 

Support can use the steps below to guide the provider to confirm the child authorization:

In KinderConnect, click on Child and then select Search to perform a child search.
Ask the provider to press Clear to remove all the search criteria and make sure the Schedule Date field is mm/dd/yyyy.

Enter the search criteria and then press Search.

As an Agent, make sure the correct Provider is searched.
Click on the child's name in the search result to access the Child Detail page.

Note: A subsidized child will have CIN and the Type will be Subsidized. Please confirm you are accessing the correct case.
On the Child Detail page, review the Subsidized Schedules.
In this example, the child has authorization from 1/1/2023 to 3/31/2023.
The child's authorization ended on 3/31/2023, which was the middle of the service week. The rest of the service week will be blank boxes on the Attendance Detail page, and the sponsors associated with this record will not be able to sign the child in/out.

Starting from the next service week (4/3/2023), the child will not appear on the Attendance Detail page.

Last Update On 04/30/2023
377.question: Have you confirmed that the child's authorization has expired?

1.button_text: No - Go back to Child Related topics

Operators with the Provider Administrator operator type can log in to their account in KinderConnect to unlock other operators at the program.

Support can use the steps below to guide the Provider Administrator to unlock an account:


In KinderConnect, click on Operator and select Search to perform an operator search.
Enter search criteria and press the Search button to find the operator.

or

The provider can leave all the fields blank and press the Search button to perform an open search to show all operators created in the program.
Click on Account on the operator record in the Search Results to access the Operator Account.

Uncheck the 'Locked' field and press the Save button to complete unlocking an operator account.

386.content:
The provider can review attendance on the Attendance > Detail page of KinderConnect. 

Note: Provider should NOT add or edit attendance in KinderConnect. The Sponsor must add all attendance entries.

Reviewing attendance in KinderConnect

Support Agents can guide the Providers by following the steps below:

Select the Attendance activity from the Navigation Bar.

Select the Detail option to open the Detail page.



The Attendance > Detail page of KinderConnect allows the user to review the details of the records of Attendance or hours of care for children at the selected Provider.

  1. Providers with multiple license numbers can access other locations by selecting them here.
  2. Navigate to a previous week.
  3. Enter the date you would like to view the Attendance.
  4. Navigate to the following week.
  5. Choose how many children to display.
  6. There is an option to sort the children's names from A-Z or Z-A.
  7. There is an option to search by name. 

The provider will be able to view the children's information, including First & Last Names, Case Number, and Child CIN.


Last Update On: 10/13/2023

387.page_title: Provider | Checking Provider Information in KT
387.content:
Follow the steps below to search for the Provider account:

Sign in to KinderTrack using Rippling. Click on KT4TX Prod
The system will take you to KinderTrack Home Page.
Make sure you are in the correct District/Region. You can check this at the bottom of the page. Click on the arrow to change District/Region.
Navigate to Provider > Search page.
Make sure all fields are empty by clicking on Clear. 
Search the provider by using the License Number
Click on the provider name that appears in the search result. 
The System will take you to the Provider > Provider page.
On the navigation activity, go to Provider > Contacts. 
Confirm the registration information on the Contacts page. The registration information is based on the information given in the survey. This includes:
  • First name
  • Last Name
  • Verification Code (Provider Contact ID)

Support must speak to the operator shown in the system. If the caller's name does not match the name in the system we cannot assist them.

If the provider is not able to locate the registration email, the support agent can re-send it by clicking on "Send Registration Email"
Note: The Support Agents MUST NOT update any information on the Contact Page.

Notes:

  • If the registration information is entered in KinderTrack incorrectly and or the Provider wants to update it, Support Agents will advise the Provider to contact their state State Helpdesk select Refer to State Helpdesk
    • If there are any misspellings in the contact details, please contact any available team lead to update and document the changes in the case.
  • If the Contact details are blank in KT and Provider has received the registration email, the support agent will have to use Teams to message Amber, Nora, or Raul who can help correct the provider information during the call.
    • If no one is available to assist during the call select Schedule a Callback. Once information is updated by the registration team Support agent will call the Provider back and continue with the registration steps.

Last Update on: 03/14/2024

389.content:
The State of Texas asked all providers (except the In-Home/IVR Providers) to complete a survey. The State reviews the provider’s information and sends it to the registration team within the Support department. The registration team then ships tablets to eligible providers according to the list provided by TWC. 

Assisting a New Provider

Confirm with the Provider if they already received the registration email. Follow the next steps depending on the scenarios below:

  • If they have received their registration email, select Registration Steps
  • If they have not received their registration email, select Check Registration Email in KT
  • If the Provider is inquiring about tablet status, Support Agent must verify they have received a registration email first before selecting Check Tablet Status

Assisting a Relative In-Home Provider

Relative In-home providers will use IVR to track attendance. They will NOT receive a TWC survey and will NOT receive a tablet. Support agents must verify if the provider is on the Relative In-home Provider IVR list.

  • If the provider is found on the list, proceed to Registration Steps.

  • If the Provider is NOT found on the list, or for more information, select New Relative In-Home Provider.

Last Update On: 03/21/2024

390.page_title: Provider | Non-API Provider Completed the Survey
390.content:
If the Provider confirms that they completed the TWC survey and are not using KinderBridge/CCMS(API), the Registration team will ship a tablet and then send a registration Email with the Provider registration information and the verification code.  

Confirm with the Provider if they received a tablet:

  • If the Provider received a tablet and the registration email, proceed to Registration Steps.
  • If the Provider received a tablet but did NOT receive the registration email, the Support agent will need to confirm if the registration email has been sent. Select the Check Registration Email Status button below.

Last Update On: 05/15/2024

391.page_title: Provider | API Provider Completed the Survey
391.content:
If the Provider confirms that they completed the TWC survey and are using "Certified" API/CMS., the Registration team will NOT ship a tablet but will send a registration email with the Provider registration information and the verification code.

Note: Some Providers who are using API/CMS tools may receive a tablet from KinderSystems. If so, they should keep the tablets until their API vendor is certified by KinderConnect to meet state requirements. Once their API is certified with KinderConnect, they can request the return of the tablet from the state.

To view the full list of certified APIs select API Partners List.

Confirm with the API Provider if they received the registration email:

  • If the Provider received the registration email, proceed to Registration Steps.
  • If the Provider received the registration email, is already registered, and will use API, select Provider is Registered, Proceed to API Setup
  • If the Provider did NOT receive the registration email, please advise them this is a controlled release email, and if they don't receive the registration email within two weeks they will need to contact us again. To confirm the status of the email, select Check Registration Email Status
  • If the is already registered to KidnerConnect and they're using a certified API/CMS, proceed to Set up API/CMS.

Last Update On: 09/21/2023

392.page_title: Provider | Check If Provider Completed the State Helpdesk Survey
392.content:
Step 1. Support Agents must ask the Provider if they are a Relative In-Home Provider. 

  • If they are a Relative In-Home Provider, proceed to New Relative In-home Provider 
  • If they are not a Relative In-Home Provider, proceed to Step 2.

Step 2. To receive a tablet and/or begin using KinderConnect, all Providers must fill out a survey sent from the TWC (TWC@public.govdelivery.com). 

The Support agents must check the Provider Survey List to view the list of providers who have completed the survey:

Click on Provider Survey List  and read the guidelines below: 

  • Support Agent should NOT give out the name found on the list.
  • If the Provider is found on the list and does NOT have information in KT, the Support agent must select Provider on List. Submit Provider Information Form.
  • If the Provider is found on the list and has information in KT, the Support agent must verify the information is correct and then click on the Send Registration Email button.
  • If the survey is listed under someone else's name, Support must inform the caller the person who filled out the survey must call in. Support cannot give out the name. 
  • If the Provider listed no longer works at the location, Support must inform the Provider they must email  tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov to request a new survey be sent to them.
  • If the Provider is not on the list, the provider may not have completed the survey. They must email  tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov to request a new survey be sent to them.
    • If the Provider states they have recently completed the survey but their name is not yet on the Provider Survey List. Then the Support Agent must ask the Provider to call back the following week to confirm their survey entry has been received. The list is updated weekly.
  • If the Provider does not have an Active Agreement, they must email  tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov for more information.

Notes: Support Agents should NOT change any live data in KT.

If the Provider has the incorrect contact information in KT:

  • Please tell the provider to check with other staff within the same Child Care center who may be in charge of any updates to Child Care Regulation (CCR) because they may have already responded since the survey goes to a unique email.
  • If no one in the provider location received the email, the Provider will need to contact their CCR representative to ensure they have the accurate email address on record. If they do not know their CCR representative, they can send their inquiries to tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov. 
  • If Provider contact information needs to be updated, contact tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov. 

Note: If the provider/caller has already received the tablet, then they have completed the survey from TWC or someone in their facility has already completed the survey.

Last Update On: 04/16/2024

393.content:
Providers can receive a tablet if they have at least 1 subsidized child attending their location. 

Providers NOT eligible for tablets if they are:

  • API/CMS Providers - If the Provider uses a certified API/CMS, Support should advise that they will not receive a tablet. Select API User for the next steps.
  • Relative In-Home Providers -  If the Provider is a Relative In-Home provider, Support should advise that they will not receive a tablet. They have the option to use their personal tablet for KinderSign, KinderSmart, or IVR. Select Relative In-Home Provider. Additional Questions for the next steps.

How to Check the Tablet Delivery Status for an Eligible Provider

If the Provider is eligible to receive a tablet and would like to check the tablet delivery status, Support should search for this information using the methods below:

From NetSuite, search for the Customer using the Global Search.

Method 1

From the Customer record page, select the Sales tab, under Items Purchased in the drop-down menu, select KS Item Orders.

Under the KS Item Orders, it will list the Tracking Number & serial number in this section.

Copy the tracking number and open up a web browser to check the delivery status online.


Method 2

Scroll down to the subtabs and select Communication. Under Communication, select User Notes.

If the tablet was shipped, the tablet shipping information will be posted in this section, as shown below.

The memo contains the tracking number for the tablet. The support agent must give the provider this information.

If the Communication > User Notes section does not have any tablet shipping information, Support Agents must check the Support Notes to verify if a Support Agent has already submitted a Provider Information Form. The Agent must submit a Back Office ticket if the first note was one week or older.

Method 3

Scroll down to the subtabs and select Sales. Under Sales, choose Deployed Serialized Item Lists.


If the tablet was shipped, the tablet shipping information will be posted in this section, as shown below.

Note: Some Providers may already receive a tablet but have not received the email yet. Please advise them this is a controlled release email, and if they don't receive the registration email within two (2) weeks they will need to contact us again. 

Provider is Eligible but Tablet is Not Shipped

If the Support Agent confirms that the tablet has not been shipped for an eligible Provider after following the steps above, follow the guidelines below:

  1. If an eligible Provider has not received the registration email, select Check Email Registration button below
  2. If an eligible Provider received the registration email and/or the Provider was already registered but did not get the tablet, Support must check the Texas Provider Survey File: 
    • In the Texas Provider Survey File, the Support Agent will confirm if the Provider is an API user or not by looking at column Q containing the question: Do you use your Childcare Management System to collect attendance? (¿Utiliza su sistema de gestión de cuidado infantil para recopilar la asistencia?)
      • If the survey says the Provider is not using  API for attendance (answer is No in column Q), select Submit New Tablet Request Form. 
      • If the survey says the Provider is using  API (answer is Yes in column Q) but needs to change their answer, Support Agents will need to disable API for the provider, select Disable API. Tablet Request
    • In the Texas Provider Survey File, the Support Agent will confirm if the Provider has subsidized children by looking at column O containing the question: Please share approximately how many scholarship/subsidized children are in your care today. (Porfavor comparte aproximadamente cuantos ninos subsidados o becados estan en su cuidado hoy?
      • If the survey says the Provider has children (answer is 1+ in column O), select Submit a New Tablet Request Form.
      • If the survey says the Provider does not have children (answer is 0 in column O) but the Provider is calling back to report that they now have subsidized children, Support Agents will need to confirm the subsidized child authorization in the Provider > Cases page. If they have an active authorization, Support Agents will select Submit a New Tablet Request Form.

Currently, there is a high demand for tablets, and requests are being handled in the order they are received. The tablet team will send them out as soon as they become available. Support Agents can advise using a personal tablet or KinderSmart until the state-provided tablet is received.

Last Update On: 12/08/2023

4.button_text: Submit a New Tablet Request Form

394.content:
Sponsor Accounts

In order to assist the Sponsor with their account issues accurately, Support agents must do the following before assisting:

  1. Search for the Sponsor's account.
  2. Confirm if the Sponsor's account is already set up for the Self-Reset/Self-Unlock feature on the Sponsor > Detail page. 
  3. Check the SMS Phone number and Email address fields.
Sponsor with Self-Reset SetupSponsor without Self-Reset Setup
If there is an SMS Phone number or an Email address, the Sponsor's account is set up to Self-Reset/Self-Unlock.
If there is NO SMS Phone number or Email address, the Sponsor's account is NOT set up to Self-Reset/Self-Unlock. 

Sponsors with or without Self-reset Setup will go through the self-reset/self-unlock process when their account is locked. Support agents must assist the Sponsor with self-unlocking their account first if the Sponsor is at the location.

  • If the Sponsor is at the location and their account is set up to the Self-reset feature, select Locked Account (Self-Reset Set Up) button.
  • If the Sponsor is at the location and their account is NOT set up to the Self-reset feature, select Locked Account (Self-Reset Not Set Up) button.
  • If the Sponsor is not at the location or the Sponsor has issues with their self-unlock email or SMS phone number, Support agents can assist with unlocking their account. Select the Locked Account (Support Unlocking Account) button below.
  • If the Sponsor wants to set up their account to the Self-reset feature, select the Sponsor Self-Reset/Self-Unlock Setup button.
  • If the Sponsor is calling regarding issues with the Self-Reset feature, select the Sponsor Self-Reset/Self-Unlock Issues button.
  • For PIN-related issues, select the Sponsor Resetting PIN/Password button.
  • For secret answer-related issues, select the Sponsor Forgot Secret Answer button.
  • If the Sponsor accounts require an update, select Updating Sponsor Account Info (Provider Available) or Updating Sponsor Account Info (Provider not Available).

Last Update On: 05/17/2023
394.question: Select the topic that best describes the Sponsor's Account issue:

395.content:
KinderSign offers a Self-Reset or Self-Unlock feature that allows Sponsors to verify or unlock their account with their email or SMS number.

Support Agents must offer assistance with setting up their account for the Self-Reset/Self-Unlock account feature before the call ends. This will make it easier for the Sponsor to unlock their account and reset their PIN anytime.

  • If the Sponsor is available to do this during the call, support should assist with the steps. 
  • If the Sponsor is not at the location, inform them of this feature.

Last Update On: 5/22/2023

396.content:
The providers can’t see payment now until Phase 2 and the state uses KinderTrack!

In the meantime, the providers will get paid according to the children's authorization in advance. They will continue getting paid the same way they are getting paid now. 

They are NOT penalized if a parent isn’t entering attendance. Excessive absence consequences are applied to the child when they hit 40 absences but that consequence has been waived until further notice. Providers are always paid as long as there is an active referral/authorization in the system. They should be checking their KinderConnect portal regularly to make sure referrals/authorizations are still in place and parents are entering attendance.

399.page_title: Provider | Set up new KinderBridge (API) Connection
399.content:
Notes:

  •  You cannot register a tablet when the Enable API Provider box is checked on the Provider > Detail page. The Provider who will use a CCMS system will not be able to use KinderSign or KinderSmart to sign in/out children. 
  • Support Agents cannot set up an CCMS in response to a Chat or an Email.
  • In order to enable API, the Provider must call Tx3C Support Center 888-265-6461 (M-F, 6 am CT to 9 pm CT)
  • Support must speak to the operator with the Provider Administrator operator type to Setup KinderBridge.


The Support Agent will have to do the following:

  1. Check the KinderBrige Partners List
  2. Enable API and API Source
    • If the Provider has multiple regions CCMS must be enabled on all regions.
  3. Create a new group password
  4. Inform the Provider that the setup from KinderBridge has been completed. Give the Provider the information below:
    • Group Password
    • Group ID/Provider ID
  5. Depending on the CCMS vendor, the provider may need to contact their CCMS vendor to complete the integration or utilize any resources we have available for them.
  6. Support agents should not give the credentials to the CCMS vendor unless the Provider Administrator is also on the call. If they have been authorized by the provider, they must send proof of authorization to partners@kindersystems.com.

Once the API is enabled, the effective date does not prevent previous attendance from being transferred unless attendance already exists.

Last update On: 05/16/2024

400.question: Select the best option below:

401.content:
Absence Policies

Absent Days are days the child is authorized and scheduled to be in Provider care but was absent. 

  • Providers can get paid for absent days. 
  • Absent days are paid based on child authorization
  • Absent days are added by Sponsor using KinderSign and KinderSmart.

Providers are NOT penalized if a parent isn’t entering attendance. Excessive absence consequences are applied to the child when they hit 40 absences per year, but the consequences have been waived until October 1, 2023. Providers are always paid as long as there is an active referral/authorization in the system. They should be checking their KinderConnect portal regularly to make sure referrals/authorizations are still in place and parents are entering attendance.

If the Provider has questions regarding absences or other policies about this, Support Agents must refer them to contact their county/State Helpdesk.


How to Record an Absence in KinderSmart


Open the KinderSmart app on the phone. Note that the phone must be already registered with the Provider.


Once the Activities screen displays, tap Attendance.
IF requested, tap Scan to enable the QR Code reader.


Note: If the GPS of the phone reads that the device is within 150 feet of the location, it will skip scanning the Mobile Sign-in Sheet. 

Move the QR code into the view of the phone camera so that it can be clearly seen on the phone screen. As soon as the whole QR code is visible to the phone camera, the phone scans the code automatically.
Select the Absent box and add a Note to explain the reason.

The Sponsor should Sign and click Submit Attendance at the bottom of the screen.
A message will appear confirming the Attendance was saved.


The system again displays the Sponsors Activities screen.



Note: Attendance is automatically transmitted to KinderConnect, and the system confirms the transaction.

Last Updated 06/30/2023
401.question: Select the best option below:

403.page_title: Switch the Tablet to Kiosk Mode
403.content:
What is Kiosk Mode?

Kiosk mode is a new tablet configuration for Missouri that limits the functions that the providers will have access to. This will make it easier for the providers to navigate and support their daily tasks. The provider will now only have access to KinderConnect, KinderSign, the Texas info site, and Knox Remote Support which is a new feature that lets IT assist the Provider directly with troubleshooting problems (this new update replaces the use of RescueMe).

What Support Agent Needs to Know

  • The provider must have their wi-fi password at the ready as they will need to be able to reconnect the tablet for the update to process. 
  • Support agents will use the steps below to assist the Provider in setting up their tablet to Kiosk Mode.
  • Tablets should be at an 85% battery or plugged in during the process of setting the tablet up for Kiosk Mode.

How to Switch the Tablet to Kiosk Mode


After the tablet is reset the Start page will appear, press the arrow.

Agree to all of the terms and conditions, press Next.
Press Skip this for now, then Next.

Note: If the provider is prompted to type in the account information for Samsung during the tablet update, please escalate the call to the Back Office.

The tablet will begin to search for Knox updates. Once it continues, this screen will appear.

Tap Accept & continue.

The profile will begin to download.
 The Provider will be asked to select the tablet management method. Select Fully managed device.

Note: Please ensure that Providers are selecting the correct option (Fully managed device). A factory reset will be performed again if the wrong option is selected. 
A popup will appear asking for Google Location Services to be turned on, tap OK. 

Please make sure that providers will tap OK.
Knox Manage will begin to install. This may take a few minutes.

After a few minutes, the Kiosk will load.
Once installation is complete, the Samsung Knox Manage screen will be displayed. Tap the left arrow (<) in the bottom left-hand corner. 
The screen will say Finish Setup. Tap Finish to continue. 
The tablet is now configured and ready to register according to normal procedures.

Note: If the Provider reports that some apps are missing,  support should inform the provider to wait for the application to download.

 To ensure that Provider is done with the setup, advise to tap on the KinderSign app.

A prompt will appear asking if they would like to "Allow KinderSign to take pictures and record video?" 

Tap While Using the App.

Last Update On 07/17/2023

1.button_text: Kiosk Mode setup was successful. Provider will register the tablet to KinderSign later

404.content:
If a CCMS Provider is requesting to disable KinderBridge (API) or wants to receive a state-provided tablet, the Support agents must ensure that the Provider Administrator is informed of the following:

  1. Once API is disabled, the Provider can no longer use their third-party software to transfer attendance into KinderConnect. But if they would like to enable API again, they can. They would have to call Support to assist.
  2. Providers must be informed of the attendance policy:
    • Parents have a 6-day Backdating Policy:
      • The Parents can only backdate up to Six days in the past. 
      • This does NOT include attendance codes such as Absent and Holiday
  3. Go to tx3c.info to learn more about the KinderSystems apps.

If the Provider confirms that they understood the information above, proceed with the next steps:

How to Disable KinderBridge (API)

Support Agents must speak to the Provider Administrator and verify their secret question and answer before the Support Agent can disable the API. Support Agents will adhere to the steps below:

Go to Operator > Search and search for the Operator account of the caller. 

Support Agents can only proceed with the next steps if talking to a Provider Administrator. 

Click on Account on the operator record in the Search Results to access Operator Account.
Support needs to ask the operator's Secret Question and the operator needs to answer it correctly to complete the verification.
After verification is successful, go to Provider > Detail page. 
Uncheck the Enable Provider API box and press Save.


If the Provider wishes to request a tablet, Support Agents must confirm the following:

  • The Provider has an entry in the survey file. Check for the entry in the Provider Survey List.
  • The Provider has at least 1 active subsidized child authorization, confirm by checking KinderConnect under the Provider > Cases page.

Once confirmed Provider is eligible, select Informed of Policy. Disabled KinderBridge (API). Submit a Tablet Request Form

Last Update On: 05/16/2024
404.question: Select the best action from the options below:

1.button_text: Informed of Policy. Disabled KinderBridge (API). Submit a Tablet Request Form.

2.button_text: Informed of Policy. Provider Administrator Not Available/Provider will call back later.

405.content:
Notes: 

  • The Support Agent must offer to stay on the phone until the Provider completes registration if the email is resent. 
  • The Support Agent must NOT give out any information in the system. The Support Agent must ask the Provider about the registration information.

Issue 1: If there is a Date and Time displayed and the Provider is not able to locate the Registration Email, the Support Agent must verify the email address on file is correct. 

If the email is correct the Support Agent can re-send the email by clicking on "Send Registration Email"

If the email is incorrect Refer to State Helpdesk.

Notes: 

  • The information in KT is imported directly from the survey the Provider submitted.
  • The Support Agents MUST not change any information on the Contact page.

Issue 2: If the registration information entered in KinderTrack does not belong to the caller, ask the caller if any other staff members can be listed as the contact. If they know who the contact is, advise them to have that person call us back.

If the registration information is entered in KinderTrack incorrectly and or the Provider wants to update it, Support Agents will advise the Provider to contact the State Helpdesk.

Issue 3: If the name contains an extra space, the Support Agent can remove the extra space in the name in KT. The Support Agent must speak to the owner of the account.  

Note: If the registration information is entered in KinderTrack incorrectly and or the Provider wants to update it, Support Agents will advise the Provider to contact the State Helpdesk.
Issue 4: If the Contact details are blank in KT and Provider has received the registration email, the support agent will have to fill out Provider Information Form.

417.content:
Providers must log in to the TX3C Availability Portal website to edit their Profiles for families to view. 

Note: The Provider must be licensed with TWC first to be able to log in.  

Support agents must guide the Provider through the steps listed below:

Open the browser and enter find.childcare.texas.gov/providers. 
Enter the email address associated with the Provider's license, then press Submit.
Check the email for a code that was sent by the system.

To log in, the Provider can either enter the code below to access their account. 

Or, click the link in the email to log in automatically. 


Login Issues

If the Provider sees an error "Email not found" while logging in, this means that the email entered is not registered in the State licensing system. Support must log in to the Availability Portal - Admin Portal to verify the correct email address. Select No - Verify Provider's Email Address option for the next steps.

To upload a short bio and a photo for each team member, the Provider will click the blue Add button.
The Provider can share the name and short bio for the staff member. 

Drag and drop or browse to add photos.

418.question: Select the best option below:

420.content:
The Reports page allows the Admin Users to search, run, and download reports in the Availability Portal. In addition to standard reports, admin users have the ability to create customized reports that include the specific fields they require.

How to Run and Download a Report

Once the Admin is signed in, select Reports from the navigation menu on the left-hand side.
To view Reports, the Admin user can either click on the category related to the report you want to view.
Or, search for the report you would like to access in the search bar at the top. 
The search results will appear at the bottom of the screen. 

Click on the report name from the list.
The system will display the selected report.
To download the report into PDF, click on the Download button.


How to Create a Customized Report

Once the Admin is signed in, select Reports from the navigation menu on the left-hand side.
Select the group/category related to the report you want to customize.
Or, press + New if you want to can create a new report with customized report fields. 
Enter the report name. Select the Report Type and Schema from the drop-down list. Press Create to continue.
To select the fields you want to include in your report, check the top left-hand corner of the screen. 

The preview of the report will be displayed below. All fields that you select will show as columns.
Select left and right arrows (< or >) to arrange the order of the columns. 
Click on the 3 dots to view more settings of the selected column.
To view more settings of your customized report, click on the 3 dots next to the report name. 

Note: All changes made will be automatically saved.


Last Update Date: 11/22/2023
420.question: Select the best option below:

421.content:
The Analytics page displays a dashboard or visual statistics of a selected report. 

How to Add a Dashboard

Once signed in as an Admin user, click on Analytics. 
Click on the three dots next to the dashboard type (Searches or Vacancy Dashboard). Select + Create new dashboard.
Enter the desired name of the dashboard and press Save.
Press the + Add metric button.
Fill out the fields as needed, and press Save.
The new dashboard will now appear on the Analytics page. 


How to Edit a Dashboard

From the Analytics page, click on the three dots next to the dashboard type (Searches or Vacancy Dashboard). Select Edit Dashboard.
Click on the three dots inside the Dashboard that you want to edit. 

Select Edit, Duplicate, or Remove.  
Edit will allow you to edit the dashboard metrics. Press Save to save the changes made. 
Duplicate will allow you to duplicate the selected dashboard. 
Remove will allow you to remove the selected dashboard. 

Last Update On: 11/20/2023

426.content:
Admin users can view and edit staff account details, such as name and email address. Follow the instructions below:

How to View Provider Staff Account

Once signed in as Admin User, select Providers and select Staff from the drop-down arrow.
A  list of all staff will be displayed. Click the name of the staff member desired.
The staff member's selected record will be displayed.

  • The Profile section shows the name and email address of the staff.  This information will also indicate the program to which the staff member belongs.

  • The Access section shows the role or permission of the Staff member. There are two available roles for Staff member's account: Admin and Member roles. At this time, Provider's staff accounts have been set up on the "Member" level.


How to Edit Provider Staff Account

Once signed in as Admin User, select Providers and select Staff from the drop-down arrow.
Search for the name of the staff using the search bar.
Click on the name in the search results. 
Make the necessary changes. 
Press Save.

Click on Search by Location field
Enter the city of the daycare location.

You can narrow down the search for childcare by searching for care near Home, Work , Zip Code, or Along my Commute options.

The steps above are also the same steps that families follow in searching for providers.

431.question: Select the best option below:

434.content:
When you select one of the options, you will get asked if you want to create a group or an individual message.
To create a new message from the Message Center, press + New Message.

Group Message

Press +New Message from the options at the top of the page from the Message Center.

Note: Sending and receiving messages is permission-based; therefore, not all Operators can create and send messages.


Select Group Message.

Click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to select the recipients of the message.

  1. Group: Select the Operator and Sponsor types to receive the message. 
  2. Priority: Select the urgency of your message. 
  3. Subject: Enter the Subject of the message.  
  4. Message: Enter the text of the message. 

When you finish selecting your options, press Send. 


Individual Message


Press +New Message from the options at the top of the page from the Message Center.

Note: Sending and receiving messages is permission-based; therefore, not all Operators can create and send messages.

Select Individual Message.

Click on the Recipients field to select the individual names.

Click on the check box corresponding to the desired name, then press Add.

When you finish filling in the rest of the options and the body of the message, press Send.

When you finish filling in the rest of the options and the body of the message, press Send.


Last Update On: 11/14/2023

435.content:
When a new child authorization is added to the Provider's account, KinderConnect sends a message alert to providers to notify them of this change. 

If the Provider asks about the next steps, the Support agents must verify if they have created a Private Pay record for the child:

  • If the Support agent confirms that NO private pay record is created, NO required action is needed.
  • If the Support agent confirms that there is a private pay record created, advise the Provider to press the Action Required button. This takes them to the Merge Child page where they can merge the subsidized and private pay records. 
    • Click on the Merge Child Records button for the next steps. 

Last Update On: 9/8/2023

436.page_title: Provider | Multi-board Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet
436.content:
Multi-board Providers will need to print the Mobile Sign-in Sheet for a Sponsor wanting to use KinderSmart. The Provider must ensure to print out the Mobile Sign-in Sheet associated with the board the Sponsor resides in.

The provider can access this by following the steps below:

KinderSmart Registration form

To register KinderSmart, a parent/sponsor must register their app using their unique KinderSmart Registration Form. The provider can access this by following the steps below:

  1. A provider will need to search for the Parent/Sponsor under the Sponsor>Search page
  2. Remind the Provider to press the Clear button to remove previously entered criteria.
  3. Provider then enters the appropriate search criteria into the available fields. NOTE: The more criteria you add, the more specific your search results will be.
  4. Once found, click on the sponsor's name.

Once in the sponsor record, press the PrintKinderSmart Registration Form button.
A pop-up will appear.
Press Print.
This will download the Registration Form to the Provider's computer.
Note: Providers cannot use the TWC-provided tablet to download the Form. The Provider should check that the name on the form matches the Sponsor who is registering.


Next, the Provider must make sure when printing out the Mobile Sign-in Sheet for the Sponsor it is associated with the board the Sponsor resides in. And have the Sponsor re-scan the Mobile Sign-in Sheet.

Follow the steps below:

Provider Mobile Sign-in Sheet

When entering or backdating attendance within 150 feet of the Provider location, the KinderSmart app will work without asking the Sponsor to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet. Otherwise, the Sponsor will have to scan the Provider Mobile Sign-In Sheet, please ensure the Provider has it handy or they will have to print it.

 Note: The Provider should not allow Parents/Sponsors to have a copy of the Mobile Sign-in Sheet. This would allow the parent/Sponsor to register attendance from anywhere outside of the Provider's location.


The Provider will navigate to the Reports > Reports page.
They will then press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Mobile Sign In Sheet from the Report menu.

Once selected, Press View.
Once downloaded, open the file and either use the tablet (KinderSign) or the smartphone (KinderSmart) camera to scan.

Last Update On 09/22/2023

437.content:
The TX3C Availability Portal is a one-stop shop where families (Subsidized and Private Pay) can search for childcare providers tailored to family's needs and locations.

TX3C users can fall into three types: Provider, Family, or Administrator. For each of these categories, there are different interfaces. We have provided training videos for each of these interfaces, and we encourage you to review them at your own convenience.

  • Parent Central is used by Families/Parents to search for childcare providers with current openings. 
    • Note: More details are still being worked on; specific information will be provided soon. 
    • Parent Central training video. 
  • Provider Central is used by Providers to add descriptions about their program and update openings or availability to help families find available care. 
    • Provider Central training video. 
  • Admin Portal is used by Administrators to view and manage family and provider information and complete other tasks. 
    • Support permission is currently under review. 
    • Admin Portal training video. Passcode: L2WQ#Ga9

Last Update Date: 02/21/2024

Note: The Admin users' access will depend on the permission of their account.

To navigate this website, click on this link: https://childcare.twc.texas.gov/admin/

440.content:
If there is a security threat found on a smartphone, it may not allow the sponsor to use the KinderSmart application. Here is a list of codes related to these issues in the attachment for Androids or IOS Apple:

Android Error Codes:

Error Code

Message

Reason

01

We have detected that your device is rooted. For your protection, the app will be closed. Please disable root-state, reset your device or contact support. REF: 6901

Rooted device detected

02

For your protection, please go to Settings and turn off 'Unknown Sources' or contact support. REF: 6701

Unknown sources are enabled

03

For your protection, please go to Settings and turn off 'Developer Options' or contact support. REF: 6702

Developer Options is enabled

04 

We have detected an untrusted connection. For your protection, please switch networks, close and reopen the app, or contact support. REF: 6500

MITM detected

05

We have detected an untrusted connection. For your protection, please switch networks, close and reopen the app, or contact support. REF: 6510

Proxy detected

06

We have detected an untrusted connection. For your protection, please switch networks, close and reopen the app, or contact support. REF: 6502

TLS 1.2 version not detected (forced downgrade)

07

The app has detected a potential security threat on this device. For your protection, the app will close. (Ref: 7215)

Tampering detected, (debugger, code manipulator, checksum failure, static app caching, code tampering, app repacking, emulator/simulator detection

 

iOS Exit codes:

Error code

Message

Reason

01

We have detected that your device is jailbroken. For your protection, the app will be closed. Please disable jailbreak, reset your device or contact support. REF: 6901

Device is Jailbroken

02

We have detected an untrusted connection. For your protection, please switch networks, close and reopen the app, or contact support. REF: 6500

MITM detected

03

What if the Sponsor is affected by this issue?

  • If the Sponsor is affected by this issue and their KinderSmart cannot function as expected, Support agents must recommend the Sponsor to use the KinderSign app on the TWC-issued tablet. Another alternative would be to use a different device. No further actions needed. 
  • Please note that currently, the KinderSmart app does not display a code as displayed above. A JIRA (https://controltecjira.atlassian.net/browse/KSM-217) has been created for this. 
  • DO NOT escalate these calls to the Back Office Team. Support Agents must set the cases created to “On Hold – JIRA Ticket” status and include the JIRA link.

440.question: Select the best option below:

441.content:
Providers can input and modify information regarding their program through the TX3C Availability Portal.

Providers must be logged in first before they can edit their profile.

Description

Providers can add and share a description of their program in the Description section. This includes their mission statement, philosophy, and other important information. 

If there is a public notice associated with the Provider's program, this will be displayed in the Public Notice box. This field is locked to the Provider and cannot be edited. 



Contact

Providers can add or update their contact information and location in the Contact section.

In this section, Providers can see on a map where the daycare is located. Providers can also view and edit the business name for their location. 

Providers can view email, phone, website, address, etc. However, please note that this information comes from licensing data and cannot be edited by providers.

Providers can also add information like their Facebook page, link to Google information, link to Yelp information, etc.

Providers can view the latitude and longitude, which are used to populate the map at the top of the page. (This cannot be edited)

They can also update primary contact information. It's suggested to fill this section out with information for who they would like families to contact with name, phone, and email.


Programs

The Program section reflects the programs that the Provider is currently licensed to provide. The information on this page will be visible to families.

Providers can edit some information about each of their programs. However, they cannot delete the programs or rename them.
To update the program's capacity, click on the three dots located beside the program name. This will allow Providers to update the desired capacity as needed.


How to Enroll

The How to Enroll section allows Providers to share more steps and information with families to let them know what steps they would need to take to enroll in the program.

Providers can update the title and the description for step one. 

Providers can also add files here if they need families to have access to any documents.
To add additional steps, the Provider will press the blue Add Step button.

To delete steps, the Provider will press the white Delete Step button.


Hours of Operation

The Hours of Operation section allows Providers to view information about the hours they are open. Please note that some fields are locked as they correlate with the Provider's licensing information.

The Closed status shows the current status of the program's operation hours. 

The picture on the left shows that the Provider is open. However, they cannot update this information. 
Providers can update the program season to indicate if they offer Year round, School year only or Summer only.
Providers can view their Program options and hours of operation.
Providers can add other hours information in the provided box, if necessary.


Highlights

In the Highlights section, Providers can share more detailed information about their program.

Providers can add and share information about their programs, such as Curriculum, Immersion languages, Meals, Parent involvement, Program focus, specialized care, spoken languages, toilet learning, transportation, and other program highlights.
Note: All the information with a drop-down option is filterable to families on the Texas Child Care ChildCare Connection.

For example, if they select that they offer immersion language programs in French, and a family is specifically searching for immersion language programs in French, you will appear in the search results.


Last Updated On: 03/15/2024
441.question: Does this answer the Provider's question?

442.content:
Prospective Families can request a tour of a Provider's location to view the daycare location in person. If the Provider chooses to offer this option, they must enable tour requests on their Provider Profile. 

Support agents should follow the steps below to guide the Provider on how to:

Set up and Enable tour requests

Providers need to sign in to the TX3C Availability Portal. Once signed in, click "Edit Profile" from the home page.
On the Edit Profile page, click "Tour Requests" from the menu on the left-hand side of the screen.
On the Tour Requests page, to enable tour requests, click on the blue button that says "Enable Families to Request a Tour."
Once Tour Requests are enabled, the page will change to allow editing of tour request times.

  • To allow or remove specific days from being eligible for tour requests, select the "yes" or "no" buttons next to the day in question.
  • To adjust the time that is available on the specific day, move the dark blue slider on the light blue timeline to the desired timeframe.
At the bottom of the page, providers have the option to allow multiple families to tour simultaneously and give an estimate on how long a tour would take to complete.

  • To allow multiple families to tour simultaneously, click the checkbox next to "Allow families to tour at the same time."
  • To select how long the tour will take, click on the dropdown menu under "How long are your tours?" and then choose between "30 Minutes", "1 Hour", and "2 Hours"
To stop allowing Tour Requests, click on the big blue button towards the top of the page that says "Tours Enabled."  The days listed on the Tour Request page will disappear, and tour requests from families can no longer be completed.


Note: Enabling tour requests on this page only allows for families to request a tour. In order to accept or refuse a tour, Providers need to follow the instructions sent to their email when a tour is requested.

Last Update On: 09/27/2023

443.content:
In the Financial Programs Page, Providers can share information about all payment methods that are accepted.

 Support Agents can guide the Provider through the steps below:

How to Edit Accepted Payment Methods

Sign in to the TX3C Availability Portal, then select "Edit Profile" from the home page.
On the Edit Profile Page, click "Financial Programs" from the menu on the left-hand side of the page. Providers may have to scroll down to see this option.
To edit the accepted payment methods, click the dropdown menu under "Payment methods accepted." Select the payment options the provider accepts such as:
  • Cash
  • Money Order
  • Check
  • Visa
  • Mastercard
To add additional payment methods that are not in the list, click on the grey box below "Additional Payment Options" and then type in the additional payment methods.

444.content:
Providers can feature specific staff members to be displayed to the families when searching for their daycare location. It can display their photo, name, and short biography. Providers can feature as many staff members as they would like.

To feature a Staff Member, Support Agents can guide the Provider through the steps below:

Sign in to the TX3C Availability Portal, then click "Edit Profile" from the home page.
On the "Edit Profile" page, click "Staff" from the menu options on the left-hand side of the page. Providers may have to scroll down to see this option.
On the Staff Members page, click the blue "+Add" button in the top right-hand corner. This opens the "New Staff Member" pop-up.
To add a photo of the featured staff member, either drag and drop the photo into the grey box at the top of the screen, or click the blue "browse files" option to find the photo on the device.
To enter the Staff Member's name, click in the grey box below "Name" and then type in the Staff Member's name.
To enter a short biography, click on the grey box under "Short Bio" and then type in the short biography that is to be displayed.
Once done, click the "Save" button in the bottom-right hand corner of the pop-up menu. To feature additional staff members, simply repeat the process.

Last Update On: 10/13/2023
444.question: Does this answer the Provider's Question?

445.content:
Providers can view their licensing information in the TX3C Availability Portal. However, this information is restricted and cannot be edited as it comes from the State Licensing System. 

All restricted information in the Availability Portal gets updated regularly with the following schedule:

  • Restricted Information excluding Quality Rating: Everyday
  • Quality Rating Information: Once a month

To view the licensing information in Provider Central, Support Agents can guide the Provider by following the steps below:

Viewing Licensing Information 

Sign in to the TX3C Availability Portal, then click "Edit Profile" from the home page.
On the Edit Profile page, click "Licensing" from the menu on the left-hand side. Providers may have to scroll down to see this option.
Providers can now view their individual Licensing and Accreditation information. 

Providers will have to scroll down to see all fields. 


Licensing Information Discrepancies

If the Provider is reporting discrepancies regarding their licensing information in the Availability Portal, Support must follow the guidelines below:

Issue 1: Incorrect Restricted information in the Availability Portal

Resolution: if the Provider reports that restricted information in the Availability Portal is incorrect, Support agents must confirm and match the information with the provider on the Texas Open Data Portal.

  • Check here for information regarding Texas Rising Star and Subsidy Acceptance.
  • Check here for all other information.

If the info in the Data portal is correct, but in the Availability Portal, it is wrong, escalate this issue to the Availability Portal team via Back Office Form. 

If the info in the Data portal and the Availability both show incorrect information, refer the Provider to review their information in the State licensing system. 

Issue 2: Incorrect Non-Restricted Information in the Availability Portal

Resolution: If the Provider updated non-restricted information (such as program description, pictures, etc) but reported that the updates did not display on the Availability Portal, the Support agent needs to follow the troubleshooting steps below: 

Note: Any changes made by the provider in the Availability Portal are updated in real-time.

Navigate to the TX3C Availability Portal website.
Enter the name of the program in the search field and select the program that matches your search. 
This will take you to the Provider Information page. 

Scroll down to look for more information. Identify with the provider the information they want to be updated. 
Sign in to the Admin Portal: https://childcare.twc.texas.gov/admin
Go to Provider > Locations.
Enter the program's name and select the program that matches your search.

This will take you to the Provider Information page of the Admin Portal.

Scroll down to look for more information. Identify with the provider the information they want to be updated.


        ○ If the Provider's update is not in the Admin Portal or the Availability Portal (for end-user), the Support must walk the Provider through updating the information. Select No - Edit Provider's Profile

        ○ If the Provider's update is found in the Admin Portal but is not showing on the Availability Portal (for end-user), Support must escalate to the Availability Portal Team.

Last Update On: 02/27/2024

446.content:
Support Agents can guide Providers on uploading photos to reflect information about their location. These photos will be visible to families when they search for Providers in the TX3C Availability Portal.

Follow the steps below:

Once the Provider is logged in, click Edit profile.
To the left of the screen, select Photos.
To upload a photo, click the blue button in the top right-hand corner +Upload. To drop files or click the blue link to browse files from their computer.
Drag and drop a photo here. 
Next, click the green upload file button to upload. Once the upload is uploaded, the photo will show on the screen.

Click Done.
To delete the photo, use the blue trashcan button in the top right-hand corner.
Click the blue next button in the bottom right-hand corner to move forward to the next section of the profile.


Video Tour

In the virtual video tour section, Providers will be able to upload a video in the same way they uploaded a photo. Families will see this video and can view more information in the video about their location.

To upload a video, click the blue button in the top right-hand corner that says plus upload. 

Click Donewhen ready to complete.

447.content:
Providers can quickly update their availability so potential families will know if the location currently has openings for specific aged children when searching based on their programs.

Support Agents can guide a Provider on how to update their availability and add an opening by following the steps below:

Once the Provider is logged in, click Update Availability.
Select the # of openings and choose the Date available.

Select the For Which Programs? to show all the programs that the Provider's license offers.
Once For Which Programs is selected, Providers can choose the program/s they want to edit. 

Note: The available program depends on how the provider is set up with the state.

In the example on the left, it shows that the Provider offers Infant and Toddler program, and that they added two openings for the Infants program.
To edit the age requirement for the selected program, select a Minimum age and a Maximum age for the opening.

Once done, select Save.
A display box will appear with the Openings shown up to date.
If there are no openings, a red box No available openings will be displayed.
To view saved or current openings, select the tab on the left that says Openings.

Families and parents can also use Parent Central to submit their application for financial aid.
