449.content:
Families/Parents can add Providers to their favorites list and send messages to Providers. To do this, Families/Parents must log in or create an account in the TX3C Availability Portal first.

Support may also provide the following URL Texas Child Care Connection for Families if needed.

Support Agents can guide the Sponsors by following the steps below:

Creating an Account

Press the three black lines in the top right-hand corner and select Login.
If the Family/Parent previously created an account, enter the email address and press Login.

If the Sponsor wants to create an account, click on the Create Account link.
The Family/Parent will enter their first name, last name, email, and verify email. 

Press Sign up. 
After the Family/Parent reads the TX3C Availability Portal Terms and Conditions, select Accept and Continue.

Check the email for a code that was sent by the system.

Click on the link to log in automatically. 

Alternatively, enter the unique code in the portal.

The Family will be automatically logged in after correctly entering the unique code.


Last Update On: 05/15/2024
449.question: Did the family successfully create an account?

450.content:
Support can assist families/parents in searching for childcare by following the steps below:

Searching for Childcare

Before searching for childcare, Families/parents can view the portal in English or Spanish by selecting the language in the portal's top right-hand corner.
In the Search field, select the drop-down. Families/Parents can choose home, work, zip code, or along my commute. Families/Parents can also search for a city or an exact address.
If searching by City, an option below will pop up to choose the location. 
If home, work, zip code, or along my commute is chosen, additional options will appear.
By clicking Along my Commute, it will allow to input two addresses. A  starting location and a final location to see options for childcare along the entire route.

Once search criteria are entered for the search area, click Done.
On the Method of transportation, options for the type of transportation will appear. Options such as Driving, Walking, Public transit, and Biking can be selected. 
Next, click the Children to choose for what age the child care is needed. 
Click Done and then click the blue Submit button to search.


Reviewing/Filtering the Search Results

Once the search is submitted, a map on the right-hand side will show the location searched for.

On the left-hand side, it will show all childcare options in the area.

The search results can be filtered by showing results of only the ages selected by selecting the box below on the children tab.
These options can also filter the search results:
  • Availability
  • Texas Rising Star
  • Program Options
  • Hours and more
By clicking Availability, it will show only the Providers who have reported availability.
By clicking Texas Rising Star, it will show only Providers who offer a certain Rising Star.
By clicking Program Options, it will show Providers with specific program options. For example for a child with special needs, drop-in care, or offer field trips, etc.

By clicking Hours, it will give the option to select what day of the week is desired. Once selected the Apply button will light up blue to apply the filters selected.
Clicking More Filters will bring up a pop-up. It will show any additional options available to apply to the Provider search criteria desired.
The results will show as a list and will reflect on the map. 

On the left-hand side, it will show names of the childcare options that meet the search criteria, and on the right-hand side, it will show a map where those locations are 
To view more information on a specific Provider, select View more information at the bottom of the childcare location interested in 
It will display an overview of the location's available information. For more detailed information, select View Profile.
This will show a detailed view of the location's information.


Families/Parents can create a favorites list but will have to create an account first in order to save the locations they want to mark as favorites. On the main page, Sponsors have the option to download the favorites list created.

Last updated on: 10/06/2023

453.content:
After the Provider gathers the ID and group password, depending on the CCMS vendor, the provider may need to contact their CCMS vendor to complete the integration or utilize any resources we have available for them.

Support agents must provide the additional resources listed below for the following CCMS vendors:

  • Smartcare: After the customer gathers the ID and group password from KinderSystem, they need to contact SmartCare's customer support and share the credentials provided. Once the information is shared, SmartCare will finalize the integration on their end. 
    • Contact - Phone: (844) 762-7837 Option 2, Email: Support@smartcare.com
  • Lillio (formerly known as HiMama): After the customer gathers the ID and group password from KinderSystems, the Support agent will provide the Help article link: Lillio KinderConnect Integration Steps, as it contains step-by-step integration screenshots to assist the caller.
  • Famly: If the customer needs additional support, the Support Agent can send this resource to the provider for further assistance. KinderConnect Integration | Famly Support | Famly Help Center
  • Brightwheel: If the customer needs additional support, the Support Agent can send this resource to the provider for further assistance: https://help.mybrightwheel.com/en/articles/7157785-integrated-attendance-with-kinderconnect 
    • If the Provider has multiple boards/regions, please have the Provider reach out to Brightwheel to start transmitting attendance. Multiple boards/regions will need to be set up first to finish the integration. Providers can contact: support@mybrightwheel.com
  • Procare: If the Provider has multiple boards/regions, please have the Provider reach out to Owen Mcarlson at omcarlson@procaresoftware.com to help finish the integration with the multiple location IDs. 
  • Wonderschool
    • Documentation: KinderConnect Integration Process – Wonderschool (zendesk.com)
    • Contact: Wonderschool (zendesk.com)
  • Lineleader: 
    • Contact:+1 866.306.1985 / Email: support@lineleader.com 
  • 1Coresolution:
    • Contact: Need Help? Contact Us | 1Core Solution
  • ThomasKelly Software/EZChildTrack:
    • Contact: Childcare Management Software | Childcare Management System | EZChildTrack

If the Provider requires assistance finding the Child IDs, guide the Provider to Child > Search, enter desired criteria, and use the sample below to find the Child ID number. Do not use the CIN.

Providers can edit a range of settings on their Provider Profile. They can add photos, upload a video tour, edit their program information, set up tour requests, and more. 

Some of the settings on their profile will reflect in the filters used by potential families when searching. 

They can also view their licensing information, but it is not editable. For example, the indicator for accepting childcare subsidy in the search results cannot be configured by the provider, it comes from licensing information from the state.

455.content:
The provider can review attendance on the Attendance > Detail page of KinderConnect. 

Support Agents can guide the Providers by following the steps below:

Reviewing attendance in KinderConnect

Select the Attendance activity from the Navigation Bar.

Select the Detail option to open the Detail page.

•    Operators that have one license number serving multiple boards (Multi-board Providers) will be able to see all children across all boards on the Attendance Detail page without the need to change the Provider drop-down menu. 

•    Operators that have multiple license numbers assigned to them will need to select the program/location they are trying to view attendance from. They can access other locations by selecting them in the Provider drop-down menu.

Notes:  

  • If the Provider states they cannot see a child with an active schedule/authorization, the Provider can check if the child is assigned to a different location.
    • If the child is not found in other locations, the Provider must confirm that the Child’s authorization is active.



The Attendance > Detail page of KinderConnect allows the user to review the details of the records of Attendance or hours of care for children at the selected Provider.

  1. Select Provider location if needed.
  2. Navigate to a previous week.
  3. Enter the date you would like to view the Attendance.
  4. Navigate to the following week.
  5. Choose how many children to display.
  6. There is an option to sort the children's names from A-Z or Z-A.
  7. There is an option to search by name. 

The provider will be able to view the children's information, including First & Last Names, Case Number, and Child CIN.


Last Update On: 10/06/2023
455.question: Was the Provider able to review attendance successfully ?

456.content:
Remember, providers CANNOT enter Attendance in KinderConnect.

Still, providers may also need assistance guiding sponsors on how to perform different attendance-related activities. 

Before assisting the provider with Attendance related questions, the Support Agent must identify the following:

  • The Child/ren's First & Last Name
  • The Billing Cycle/dates
  • Any errors message, if any

General Policies for Attendance:

  1. Providers CANNOT enter attendance 
  2. Providers CANNOT Recall attendance 
  3. Attendance can be backdated 6 days from the service date by the Sponsor
  4. ALL attendance is automatically submitted 7 Days after the Service Period, regardless of status. Click on Submitting Attendance for more information. 
  5. Only ONE time needs to be entered for the state to accept the attendance
    • Agents should encourage them to enter at all times
    • Families only need to enter an IN or OUT time. A full-time pairing is not required for the day to be paid by TWC 
  6.  If the Provider is the child's transportation, the Provider may take the tablet with them so the Sponsor can sign in or out the child.
    •  But if the tablet needs to stay at the location for others to sign in then Support must refer the Provider to contact the State Helpdesk at tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov to request additional tablets.
  7. Operators that have multiple license numbers assigned to them will need to select the program/location they are trying to view attendance from.

Note: The Payment for the submitted attendance is based on the child's authorization. If the Provider has further questions regarding their payment is calculated, please refer to State Helpdesk tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov

Last Update On: 09/05/2023

458.content:
Aside from Attendance and Remote Absences, Sponsors have access to the following options in KinderSmart:

Viewing Case Information

Sponsors have access to view their child's case information through KinderSmart by selecting the Case Information option.

By tapping on the Case Information option on the main menu, sponsors may view their child's case details, such as:

  • Authorization dates
  • Providers

Viewing Messages 

Sponsors have access to view their messages through KinderSmart by selecting the Messages option in their Activities screen.

  • Once the Activities screen displays, tap Messages. This will list all the messages in your inbox. 
  • Tap on the message you would like to review. 
  • After reviewing your message, you have the option to delete a message by tapping Delete Message.
  • You may also create a reminder message for yourself by tapping Set Reminder. Once the message is complete, tap Save. 
  • To return back to the Activities screen, tap the back arrow.  

Viewing Transactions

Sponsors have access to view recorded attendance by selecting the Transactions option.
Once selected, a list of attendance transactions will be displayed below the dates.

The recorded attendance displayed is viewed weekly. To navigate to the desired week click on the back or forward arrows next to the dates. 


Viewing Settings

In Settings, Sponsor can view:

  • Scan QR Code: This allows the Sponsor to scan the QR code without re-installing the app.
  • Language: This allows the Sponsor to change the language while using the app. Language options are:
    • English
    • Spanish 
    • Vietenamese
  • Version: This shows the current version number of the KinderSmart Application

Last Updated On: 10/13/2023

460.content:
Relative In-home providers will use Interactive Voice Recognition or IVR, a phone-based system that does not require access to the Internet, to track attendance. IVR can be used on a cellphone or a landline phone. Ex. Press 1 to clock the child in. IVR only logs live attendance and cannot enter backdated times. 

When a Relative In-home Provider calls in for the first time, Support Agents will need to fill out a New Relative In- home Provider Registration form in order for the new Relative In-home Provider to receive an email with a verification code to be able to register in KinderConnect. (It may take up to 72 hours to receive the verification code). Please be advised In-home Providers do not fill out a survey.

Once the email with the verification code is received, relative In-home Providers can proceed to register in KinderConnect or call in for registration assistance. 

  • New Relative In-home Provider calling in for the first time please select Fill Out New Relative In-home Provider Registration Form
  • New Relative In-home Provider calling in for registration assistance select Proceed to Registration Steps

Notes: 

  • If Provider states it has been over 72 hours and they have not received their email with verification code Support Agents will need to reach out to Raul Tejeda: rtejeda@kindersystems.com. 
  • Relative In-Home Providers will not receive a tablet. IVR Providers are not allowed to use KinderSign or KinderSmart and must use IVR. In case they have further questions regarding this policy, Support Agents should refer the Provider to contact the State Help Desk.

Last Updated On: 12/27/2023
460.question: Select the best option below:

0.button_text: Fill Out New Relative In-home Provider Registration Form

461.content:
Before proceeding to send a replacement tablet, the Support agent must ask for the serial number of the tablet from the provider. The provider can have this from the tablet box. They will then send a request for the lost or stolen tablet to be ‘locked' via Teams > Tablet Unlocks Channel.

From Microsoft Teams, select Teams from the menu located on the left side.

Go to Support, then click on Tablet unlocks.

Click on New Conversation down at the bottom.

Begin sending your request, including the following information:

DVN 

Serial Number/s of the tablet/s



If the provider is unable to find the tablet serial number, Support agent can find this information in Netsuite. This can be located on the customer account under Sales > items. 

Last Updated On: 11/01/2023

All new Relative In-home Providers must first have a registration form filled out in order to receive an email with a verification code to be able to register and create an account in KinderConnect.

The Support Agent will need to collect the new Relative In-home Provider Registration information and send it to the registration team. The team will follow up within 72 hours. The registration team will review the information and send the registration email with the next group of emails.

  • Please review and confirm the details of the New Relative In-home Provider Registration Form. 
    • If you need to make changes, click on the Back button. 
    • If the information is correct, click on the Send Email to the Registration Team button. 
  • Create a case and leave the case as In Progress status.

  • If you have not received a response or update to your request within 24 business hours, please follow up with the Registration Team to ensure it was not missed. 
  • Registration Team contact information: jnajera@kindersystems.com

466.page_title: JIRA Authorized Children Not Appearing in KC
466.content:
JIRA Authorized Children Not Appearing in KC

A known issue is causing some subsidized children's authorization to not appear in KinderConnect.

1. If a Child's authorization cannot be found or has expired, but the Provider/Sponsor has verified with TWC that the child has authorization or

2. If the Provider/Sponsor is unsure whether the child should have an active authorization, then Support Agents must follow the process below:

  1. Create a case, and the case must be left On hold - JIRA Ticket status
  2. The case must have the JIRA link information. Refer to Handling Cases in Netsuite for more information
  3. If no active Authorization is found, guide the Provider in creating a Non-Subsidized Child to track attendance. See Adding Non-Subsidized Child below.
  4. Fill out the TX JIRA Authorized Children Not Appearing Form, select Fill out TX JIRA Authorized Children Not Appearing Form 
    • Raul and the TX Team will handle this issue. Raul will reach out to TWC to validate the child's authorization. 
    • Once validated, Raul will update the case and reach out to the Support agent.

Note: If the Sponsor would like to apply for authorization and or re-apply for a renewal of authorization, the Support Agent must refer them to contact their case worker or the State Helpdesk. Do not fill out this form. 

Adding Non-Subsidized Child

Click on the Child > Detail page on the navigation bar.
Add a Non-Subsidized child by pressing New to create a new record at the top of the Detail page. This step is essential when entering multiple records.
Enter the required information for the child indicated 
by a red asterisk (*):
  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Date of Birth
  • Non-Subsidized Schedules
A Provider can enter the rest of the information if desired. At the bottom of the page, the Provider has to press Add Non-Subsidized Schedule and enter the start and end date of the schedule.
Press Save at the top of the Child Detail page. 

Make sure the Provider can link the Child Account to the sponsor account. If the Provider needs assistance adding a Sponsor to the Non-Subsidized child account, proceed to Adding Sponsor. 

What the Provider Needs to Know:

  • There is a known issue that is being worked on.
  • Providers should continuously check that the child's authorization has been added to the system. Once added, they may call Support if they need assistance merging the accounts.
  • If the provider has any payment-related queries or concerns, Support agents should not advise providers on how to manage their business or receive payments. Explain the current scenario and issues. Providers can also their inquiries to tx3cquestions@twc.texas.gov.

Handling the Case in NetSuite

If the caller is affected by the ongoing JIRA, follow the steps below to create the case.

Make sure the Provider can link the Child Account to the sponsor account. If the Provider needs assistance adding a Sponsor to the Non-Subsidized child account, proceed to Adding Sponsor.

In the Subject field, enter "Missing Children from KC"
Mark the case Status as "On Hold - Jira Ticket"

Enter the KS Jira Number as:  https://controltecjira.atlassian.net/browse/IN-500
Select the KS Issue Texas as "Authorized Children Not Appearing in KC."
Make sure to list the missing children's First and Last Name in the User Notes.

Make sure to ask for the Child Case Number assigned to the child's subsidy case by the state and record it. 
Note: Families may not have this number, but Support Agents can find the Child case number in the Attendance > Detail page and Provider > Cases page. 

Notes:

  • Open Jira case should not be created if the child names have already been previously recorded on an Open Jira case.
  •  Support Agents will need to check all open JIRA cases weekly to see if the authorizations have been updated. If the authorization has been updated, notify Team Lead and close the case. 
  • Please contact the original caller once the authorization is updated prior to closing the case.
  • Support Agents must ask whether the caller has the case number relating to the missing family. If the Provider is unaware of the case number, it is not an issue. However, if they do have the case number, kindly request them to provide it, and ensure it is documented in the case notes. This step significantly expedites the process of adding the child.

Last Updated On: 12/13/2023

467.content:
Admin users must log in to the TX3C Availability Portal website to edit their Profiles for families to view. 

Note: The Admin must be added first to be able to log in.  

Support agents must guide the Admin user through the steps listed below:

Open the browser and enter find.childcare.texas.gov/providers. 
Enter the email address, then press Submit.
Check the email for a code that was sent by the system.

To log in, the Admin user can either enter the code below to access their account. 

Or, click the link in the email to login automatically. 

Last Updated On: 11/16/2023
467.question: Select the best option below:

468.page_title: Admin Portal | How to Review Provider Location
468.content:
Admins users can review Provider locations by following the steps below:

Once signed in as Admin user, click on Provider from the left menu and select Locations from the drop down.


The list of Providers will appear.

Admin user can use the search field to search for a particular location to narrow down the search results.
Select the provider by clicking the name of the location
Selecting the name of the location will open up a landing page were you can view:

  • Description of Program
  • Hours of Operation
  • Photos etc
It also has viewing options at the top of the page such as:
  • Profile
  • Programs
  • Openings 
  • License
  • and more

Last Updated On: 11/21/2023
468.question: Select the best option below:

469.page_title: Admin Portal | How to Manage Admins, Members & Team
469.content:
All users who has access to Admin Portal are called members. These users can be assigned as a member or admin user in the system.


Select each topic below to learn how to manage admin user accounts:

↘️ How to Add Admin and Member Users

Click Settings from the drop-down and select Members.
This takes you to the screen with a list of current admins and members of the systems. Select +New Member to add a new user.
A popup box will come up for you to enter:
  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Email
Press Save to save the changes. 

By default, a user will have a member access. 
Close

↘️ How to Update and View Permissions

Once a member account is saved, you will be taken to the user profile where you will be able to select the type of permissions you want to grant the user.
To assign a user to an Admin role, enable the permission that says " Is this user an administrator?"
Admin users can change the Permissions of a Member or Admin user in the system as needed. The user's access will depend on the permission granted.

Press Save to save the changes made.
Close

↘️ How to Add a Team

To create a team, click on Settings and select Teams from the drop-down.
This will open up the page with the option to select + New Team.
A pop-up window will come up and add a Team Name.
Click Save.
The team name will display at the top, and then you will be able to select Add Member 
Enter the name of a team member. Press Save to save the changes.
The member will show under the team name.
Repeat these steps for all the members desired in the group
Close


Last Updated On: 11/22/2023
469.question: Select the best option below:

470.page_title: Admin | How to Manage a Family Application
470.content:
Admin users can manage family applications in Admin Portal. Follow the steps below:

Click Family Subsidies on the left side.
The results for all Family subsidies will be displayed.
Search options can be filtered by the status of the Family's application with any of the options shown.
Families applications can also be found by typing in the name in the search bar.
Once the name has been entered, a results list will be displayed below. 

Click the desired family name.
Click the family name to open up the application.
To view more information about the application, select the application number.
This will display the family's profile.
The application status can also be selected.
By selecting the Status, it will list the reasons for the status displayed.

Last Updated On: 11/21/2023
470.question: Select the best option below:

471.page_title: Admin Portal | How to Verify Provider's Email Address
471.content:
The Provider account gets created according to the data imported from the Texas Licensing System. Admin users can verify the Provider email addresses for the TX3C Availability Portal in multiple ways.

Method 1: Provider Locations Page

Log in Availability Portal as an Admin user. 

Click on Provider from the left navigation and select Locations. The Locations page shows the complete list of Providers imported from the State Licensing system. 
Enter the license number in the search field to filter the results. 

Then, click the name of the location in the search results. 
Once on the Provider record, you will be taken to the Profile page. Look for the Contact Information section. 

The first email address displayed above the Contact information section is the email address of the business/location. Click on this email to verify the staff email address.
You will be taken to the Businesses page. 

The Staff section shows the Staff member's email address that needs to be used for login. 


Method 2: Provider Staff Page

Once signed as an Admin user, click on Provider from the left navigation and select Staff.

Staff are the Provider users who can access and update provider information.
Enter the Staff's name or email address in the search field to filter the results. Press Enter to view the search results.

Click the Staff name to be taken to the Staff page. 
The Last Login column will show the last login date and time.

Note: If the Provider has never logged in, they will have an unknown name, and the Last login column will be empty.

The Staff member's email address that needs to be used for login will be displayed. 



Method 3: Reports

Admin users can review all the provider location details using the Provider Access Analysis report. 

Once signed as an Admin user, click on Reports from the left navigation.
In the search field, type Staff Member and press enter to search.
Scroll down to the bottom to find the search results. Select the report. 
The Member Email column shows the email address the Provider must use to log in to the TX3C Availability Portal (Provider Central).
To filter the report or search for an email, click on three dots, then select Add filter.

Note: If you cannot see this option, please contact your supervisor/manager to view/change your user permission settings.  
In the Add Filters window:
1. Press Add to add the filters.
2. Select contains as the Condition. You may also use the other conditions as applicable to your search.
3. Enter the keyword in the Value field.
4. Press Save. 
The Admin user also downloads the report to view the complete list of this report.


Incorrect Restricted information in the Availability Portal

 If the Provider reports that restricted information in the Availability Portal is incorrect (such as email address), the Support agent needs to confirm and match the information with the provider on this website: Texas Open Data Portal

  • If the info in the Data portal is correct, but in the Availability Portal, it is wrong, escalate this issue to the Availability Portalteam via the Back Office form.
    • The Back Office Agent will confirm what the Support Agents found and then email Baker, who will contact BridgeCare to review the issue. 
  • If the info in the Data portal and the Availability both show incorrect information, refer the Provider to review their information in the State Licensing system. 

Last Update On: 1/10/2024
471.question: Select the best option below:

2.button_text: Incorrect Restricted information/Further Troubleshooting Needed. Escalate Call.

472.page_title: Admin Portal | How to View User's Login History
472.content:
Viewing Admin/Member's Creation Date

The Members tab under the Settings menu shows the list of System Admin users (BridgeCare team, KinderSystems team, the TWC team, etc.) who can view and access the Admin Portal. There are two roles available for admin users: Admin and Member. 

  • Admin users with Admin Roles have full access and can update their permissions and the permissions of other System Admin.
  • Admin users with Member Roles have limited access and cannot update their settings on their individual Members page, and they will not see the list of permissions at all.

To view the Admin User's (Admin/Member role) creation date, follow the steps below:

Once signed in as an Admin user, click on Settings from the left navigation and select Members.
You will see the list of all Members who can view and access the TX3C Availability Portal as admin users. 
To check when the account was created, look in the Created column.


Viewing Provider's Login History

To view the Provider's login history, follow the steps below:

Once signed as an Admin user, click on Provider from the left navigation and select Staff.

Staff are the Provider users who can access and update provider information.
Search for the provider's email address in the search field. Press enter to view the search results.

The Search results will be displayed below.

To check when the Provider staff last logged in, refer to the Last Login column.

If no results are found, the email is not added or found in the system

Last Update On: 11/22/2023
472.question: Select the best option below:

473.page_title: Admin Portal | How to Add a Provider Staff
473.content:
Admin users can add a Provider Satff by following the steps below:

Once signed in as Admin User, select Providers and select Staff from the drop-down arrow.

Press Upload Staff.

A pop up window will appear allowing Admin users to attach a file to update or create new memebers.

Once a file is attached, press the Upload button.

Last Updated On: 11/21/2023
473.question: Select the best option below:

474.page_title: Admin Portal | How to Assign/Unassign Locations to Staff
474.content:
Admin users can manage Provider Staff's access to specific locations if the Provider is associated with multiple locations.

They can assign and unassign a Provider staff to individual or multiple locations. Follow the steps below to learn the steps:

Click on Providers on the left-hand menu and select Staff.
Search for the Provider Staff in the search field. 

Select the name of the Provider Staff to go to their profile.
Under the Access section, click on the Assigned locations field.
Check the boxes of the locations to assign. Uncheck the boxes to unassign. 


Last Update On: 11/22/2023
474.question: Select the best option below:

476.page_title: Admin Portal | How to Verify Family's Email Address
476.content:
Families can create accounts in the Availability Portal (Parent Central) to be able to add Providers to their favorites list and send messages to Providers. 

If a family has issues logging into their Parent Central account, follow the steps below to verify the email address that they used:

Once signed in as the Admin user, click Families from the left-hand navigation menu.
Search for the Family using the search bar. 
Click on the name in the search results. 
The Family information will be displayed on the Profile tab.
Select the Member's tab.

The Members tab displays information about the user account (or accounts) for the family. 
The email address displayed on this page is the one used for account creation to Parent Central.

Last Update On: 11/30/2023

487.content:
Families can apply for subsidy using the Availability Portal (Parent Central. To apply for a subsidy, the Family must follow these steps:

  1. Submit the TX3C Eligibility Screener & Waitlist Application. This application is the first step in the process and will help determine if they meet the eligibility criteria to apply for the program.
  2. If accepted, they will receive an invitation from the state via email to submit the TX3C Standard Application. This application requires the family to provide additional information and complete the application process.
  3. Once submitted, the Family will need to wait for a response from the state. 


  • If the family is starting a new application, select Continue TX3C Eligibility Screener & Waitlist App.
  • If the family received an invite from the state to complete the application, Select TX3C Standard Application.

Last Update On: 12/13/2023

493.content:
When a Provider reports issues with successfully transferring attendance from their CCMS to KinderConnect, Support agents must validate the following:

  1. CCMS or third-party software they are using is a certified KinderBridge Partner. 
  2. API box is checked in the Provider > Detail page.

3. Correct software is listed in "Attendance API Source" on the Provider > Detail page.

4. Ask for the Provider's Provider ID and Group password. Verify that they have the correct credentials listed in the system.


5. Provider is uploading the attendance into KinderConnect. They must manually send attendance each week from their CCMS.

  • If any of the requirements above were NOT met, correct the issue, then ask the Provider to attempt to transfer attendance again.
  • If all requirements above were met or you have followed the steps above but the issue persists, select the issue from the options below.

Last Update on: 05/15/2024
493.question: What is the issue with KinderBridge transfer?

0.button_text: All Attendance Not Uploading to KinderConnect

1.button_text: Some Attendance Not Uploading to KinderConnect

2.button_text: Unable to Update Existing Attendance in KinderConnect

4.button_text: Attendance has been Corrected. End of Call

495.page_title: All Attendance Not Uploading to KinderConnect
495.content:
If the Provider reports that all attendance they recorded in their CCMS is NOT uploading to KinderConnect, there is a possibility that there's an issue with the CCMS connection. 

Support agents must follow the troubleshooting steps below:

↘️ Step 1: Reestablish CCMS Connection Credentials

In some cases, CCMS connection needs to be reestablished to ensure successful upload. 

  1. Advise the provider to reselect the state agency and reenter the Provider ID and Group password in their CCMS.
  2. Attempt to upload attendance
  3. If the attendance does not transfer, Support agent must generate a new group password for the Provider. Press Save to save the changes.
  • if resolved, end the call
  • if not resolved, proceed to step 2
Close

↘️ Step 2: Verify if the Provider has multiple regions

  1. Ensure the API is enabled on all of the locations. If not, enable the API and attempt to transfer.
  2. Confirm with the provider if they use their CCMS account for multiple locations. (For example, a Provider has 2 centers under the same Brightwheel account.)If they do, ensure that they are using the correct id and password everytime they transfer attendance.
  3. Attempt to transfer
  • if resolved, end the call
  • If not resolved, proceed to step 3
Close

↘️ Step 3: Validate the Children's authorization

  1. Review recently expired/activated child authorizations for the provider. 
  2. Go to the Provider > Cases. Check recent dates before AND after the dates the provider is trying to transmit. 
  3. Some APIs (e.g., Brightwheel) will not send ANY attendance if one child has attendance outside their authorization dates (before or after). If this is the case, advise the Provider to create a private pay record for the expired subsidized children, or remove the Child ID from their Brightwheel profile.Note: Currently, Brightwheel does not return any errors related to child record issues.

Attendance will not transfer if the Child has no authorization or has expired authorization. For example, a Provider attempting to transfer attendance for midmonth expiration and the child continues to attend after the expiration date.


  • If there is no authorization or an expired authorization, select the No. Child Authorization Issues (JIRA) button and submit the form.
  • if there is authorization, proceed to Step 4.
Close

↘️ Step 4: Review the Children's information

  1. Child ID
    1. To find Child IDs, Support Agents must guide the Provider to go to Child > Search to find the child ID number. Do not use the CIN. (Some providers must have all children's IDs updated correctly for active utilization (Subsidized) before the information will upload to KinderConnect (Providers who use Sage, for example)
    2. If those children whose attendance is not transferring have valid authorizations, check that their DOB, Child Names, and child IDs match in both KC and in their Providers CCMS.
  2. First Name and Last name
    1. Ask them to verify the children's names
    2. After the provider confirms that the child records match but the Child Names are still NOT Confirming – support agents must contact the Team Lead to Check for extra spaces/variations in KinderTrack.
Close


Still not Uploading? 

Document your actions and escalate the call to the Back Office for further troubleshooting.

Last Update on: 05/16/2024
495.question: Was the Provider's issue resolved?

496.page_title: Some Attendance Not Uploading to KinderConnect
496.content:
If attendance for some children recorded in the Provider's CCMS is not uploading to KinderConnect, the issue may be related to the child's record as the CCMS connection has already been established. Support agents must follow the troubleshooting steps below:

↘️ Step 1: Validate that the children have active authorization

  1. Review recently expired/activated child authorizations for the provider. 
  2. Go to the Provider > Cases. Check recent dates before AND after the dates the provider is trying to transmit. 
  3. Some CCMS (e.g., Brightwheel) will not send ANY attendance if one child has attendance outside their authorization dates (before or after). If this is the case, advise the Provider to create a private pay record for the expired subsidized children, or remove the Child ID from their Brightwheel profile.
    Note: Currently, Brightwheel does not return any errors related to child record issues.

Attendance will not transfer if the Child has no authorization or has expired authorization. For example, a Provider attempting to transfer attendance for midmonth expiration and the child continues to attend after the expiration date.

  • If there is no authorization or an expired authorization, select the No. Child Authorization Issues (JIRA) button and submit the form.
  • if there is authorization, proceed to Step 2.
Close

↘️ Step 2: Review the Children's information

  1. Child ID
    1. To find Child IDs, Support Agents must guide the Provider to go to Child > Search to find the child ID number. Do not use the CIN. (Some providers must have all children's IDs updated correctly for active utilization (Subsidized) before the information will upload to KinderConnect (Providers who use Sage, for example)
    2. If those children whose attendance is not transferring have valid authorizations, check that their DOB, Child Names, and child IDs match in both KC and in their Providers CCMS.
  2. First Name and Last name
    1. Ask them to verify the children's names
    2. After the provider confirms that the child records match but the Child Names are still NOT Confirming – support agents must contact the Team Lead to Check for extra spaces/variations in KinderTrack.
  • if resolved, end the call
  • if not resolved, proceed to step 3
Close

↘️ Step 3: Reestablish CCMS Connection Credentials

In some cases, CCMS connection needs to be reestablished to ensure successful upload. 

  1. Advise the provider to reselect the state agency and reenter the Provider ID and Group password in their CCMS.
  2. Attempt to upload attendance
  3. If the attendance does not transfer, Support agent must generate a new group password for the Provider. Press Save to save the changes.
  • if resolved, end the call
  • if not resolved, proceed to step 4
Close

↘️ Step 4: Verify if the Provider has multiple regions

  1. Ensure the API is enabled on all of the locations. If not, enable the API and attempt to transfer.
  2. Confirm with the provider if they use their CCMS account for multiple locations. (For example, a Provider has 2 centers under the same Brightwheel account.)If they do, ensure that they are using the correct id and password everytime they transfer attendance.
  3. Attempt to transfer
Close


Still not Uploading? 

Document the actions you have taken and escalate the call to the Back Office for further troubleshooting.

Last Update on: 05/15/2024
496.question: Was the Provider's issue resolved?

497.content:
Providers must always contact their CCMS vendors or check their CCMS vendor resources first to get help setting up a CCMS connection between their CCMS and Kinderconnect. 

If the Provider encounters an error after contacting their CCMS support or following their CCMS's resources, Support agents must follow the troubleshooting steps below:

↘️ Step 1: Validate CCMS Connection Credentials

In some cases, CCMS connection needs to be reestablished to ensure successful upload. 

  1. Advise the provider to reselect the state agency and reenter the Provider ID and Group password in their CCMS.
  2. Attempt to upload attendance
  3. If the attendance does not transfer, Support agent must generate a new group password for the Provider. Press Save to save the changes.
  • if resolved, end the call
  • if not resolved, proceed to step 2
Close

↘️ Step 2: Validate Children's Authorizations

  1. Review recently expired/activated child authorizations for the provider. 
  2. Go to the Provider > Cases. Check recent dates before AND after the dates the provider is trying to transmit. 
  3. Some APIs (e.g., Brightwheel) will not send ANY attendance if one child has attendance outside their authorization dates (before or after). If this is the case, advise the Provider to create a private pay record for the expired subsidized children, or remove the Child ID from their Brightwheel profile.
  • If there is no authorization or an expired authorization, select the No. Child Authorization Issues (JIRA) button and submit the form.
  • if there is authorization, proceed to Step 3.
Close

↘️ Step 3: Review the Children's information

  1. Child ID
    1. To find Child IDs, Support Agents must guide the Provider to go to Child > Search to find the child ID number. Do not use the CIN. (Some providers must have all children's IDs updated correctly for active utilization (Subsidized) before the information will upload to KinderConnect (Providers who use Sage, for example)
    2. If those children whose attendance is not transferring have valid authorizations, check that their DOB, Child Names, and child IDs match in both KC and in their Providers CCMS.
  2. First Name and Last name
    1. Ask them to verify the children's names
    2. If the Provider reports that Child Names are NOT Confirming – Contact Team Lead to Check for extra spaces/variations in KinderTrack.
Close

↘️ Step 4: Refer them to their CCMS resources

Support agents must provide the additional resources listed below for the final KinderBrifge (API) steps of these selected few CCMS vendors:


  • Smartcare: After the customer gathers the ID and group password from KinderSystem, they need to contact SmartCare's customer support and share the credentials provided. Once the information is shared, SmartCare will finalize the integration on their end. 
    • Contact - Phone: (844) 762-7837 Option 2, Email: Support@smartcare.com
  • Lillio (formerly known as HiMama): Himama additional API information: Himama KinderConnect Steps.pdf
  • Famly:  KinderConnect Integration | Famly Support | Famly Help Center
  • Brightwheel:  https://help.mybrightwheel.com/en/articles/7157785-integrated-attendance-with-kinderconnect 
  • Procare: 
    • Using Procare with KinderConnect
    • Troubleshooting KinderConnect
Close


Still not Resolved? 

Document the actions you have taken and escalate the call to the Back Office for further troubleshooting.

Last Update on: 05/15/2024
497.question: Was the Provider's issue resolved?

498.page_title: Provider | Unable to Update Existing Attendance
498.content:
Once attendance (complete or incomplete) has been transferred for a specific day into KinderConnect, that day cannot be updated. 

If the Provider transfers data from the CCMS to the KinderConnect detail screen, any day updated for attendance in the KinderConnect Attendance> Detail page will not allow any changes again with transfers. Only days that have not been filled from the transfer of the API data can be updated. 

It is important that the recorded attendance in the CCMS is correct before the Provider transfers the data to KinderConnect. 

Last updated on: 5/16/2024
498.question: Does the information above answers the Provider's question?

502.content:
KinderConnect is an online portal for sponsors to access attendance records, update contact information, and view subsidy-related documents. They can also download the KinderSmart Registration form needed to complete the registration.

Primary parents with an active authorized schedule only can self-register in KinderConnect. Other/additional/private pay sponsors cannot self-register in KinderConnect in Texas. 

Before assisting the Sponsor with registration, Support agents must verify the following information:

1. Sponsor must be a Primary Parent. Click on the panel below to view the steps for verifying this information

↘️ How to Verify if Sponsor is Primary Parent?

In KinderConnect, search for the Sponsor's information in Sponsor > Search. 
Look for the region the Sponsor is located in. 
In Kindertrack, select the district/region of the Sponsor from the selection below. 
Go to Family > Search.

Press Clear to search for the Sponsor account in distrcit/region selected. 
Select Parent then search for the Sponsor using their information in the available fields. 

Press Search.
The Search Results will be displayed. 

Once the correct account is located, click on the name of the Sponsor under the Parent Name column. 
When viewing the Family > Parent page, the Primary parent will be listed as having the Responsibility of Primary.
Close

2. The Sponsor must have the registration information available. 

  • Email Address
  • First Name
  • Last name

Note: DO NOT give any information to the caller. If they are unsure that they have the correct information, you may ask them to give that information to you and confirm if it's correct. Otherwise, refer them to contact the Board to obtain the necessary information.  

If the Sponsor meets the requirements above, proceed to registration steps.

Last Update On: 03/12/2024
502.question: Select the best option below:

1.button_text: Sponsor does not have complete registration information

2.button_text: Sponsor is not a Primary Parent

503.content:
Error 1: Unable to Match

This error appears when the information that the Sponsor entered on Registration in Step 2 does not match what's in the system.

 Support can verify the account information with the sponsor. 

Locate the Sponsor's information and ensure that all the registration information the sponsor is typing matches what's in the system.


Error 2: Cannot Save Operator Data

This error appears when the password entered does not match the system requirements.
 
Make sure that the Sponsor meets the password requirements.


Last Updated On: 03/12/2024
503.question: Was the Sponsor able to register successfully?

504.content:
Primary parents with an active authorized schedule can self-register in KinderConnect. 

 Guide the Sponsor to the correct KinderConnect URL:

https://childcare.twc.texas.gov/KinderConnect

Click Sign Up, to begin with the registration steps.

Select No and press Continue to proceed.
Enter the required registration information in the fields.

All registration information must match to KinderConnect.

Press Verify to continue. 


Once all information is entered from the previous step, it goes to the final step. 

Note: Username cannot contain special characters or spaces. Otherwise, whenever trying to reset the password the OTP will not be sent or received.

Enter all the required information. Take note of the password requirements to avoid errors. Password requirements:

  • Password length must be between 8 and 15 characters long.
  • Password must contain the required number of digits: 1
  • Password must contain the required number of lowercase and uppercase letters: Lowercase: 1 Uppercase: 1
    Password must contain the required number of special characters: 1.

The password will expire every 365 days.

Press Create Account.


If successful, the 'Account is Registered' message will appear
Press Return to Login Screen to proceed


Last Update On 03/12/2024
504.question: Was the sponsor able to register in KinderConnect successfully?

505.page_title: TX3C Availability Portal |  How to Confirm Submitted Application in KinderTrack
505.content:
Use the Intake > Search page to view applications.

Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
Open the Search page.
Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family.

Press Search to display the results.

Click the Detail link of the Child, Parent, or Family Application you want to view.

KinderTrack automatically redirects you to the Application page. The application information and documents are displayed. The information is divided in different sections: Household, Family, Parents, Children, Forms, and Messages.

Refer to the Family section to observe if the application was submitted. Shown in the Family Status field.

Last Updated On: 3/12/2024

506.page_title: TX3C Availability Portal |  How to View Messages in the Application on KinderTrack
506.content:
There may be communications from Case Workers in the Messages screen. These messages will be displayed on the Intake > Application screen. 

Note: this could include messages sent by the Provider, Case Manager, or Applicant and is dependent on what is captured in BridgeCare. 

The Messages will be displayed from newest to oldest and will include the Date, Sender, and Message. 

Read a Message

To review the full message, select the radio button of the desired message. 

The selected message will be highlighted in yellow and displayed in the Message Body section.

Last Updated On: 3/12/2024

507.page_title: TX3C Availability Portal |  How to View Applications in KinderTrack
507.content:
Use the Intake > Search page to view applications.

Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
Open the Search page.
Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family.

Press Search to display the results.

Click the Detail link of the Child, Parent, or Family Application you want to view.

KinderTrack automatically redirects you to the Application page. The application information and documents are displayed. The information is divided into different sections: Household, Family, Parents, Children, Forms, and Messages.

Last Updated On: 3/12/2024

508.page_title: Parent Central | View and Send Messages
508.content:
Applicants can receive messages from the Provider or Case Manager. They can then reply using the message field in Parent Central.

How applicants can view messages in Parent Central:

Log in to the Parent Central Portal
Click the hamburger button in the top-righthand corner

Select My Messages
Messages are displayed newest to oldest

Unread messages appear in blue

Click on a specific message to view the message details
When viewing a specific message, the applicant can reply by filling out the Message field at the bottom of the page

Once done creating their message press Send Message


Last Updated On: 03/12/2024
508.question: Does this answer all of the callers questions?

509.content:
Sponsors can view documents in their KinderConnect account. This includes notices and documents related to their subsidy application, recertification etc.

How Sponsors View Documents/Notices in KinderConnect

Once the Sponsor is signed to KinderConnect, go to Sponsor activity and select Documents. 
Select the date range during which the document is received. 

Press Search. 
If documents are received during the date range selected, the documents will be displayed under Search Results. 
Sponsors can edit, download, or delete the document selected.


Last Updated On: 03/12/2024

510.page_title: Parent Central | How to View and Respond to Messages
510.content: Parents/Sponsors can view and respond to messages in the Availablity Portal - Parent Central.

513.content:
Families can apply for subsidy using the Parent Central (Availability Portal). Support agents must guide the family through the following steps. 

Support may also provide the following URL Texas Child Care Connection for Families if needed.

To apply for a subsidy, the Family must follow these steps:

↘️ Step 1: Create an account in Parent Central

  • If the family has not created an account yet, guide them through creating one. Select Create an Account in the Parent Central.
  • If the family has already created an account, guide them through logging in. Select Login in the Parent Central  for assistance. 
  • To check if they created an account, select Verify Family's login in the Parent Central. 
Close

↘️ Step 2: Submit the TX3C Eligibility Screener Waitlist Application

  • This application is the first step in the process and will help determine if they meet the eligibility criteria to apply for the program.


To start the application for a subsidy with the State, the Parent/Guardian will need to fill out the TX3C Eligibility Screener & Waitlist Application form first.

Parents can complete the application on their own by filling out the required fields and pressing next. Support Agents can use the steps below to better assist if they get stuck or need further assistance. Parents can ask for help from a third party, for example (A case Worker) to fill out the application.

After completing this, inform them that they will receive an email stating" “Your application has been received and has been placed on the application waitlist.". Note: In case the parent wants to know how long the application will take, this depends on the board policy. 

Close

↘️ Step 3: TWC Board sends an invitation to submit the TX3C Standard Application

  • If the board accepts the application, the family will receive an invitation via email. The email should be sent from no-reply@childcare.texas.gov.
  • They can also check their messages in the Parent Central. To walk the family through checking the messages, select How to View Messages in Parent Central. 
  • To check the application status in Kindertrack, select View Submitted Application Status in KinderTrack. 

Note: The Support Agent can provide the application status but must NOT discuss the application and subsidy information with the Sponsor or the Provider. 

Close

↘️ Step 4: Submit the TX3C Standard Application

  • This application requires the family to provide additional information and complete the application process.
  • Parents can complete the application on their own by filling out the required fields and pressing next. Support Agents can use the steps below to better assist if they get stuck or need further assistance. Parents can ask for help from a third party, for example (a case worker) to complete the application.

  • Once submitted, the Family will need to wait for a response from the Board.

Close


Last Update On: 03/13/2024

514.page_title: TX3C Availability Portal | How to view Families and their Applications
514.content:
Admin Users use the Families page to view and modify some information about the family. 

Note: The application fields are currently in the development phase and are subject to change. 

To view information about Families and their applications, follow the steps below:

Login to the Admin Portal.
Navigate to the Families page under Applications.
This opens the Applications page.

There are four columns of information. 
Applicant: Name of the Applicant
Date: Date in which the application was submitted. If the application has not been started or has not been submitted it will show as Draft.
Status: Status of the application, will either be In Progress or Submitted.
Family ID: Shows the family ID.

To search for the application: 
a. Filter the application type you wish to view using the drop-down menu at the top of the page.
b. Enter the family name in the search box
Select the name of the applicant whose application you would like to view.
This opens the Application details for the selected family.

Note: If the Application shows Eligible in the TX3C Eligibility Screener & Waitlist App that means that the applicant met all the basic requirements needed.
Select Household at the top of the page to view the Family information.

Last Updated On: 3/13/2024

542.content:
Multiboard Providers

Providers in Texas who have multiple regions/boards under the exact location/address will be able to successfully transfer attendance from their CCMS to KinderConnect. 

Transferring Attendance for Subsidized Children 

  • Attendance must be transferred from CCMS to KinderConnect for children with active authorizations ONLY. 
  • Providers will NOT be able to transfer attendance to KinderConnect for the period children whose authorization is expired. 
  • Support agents must NOT advise creating a Private Pay record for children with an expired authorization.  Providers must wait for authorizations to show in KinderConnect before they transfer attendance.

Transferring Multiple Time Pairs

  • Providers can transfer attendance with multiple time pairs. 
  • This applies to providers signing the children in and out due to room change or children attending a before and after school program.
  • Note: Providers must ensure they have the correct attendance in their CCMS before transferring attendance. Attendance cannot be corrected in KinderConnect.

Attendance Log History

  • KinderConnect displays the user type who entered attendance in the Attendance Detail (History button). 

Last Updated On: 05/15/2024

551.content:
I. Approach

  • All users have real-time access to the online self-paced learning module to prepare for Hands-On-Training
  • TX3C Administrators focuses on local flexibility options
  • Workers level up each session
  • Workers gain access to UAT as a sandbox between sessions
  • Staggering allows workers to attend different functional areas
  • Weekly Office Hours allow workers to try things out before Q & A
  • No Drinking at the Firehose
